title: BIM As-Is: SCAN-2-BIM As It Should Be
summary: In São Paulo, Brazil’s largest city, modeling underground infrastructure involves complex technical and data challenges. This case study will present the first Brazilian project to apply SCAN-2-BIM with IFC 4.3 interoperability in an active metro tunnel—part of the Line 2-Green extension, more than 40 meters deep. Reality capture was done entirely with terrestrial laser scanning (TLS). The point cloud was semantically classified and feature-extracted in ReCap software. Modeling was automated using Civil 3D software with Dynamo and Subassembly Composer, while coordination and export were handled via Navisworks and IFC 4.3 from Civil 3D. The team overcame issues of data volume, accuracy, and integration. This pioneering project also defined asset-agnostic workflows for SCAN-2-BIM in linear infrastructure—scalable and reusable across future projects.

title: Connecting 3,000 People to Build Sustainable Data Center Infrastructure Across Europe with Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Imagine trying to connect a 3,000+ workforce on projects with a capacity of 300+ megawatts across Europe. Sisk has been using BIM and innovative technology for many years on complex data center projects. Our Data Centre Business Unit successfully captured two Autodesk Excellence Awards (2020 and 2022). We’ll take you on our  journey, and share the valuable lessons learned during each stage of the transition from BIM 360 software to Construction Cloud. We’ll demonstrate how Autodesk cloud platforms have enabled a holistic methodology that streamlines coordination, improves collaboration, drives , and contributes to the wider digital / artificial intelligence (AI) data center construction landscape. Providing authentic content, we will give real-life examples from live construction projects where the use of Autodesk tools has resulted in a 50% efficiency increase in the management processes as compared to traditional methods, and we’ll cover how we ultimately design digitally and deliver physically using Construction Cloud.

title: Facing the Future: Autodesk Construction Cloud and ISO 19650 Challenges in the United States
summary: What do you do when a US-based client unexpectedly asks for ISO 19650 compliance and expects it to be delivered through Construction Cloud? This session will share where to start, how to interpret the standard in a US context, and how to manage the transition. Our practical insights, workflow strategies, and lessons learned will help prepare you for a rare but potentially growing request in the American engineering landscape.

title: Bringing Monsters to Life in Universal’s Dark Universe: Workflows for Cross-Discipline Collaboration
summary: This case study will follow the creation of the attraction Monsters Unchained: The Frankenstein Experiment for the new theme park Universal Epic Universe. It will illustrate how Universal Creative, as both designer and owner, is using the full range of Autodesk software and construction cloud suite to collaborate between teams and bring to life groundbreaking attractions. Creating innovative theme park attractions necessitates the blending of disciplines. Attraction designers incorporate mechanical system animation with digital media, lighting, and visual effects using 3ds Max software—while architects and engineers design and document facility systems in Revit software to meet operational needs. During ride and show manufacturing and general construction, teams constantly monitor installation quality with reality capture methods like LiDAR using ReCap and Navisworks software, validating real-world conditions against the creative intent models and federated BIM, thereby completing the project lifecycle.

title: Model Conditioning in Autodesk BIM Collaborate? When Did That Happen!?
summary: is NOT just a clash tool anymore! Discover the rapidly expanding model conditioning feature set in the Construction Cloud  API, now a full-data workbench for reviewing aggregate model data across formats like RVT, IFC, DWG™, and anything Docs software can support. This session will guide you through creating object table configurations to restructure and pivot model properties, enabling rapid identification of key elements during review sessions. Learn how to export data for further analysis and visualization in tools like Microsoft Excel and Power BI. Additionally, get a sneak peek at the upcoming Custom Properties feature, built on the AEC Data Model. This session is perfect for BIM managers, BIM coordinators, engineers, and designers who are existing users of , Navisworks, and Assemble. Join us to enhance your model review process and elevate your data analysis capabilities!

title: When Augmenta’s AI Joins the Project Team: Lessons Learned from Real-World AEC to Construction with AI Workflows
summary: In this session, we’ll showcase how electrical firms are using the Augmenta Construction Platform (ACP) to create a significant impact on their projects. Through a real-world case study, we’ll explore the remarkable results achieved by a first-time ACP user and discuss how their workflows will continue to evolve as the platform develops. Discover how ACP is enabling firms to streamline workflows by comparing multiple conduit routes simultaneously, making better, faster decisions, and ultimately reducing human error. We’ll also dive into how ACP enriches BIM data, leading to more-accurate and efficient fabrication. This session will highlight the tangible benefits of ACP, demonstrating that the right artificial intelligence (AI) platform can deliver big results—whether through time savings, enhanced accuracy, or improved decision making. Don’t miss this opportunity to see how the future of fabrication and BIM is unfolding with ACP!

title: For Good Measure –  Tackling Carbon Assessments in AEC
summary:
We’ve all heard the stats – the Buildings Sector accounts for over 40% of GHG emissions and construction and demolition waste is a growing problem. Join us for an insightful session to hear how a handful of leading companies teamed up to figure out how to improve efficiency, be more transparent and drive innovative strategies to help drive decarbonization of the construction sector.
 
Kicking off at London Climate Action Week just 3-months ago, Autodesk and the World Business Council for Sustainable Development convened dozens of architecture, engineering, and construction companies to initiate a Construction Working Group brainstorm resulting in a just kicked-off project focused on the handover process of carbon data from BIM workflows to construction execution. Inspired by a similar initiative focused on the design phase with A & E companies presented at AU and COP29 last year; the goal of this group is to complement that research, focus on the implementation of decarbonization workflows, glean industry insights, and propose best practices through the lens of Construction.

title: From Sketch to Specs: Seamless Rhino-to-Revit Workflow for Landscape and Master Planning
summary: Imagine a design process where creative exploration meets technical precision, seamlessly blending Rhino’s fluid conceptualization with Revit’s detailed documentation. In this session, we will explore a dynamic, cross-platform workflow that transforms 2D sketches and conceptual master plans into data-rich, buildable models—while preserving design intent and enhancing efficiency. Discover how the Environment plugin for Revit empowers landscape architects and urban designers to push creative boundaries, iterate efficiently, and bridge the gap between design and documentation with accuracy. This session will highlight a methodical yet flexible approach that minimizes errors, fosters collaboration, and streamlines project execution—illustrated through real-world applications that demonstrate design optimization and efficient delivery.

title: Revit to Indoors: A Management Journey at Denver International Airport
summary: The Denver International Airport (DEN) is widely recognized for its leadership in BIM. As part of a recent modernization initiative, DEN took a major leap forward by extending that BIM vision into geographic information system (GIS) technology—transforming how spaces inside the airport are mapped, managed, and maintained. In this session, you’ll learn how digital facilities and infrastructure (DFI) and GIS collaborated to build an 18-million-square-foot ArcGIS Indoors database spanning the entire campus using detailed Revit models. More than 7,000 rooms in this space management Digital Workplace are now spatially enabled and linked to identifiers used in asset and facilities systems. We’ll share key milestones from our 10-year  and cover how recent breakthroughs connected Revit and ArcGIS workflows. From exporting BIM to ArcGIS Indoors to now strategizing about how to push data back to Revit, DEN is building a truly bidirectional BIM-GIS environment—bringing spatial intelligence to new disciplines and teams across the airport.

title: Digital-First Stadiums: Paperless BIM and Twin-Enabled Operations
summary: How do the world’s newest mega-stadiums achieve a seamless hand-off from design to day-to-day operations—without a single roll of paper? Join owners and contractors of Qatar’s Lusail Stadium, the Jeddah Central Development Company (JCDC) waterfront arena, and other landmark venues as they reveal hard-won lessons from projects where BIM was embedded from day one. Moderated by Pinnacle Infotech—the prime BIM consultant on each build—this panel dissects model-centric collaboration, laser-scanning quality control, supplier integration, and the creation of live Digital Workplaces that facility teams actually use. Walk away ready to replicate the workflows, contracts, and tech stack that kept these billion-dollar facilities on spec and future-proof.

title: Building the Foundation for Asset Intelligence Through the Connected Data Environment
summary: Your data is rich with insights—but it takes cross-discipline collaboration to see the entire picture. In this session with Autodesk and the Montana Department of Transportation (MDT), we’ll discuss the value of data integration at the system level bringing together design, construction, and asset management. Autodesk and MDT are working collaboratively with Esri, Trimble, and Infotech to develop a connected data environment using workflows and technology. In this session, you’ll learn how MDT is using AASHTOWare Project, Civil 3D software, Trimble Business Center, and Esri technology to develop a lifecycle  approach for civil infrastructure projects.

title: Built for the Future: AI, Robots, and Green Tech Revolutionizing the Built World in 2025
summary: In 2025, technology trends in design, construction, and facilities management are converging around artificial intelligence (AI), automation, and —with a focus on enhancing efficiency, safety, and user experience. Key areas include the integration of AI in design, 3D printing and additive manufacturing, drones, robotics, wearable technology, and  initiatives. This session will bring together the leaders in design construction and facility management to discuss the current trends and look to the future of technology in 2026.

title: Consuming a Connected Construction Lifecycle – One Byte at a Time
summary: From Airports, Mission Critical Infrastructure, Healthcare, Hospitality, and Higher Education, we as builders are faced with a multitude of data inputs and variables. Come explore a story about enabling seamless collaboration, building trust and connections, and how to remain adaptable and agile in the world of construction technology and implementing best practices through the use of near real time data integration for decision making. This session outlines examples of those best practices deployed by Hensel Phelps through People, Processes, Technology, and Partnerships while focusing on the implementation of the Autodesk ecosystem along with their industry partners from software and hardware too.

title: WSP Canada's Journey to Success Using BIM for Bridges
summary: As infrastructure projects become increasingly complex, the adoption of BIM for bridge design and construction has become essential. This session will provide a deep dive into our organization’s BIM journey, showcasing how we transitioned from traditional design workflows to an integrated digital approach. We’ll discuss the challenges we faced, the solutions we implemented, and the innovations we developed to optimize collaboration, accuracy, and efficiency in bridge modeling. Demonstrating the evolution of our methodology, we’ll highlight our progression from manual modeling to parametric workflows using Civil 3D, Revit, and Dynamo—and ultimately to advanced modeling with Revit, including in-house developed add-ins, Dynamo, and SOFiSTiK Bridge and Infrastructure Modeler. You’ll gain valuable insights into best practices, software interoperability, and the future of BIM on infrastructure projects.

title: Revit to Reality: Unlocking Valuable Model Data with the AEC Data Model API and AI
summary: Discover how to use the AEC Data Model API to access and use your Revit model data more effectively. Learn how this cloud-based API lets you extract precise information from Revit models. Understand how to connect to the AEC Data Model API with GraphQL, enabling stakeholders across your organization to interact with model data without opening Revit. This session will walk you through building a complete application that accesses Revit data through the cloud API, processes it with artificial intelligence (AI) algorithms to identify optimization opportunities, and creates actionable dashboards. You'll learn practical implementation techniques for AI-enabled tools that empower team members across disciplines to interrogate model data through intuitive interfaces. The session will cover GraphQL query structure, authentication, data processing, and modern AI integration approaches that transform technical complexity into accessible insights.

title: Constructing with Confidence: The Autodesk Construction Cloud Role in Delivering 105 Victoria Street
summary: This session will explore how Construction Cloud is being used as a transformative tool on the 105 Victoria Street project—one of the first large-scale UK projects to fully embrace Construction Cloud. The content will focus on real-world applications, such as tracking mega planks and steelwork from off-site production through to installation, monitoring cladding in 3D, and enhancing quality control with NCRs and visual data. We will also highlight how Skanska uses Construction Cloud in combination with Power BI dashboards to provide project managers with real-time insights, driving accountability, improving efficiency, and enabling data-driven decision making.

title: Full Automation, Integration, & Customization in Revit Hanger Design: Speed, Coordination, and Efficiency
summary: Hanger design in BIM projects is often time-consuming and prone to human error. Traditional manual methods can lead to inefficiencies, coordination issues, and increased workload. This session will introduce an innovative Revit add-in that automates the hanger placement process. The tool identifies relevant elements in the model, generates a structured list, and automatically determines optimal hanger locations based on predefined rules. It also performs clash detection to resolve coordination issues, and it provides detailed reports. By eliminating manual intervention, this solution enables up to 95% time savings, while ensuring accuracy, efficiency, and seamless project execution. Participants will gain insights into optimizing hanger workflows in Revit to enhance project speed, coordination, and quality.

title: Autodesk Construction Cloud Road Map: Model Management
summary: The life of a model begins in design, or even in early concept stages. But it extends throughout the project lifecycle. It takes on new shapes and functions, enriched as it progresses from one team to the next. And it serves as a living representation of the project long after handover. Join us as we discuss ways to break traditional silos between teams and use Autodesk’s design and construction solutions to author, prepare, and use models. This interactive workshop, presented by our Product Development team, will focus on what’s to come in Construction Cloud and beyond.

title: From Silos to Synergy: Aligning Project Delivery Across Three Firms
summary: Aligning  across three engineering firms—spanning 5,000+ staff and major sectors like transportation, water, and buildings—is no small feat. This session will share how we’ve built a unified approach to , balancing consistency with flexibility. We’ll explore how governance, culture, and shared frameworks are helping us deliver at scale—while adapting to project and sector-specific needs. A key enabler has been our partnership with Autodesk, who supported us in adopting tools like Construction Cloud into our standard workflows. From implementation to integration, Construction Cloud is helping us streamline collaboration, enhance data continuity, and improve design coordination. If you’re leading digital strategy across a complex organization—or trying to get teams on the same page—this session will offer practical insights, tested methods, and honest lessons learned.

title: From Data to Decisions: Driving Project Certainty in Megaprojects with Power BI and Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Discover how Exyte, a leader in delivering high-tech facilities, manages multidisciplinary megaprojects. In these projects, thousands of details, conflicts, and decisions constantly compete for attention, making it difficult to focus on what really matters. Using a data-driven approach powered by Construction Cloud and Power BI, we’ve improved project certainty, making it easier to manage complexity effectively. In this session, we’ll share how we shifted from reactive problem-solving to proactive, insight-driven project management. By seamlessly consolidating data from Revit, Navisworks, Construction Cloud, Work Plans, and other external sources, we've developed powerful dashboards that do more than report. They actively guide decisions, prioritize tasks, and give real-time project insights. With this approach, we can focus on key conflicts, track model health, monitor issues across packages, and give senior management a clear and reliable view of project progress. This isn't just better reporting—it’s a smarter way to build.

title: How AI, BIM, and Digital Prototypings Are Powering the Future of AECO
summary: BIM is no longer just for design—and “Digital Workplace” is more than a buzzword. Digital Workplaces are the connective tissue of a new AECO era where every stage—from early design models to long-term operations—runs on actionable integrated data. In this future-trends theater talk, we’ll explore how BIM and Digital Workplaces are evolving from static handover artifacts to dynamic intelligent systems that extend the life and value of buildings long after construction. Drawing from macro technological, economic, and workplace trends—including recent federal mandates and technological advancements—we’ll examine how artificial intelligence (AI), occupancy behavior, and experiential design are converging to reshape how the built environment is created, constructed, and continuously optimized.

title: Intro to Using BIM and Digital Prototypings
summary: This will be an introduction to how MEP design consultants can contribute to Digital Workplace workflows in building projects. We’ll highlight lessons learned and best practices for managing and exchanging data throughout the project lifecycle using BIM tools.

title: Streamlining Design-to-Configuration: Your Rules in Autodesk Forma and Revit Via Dynamo
summary: This class will teach you how to automate decision making by applying predefined business logic and rules to data inside Dynamo software. We’ll demonstrate how to push and pull this data into Forma and Revit software to achieve predictable design outcomes that meet your BIM and virtual design and construction (VDC) requirements. Understand how to structure your logic to drive step-by-step configuration processes, delivering building models that precisely match your company’s desired outputs. This class will provide tangible solutions, whether the goal is to rapidly iterate through design options in Forma based on product constraints or to automatically generate precise geometry for construction drawings and fabrication models in Revit based on predefined company standards. By the end of this class, you’ll be equipped with the foundational knowledge and practical insights to begin implementing logic-driven design automation within your own organizations and see how building configuration is possible.

title: From Site Planning to BIM with AI: Accelerating Early-Stage Design with Finch and Autodesk Forma
summary: This session will introduce a modern, early-stage, design workflow powered by artificial intelligence (AI), connecting Forma, Finch, and Revit software. Learn how site data and massing created in Forma can be used directly in Finch to generate compliant floor plans with AI. As the design evolves, Finch automatically builds a Revit-native model using families and model groups, ready for further development and documentation. We’ll showcase a success story from one of our customers (TBA) highlighting how this workflow reduces manual work, supports more-data-driven decisions, and shortens the path from concept to BIM. Whether you’re an architect working in early-stage design or managing BIM execution, this session will provide a clear, practical view of what a connected workflow looks like and how it can accelerate project delivery.

title: Constructing Tomorrow: Scaling Up with Industrialized Construction—More Bang for Your Build!
summary: “Industrialized construction” refers to the transformation of traditional construction methods through  techniques, prefabrication, and digital technologies. This approach aims to enhance efficiency, scalability, and  in the construction industry. By using digital technologies—including BIM, MID (manufacturing informed design), production design, automation, and modular construction—industrialized construction streamlines the design-to-construction process, reducing waste, costs, and project timelines. In this session, we’ll explore workflows that seamlessly integrate design, engineering, manufacturing, and construction, fostering collaboration and innovation. All of these workflows for industrialized construction empower stakeholders to build smarter, greener, and more resilient structures, meeting the demands of modern urbanization and environmental challenges.

title: An Insight into Mott MacDonald's Partnership with Autodesk’s Sustainable Design Data API and AEC Data Model for Carbon Analysis
summary: Discover how Mott MacDonald used Autodesk’s  Data API to augment the firm’s own internally developed low-carbon product, opening pathways to additional carbon data sets and widening its appeal to clients existing and new. By incorporating the  Data API, Mott MacDonald has been able to make these data sets consistently available across an increased number of platforms, allowing for new carbon insights in products such as Revit Insight and Takeoff software. In addition, the use of the AEC Data Model has enabled a critical link between design data and carbon data, helping to drive more-sustainable design. In this session, we will share key technical lessons learned through our partnership with Autodesk, and detail how we overcame some of the challenges we encountered.

title: Informed Design Hands-On Lab: Experience the Informed Design Workflow for Architects and Building Product Manufacturers
summary: Repurposing manufacturing content for BIM presents unique challenges. The Informed Design API represents a revolutionary new approach. Get hands-on experience with Informed Design in this lab-style class and test the workflow for yourself. We'll learn how Revit users can discover, configure, and place native Revit families (RFA) into Revit projects that originated in Inventor manufacturing software. We’ll learn how manufacturers of productized building components can publish designs with reduced detail for design in Revit. We’ll learn how to assess a Revit project for Informed Design components and automatically generate manufacturing outputs such as shop drawings and bills of materials (BOMs) for each variant. We'll learn how manufacturers can securely and with controlled permissions publish content to Informed Design via Docs software, and how revisions can be consumed in Revit. Join us to discover, consider, and learn!

title: DLF’s Journey Toward Smarter, Faster, Sharper Construction Delivery Across a 50-Million-Square-Foot Portfolio
summary: Discover how DLF’s shift from static documents to real-time data has enabled faster decisions, tighter coordination, and smarter outcomes—setting a new benchmark for insight-led, sustainable project delivery in India. DLF is redefining construction delivery across a portfolio spanning more than 50 million square feet through one of the most significant s in the history of real estate in the Indian subcontinent. Powered by Construction Cloud, DLF has connected the dots between design, execution, and intelligence by integrating 3D BIM coordination, real-time Power BI dashboards, and live APIs. This move toward paperless project sites has not only driven operational efficiency, but also contributed to a meaningful reduction in the company’s carbon footprint.

title: Elevate your Revit stairs to the next level
summary: Are you ready to unleash the full potential of Revit stairs? Stairs often receive a bad rap, but they are full of exciting possibilities! This hands-on lab will take you on a journey through the Revit stair toolset, where you'll learn to craft realistic, multi-story stair towers with confidence. We'll leverage the latest Revit features and explore how to create custom stair and railing types that not only meet building codes but also match industry standards and best practices. We’ll consider the entire package as we create the stairs, their railings and seamless landings. The result will be optimized to deliver on what is required for effective construction documents. If you want to raise your stair game to the next level, this is the lab for you!

title: Automated Clash Resolution: Zone-Based Service Allocation and Smart Clash Alerts with Dynamo and AI
summary: What if your MEP model could think ahead—automatically organize itself and warn you of where problems are likely to happen? In this session, you’ll discover a smart, automated approach to MEP coordination using Dynamo and rule-based artificial intelligence (AI) logic. Simply enter the available floor-to-slab height, and the system allocates dedicated zones for HVAC, plumbing, and electrical services. Once zones are defined, services are automatically repositioned into their assigned spaces. After this, the system intelligently flags potential clash zones where conflicts might still arise—even before you run clash detection. Based on real workflows used in one of Saudi Arabia’s largest commercial projects, this session will deliver a game-changing method to reduce rework, speed up coordination, and achieve next-level automation in Revit software.

title: Bridging the Future: Using LiDAR, Photogrammetry, and Scan-to-BIM Technology for Powerful Bridge Analysis
summary: Don't have plans or any design details for a given bridge? Join us for an insightful discussion on how Parsons and Autodesk have teamed up to use high-resolution photogrammetry coupled with Autodesk’s newest Reality Capture capabilities to streamline the creation of existing-condition intelligent models for downstream bridge design and analysis. This session will showcase the innovative collaboration between industry leaders and the transformative impact that advanced technology is having on bridge engineering.

title: The Digital Track Switch: Driving Connected Cloud Adoption Without Breaking Complex Rail Infrastructure Project Delivery
summary: in infrastructure is no longer optional, but implementing cloud-based workflows mid-project—especially in complex rail infrastructure delivery—comes with unique challenges. In this session, we’ll explore SYSTRA’s behind-the-scenes journey of adopting Construction Cloud during an active rail infrastructure project. From stakeholder pushback and data silos to integration hurdles, we faced the real-world challenges of shifting to a connected, cloud-first delivery model without stopping the train. This session will focus on strategic decisions, lessons learned, and best practices for rolling out Construction Cloud and connected digital workflows mid-project, and integrating SYSTRA’s in-house tools—without compromising productivity or trust. Whether you’re leading a digital strategy for civil infrastructure or are mid-rollout on a large-scale rail project, you’ll leave with a clearer view of how to lead change and deliver value through cloud-connected collaboration.

title: Enterprise-Wide Access to Project Data: An Autodesk Construction Cloud and Esri ArcGIS GeoBIM Success Story
summary: Parsons, Autodesk, and Esri partnered to solve a massive challenge: how to organize, index, and expose hundreds of infrastructure projects—encompassing hundreds of thousands of CAD and BIM files—in a single, searchable, map-centered interface. This session will present a real-world case study of how the Parsons, Esri, and Autodesk Consulting teams used ArcGIS GeoBIM and Autodesk Platform Services to create an automated and scalable application that connects project locations with associated design documents, enabling users to search, view, and explore design data spatially. Learn how this solution streamlined access to critical files, broke down data silos, and unlocked new efficiencies across Parsons’ enterprise. Whether you're facing legacy data sprawl or planning your own GIS-BIM integration, this session will offer valuable insights and lessons learned.

title: Multi-Trade Layout Is The Missing Workflow That Drives VDC ROI
summary: In this session, you’ll hear from Skanska about their journey to implement multi-trade layout, and from Dusty Robotics, inventors of the automated layout technology that the process relies on. Learn about the best practices, hard lessons, and paradigm shifts that have led builders to success with multi-trade layout.

title: From Field Data to Smart Decisions: Real-Time Insights with Autodesk Build and Insight Builder in Civil Infrastructure Projects
summary: In complex civil infrastructure projects—such as highways, bridges, and utilities—the ability to turn field data into actionable insights is essential for performance, safety, and cost control. This session will show how MRS Logística used Build software and Insight Builder to convert raw field inputs into real-time analytics, enabling smarter and faster decisions across project lifecycles. By structuring data from Issues, RFIs, Checklists, and Forms, MRS created dynamic dashboards that track physical progress, monitor compliance, and surface predictive alerts before risks escalate. These insights connected field operations with executive decision making, providing transparency over construction quality, schedule health, and contract performance. You’ll learn how to structure data flows from the field, configure Insight Builder rules, and deploy scalable dashboards that support real-time monitoring, predictive insights, and strategic oversight in civil infrastructure delivery.

title: From Concept to Compliance: Forma’s Predictive Analytics and Insights’ Data-Driven Validation
summary:
Sustainable design starts with bold ideas—but survives on hard data. In this session, discover how to bridge Forma’s early-stage predictive analytics with Insights’ compliance calculations. Start with Forma’s early-stage modeling to forecast embodied carbon, then transition to Insights’ material databases to benchmark against global standards. Learn how Autodesk’s native integrations automate data continuity between tools, ensuring designs evolve from predictive insights to auditable outcomes. 
Walk away with strategies to eliminate greenwashing, client-ready ESG frameworks, and a workflow to align  ambitions with real-world compliance—all without compromising design intent.

title: From Reality Capture to Modeling: Integrating ReCap Meshes for Enhanced Efficiency in Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: In today’s fast-paced construction industry, bridging the gap between real-world conditions and digital-project environments is key to achieving accuracy, minimizing errors, and streamlining project delivery. Reality capture technologies, such as laser scanning, allow teams to document site conditions with precision. However, turning that raw data into actionable models and coordinating them across disciplines can be a challenge without the right tools and workflow. This lab will help you to set up a practical workflow that integrates ReCap Pro 2026, Revit, and the  module in Construction Cloud to enable efficient scan-to-BIM and  processes. It will demonstrate how point cloud data can be used not just for modeling, but also for coordination and clash detection, using mesh representations and cloud collaboration.

title: Connected Coordination: Supercharging BIM with Autodesk Construction Cloud and Navisworks
summary: Navisworks software has established itself as the industry standard for coordinating building systems with digital models. Now, the Construction Cloud module offers tools that complement Navisworks or function as stand-alone solutions. Traditional coordination challenges—exchanging models via file sharing, manually compiling updates, and distributing clash reports without accountability tracking—are eliminated. The Construction Cloud common data environment streamlines model updates, while its Issues feature enables assignment and tracking of coordination responsibilities. This session will demonstrate how to create a connected coordination workflow by combining the Construction Cloud Files, Issues, and Reports with Navisworks software's customizable search sets and clash detection. Learn implementation strategies that transform coordination from siloed activities into integrated, collaborative workflows.

title: Model Your Assets Off: Using Autodesk Build to Monitor Construction Progress Digitally and Automate Quantity Tracking
summary: BIM has transformed construction by creating a project database that allows teams to make real-time, data-driven decisions. By integrating our intelligent model with the Build Assets feature, our team was able to develop an efficient digital workflow that has tracked progress from design to installation for civil and structural construction, including various scopes such as underground utility installation and structural foundations. This session will explore how to use the Build Assets feature to develop a digital progress model from either a 3D model or a 2D plan sheet, and how to automatically extract quantities from it that can be used for financial forecasting, project scheduling, and progress billing. We’ll also discuss how we’ve integrated the Asset model into a Power BI dashboard that gives visibility to all levels—from the on-site field team up to senior management. Are you ready to model your Assets off?

title: Design, Build, Experience: Immersive Digital Workplaces (REPEAT)
summary:
Imagine walking a design site before it’s ever built, with grading, buildings, and utilities unfolding around you in full context. Immersive Digital Workplaces make that possible, turning project models into shared experiences that improve communication and bring teams into alignment before construction begins.

 

In this fast-paced, high-level session, three voices from civil design, immersive technology, and construction will share insights from the field. Rather than a technical deep dive, this session offers a big-picture look at how immersive Digital Workplaces are bridging disciplines, reducing errors, and clarifying complex data throughout the project lifecycle.

 

When stakeholders can visualize a design in its environment, they are empowered to make faster, more confident decisions. Join us to explore how immersive workflows support better outcomes from concept through construction.

title: Automating a Complex Revit Bridge Model with Grasshopper, Dynamo, and Informed Design
summary: This session will outline a workflow for creating a Revit model of a steel composite cable stay bridge by using a combo of Grasshopper, Dynamo, and Informed Design for Inventor software. Modeling a bridge structure poses challenges due to its complex geometry, which adheres to a vertical, horizontal, and super-elevated roadway profile. Consequently, the steel girders, beams, and connection details must align with this 3D roadway profile, complicating the creation and placement of Revit families. For this challenge, COWI used Grasshopper and Dynamo to automate the creation of steel geometry, parameters, and insertion points, ensuring accurate orientation for family placement. Additionally, Informed Design was used to transform various iterations of intricate steel connections into families, which were then positioned using a Dynamo workflow. The integration of visual programming and Informed Design has been vital in efficiently producing complex bridge structures with a focus on automation.

title: Revolutionizing Project Management: How India’s Largest EPC Uses 5D BIM Dashboards and ACC for Connected Workflows
summary: This case study highlights the deployment of a 5D BIM Power BI dashboard on an airport project valued at $420 million. Developed by L&T Construction—India’s largest engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) firm—the dashboard integrated Revit software and Construction Cloud to streamline progress monitoring and billing. Tackling key challenges like complex stakeholder coordination and data fragmentation, the solution improved transparency, reduced manual errors, and sped up decision making. The integration of models, documents, and workflows in the cloud created a synchronized construction environment, enhancing cost control and governance. This digital-first approach minimized paper-based processes and resource redundancies, driving operational . This case underscores the transformative power of connected construction, demonstrating how cloud-based platforms and BIM can foster efficiency, accountability, and environmental responsibility at scale.

title: Seeing Inside Walls: Using AI to Extend Scan-to-BIM for Material Circularity
summary: Buildings contribute to more than 40% of global carbon emissions, and one key scalable solution is to reuse and upgrade existing buildings and materials instead of constructing new ones. This session showcases how Autodesk Research is exploring artificial intelligence (AI) for net-zero buildings in the context of existing building projects. The team is exploring two AI-driven prototypes: one is about assessing a building’s existing conditions with limited and multimodal data. This enables AECO professionals to "see inside walls"—similarly to an “x-ray view”—and cataloging hidden materials including their potential for reusability without destructive testing. The second AI-driven prototype involves creating new low-carbon assemblies using repurposed materials. With this workflow users can specify high-level goals like “reuse materials”, “reduce carbon” and “minimize cost” and interactively explore many different options. The presentation highlights potential integration opportunities with relevant Autodesk platform features, demonstrating how designers, contractors, and building owners can make informed decisions that significantly minimize carbon footprint while creating new economic value from existing assets.

title: Enabling Industrialized Construction with the Informed Design API
summary: In this session, we’ll cover the new Informed Design API. Informed Design is an Autodesk offering aimed at connecting products created in Inventor or Autodesk Fusion software with project data in Revit software. This will improve project outcomes and increase productivity by bringing together the capabilities of our manufacturing software with our architecture, engineering, and construction software. The class will start with an overview of Informed Design and how the API can be used to extend and customize the offering. We’ll cover product creation in Inventor and Fusion. And we’ll look at how to create good BIM content by generating well-formed Revit families for use in a Revit project. Then we’ll show how to create outputs from a Revit project at scale. We’ll follow up with an overview of specific examples of how our customers and partners are using the API, followed by an example of how to use the API.

title: Stop Taking Photos on Site! Integrate Mobile 3D Capture and 3D Gaussian Splatting in Civil Infrastructure Management Instead
summary: Have you ever taken a photo of something critical during a site visit only to forget where it was or find it lacking context when reviewing it later? The increasing accessibility of advanced reality capture devices—such as photogrammetry and SLAM LiDAR technology—offers an unprecedented opportunity for AECO professionals to accurately capture detailed and extensive site details. Integrating these technologies into your workflows can dramatically enhance documentation at various construction stages, improve coordination among stakeholders, and provide timely and transparent as-built information. This case study will demonstrate how to effectively use these advanced technologies (SLAM point clouds and 3D gaussian splatting) to enrich civil infrastructure workflows with Autodesk tools like Civil 3D, ReCap, InfraWorks, Revit, and Construction Cloud.

title: Driving Project Success: How Bristol-Myers Squibb, Windover Construction, and Thornton Tomasetti Innovate to Deliver Certainty
summary: Delivering today’s high-performance projects requires more than a great design—it requires data-driven decision making and integrated collaboration from day one. In this panel, leaders from Bristol-Myers Squibb (owner), Windover Construction (construction manager), and Thornton Tomasetti (design engineer) will share how aligning goals and innovative solutions early unlocks certainty of outcomes across design, construction, and operations. This session will provide a complete 360-degree view into how owner, contract manager, and design teams collaborate to solve challenges, foster innovation, and deliver successful projects in highly technical and regulated environments. Through real-life case studies—including life sciences, manufacturing, residential, and institutional projects—you’ll learn how BIM workflows, BIM-MEP coordination, artificial intelligence (AI), Digital Workplaces, and constructability strategies drive efficiency, improve compliance, and create lasting value from planning through project delivery.

title: Revolutionizing Water Infrastructure Projects: BIM Collaborative Workflow with Reality Capture and ACC
summary: This case study will explore the transformative impact of integrating Autodesk products into water infrastructure projects. We’ll highlight how operational efficiency is enhanced, collaboration is streamlined, quality control is maintained, and  is facilitated throughout the project lifecycle. By using Construction Cloud (Docs, Build, AutoCAD Plant 3D, Revit, Navisworks, and ReCap software), the case study will demonstrate practical applications in three pivotal phases: design, construction, and operations and maintenance (O&M). Through two real-world examples, you’ll gain insights into how these tools work together to optimize project outcomes and ensure seamless integration across different stages.

title: From Zero to Build-Ready: How We Automated Project Setup with Autodesk Construction Cloud Templates
summary: One click of “Create Project” in Construction Cloud, and, like magic, folders auto-populate, design workflows activate, and dashboards light up—all before you can even finish brewing your coffee. Join us to unpack how our virtual design and construction (VDC) and design teams built an Construction Cloud template that cuts setup from weeks to hours. Learn how we preconfigured  rules (clash detection on the cloud!), embedded structured folders, and auto-populated Assets settings. We’ll demo how designers now sync Revit models to Construction Cloud sheets with one click, while on-site teams track steel installations via prebuilt Assets dashboards with no Python PhD required. “This way, teams can focus on the important aspects of designing,” says our lead design manager. Discover how Construction Cloud templates auto-invite team members, assign permissions, and deploy build settings, not admin work. This is perfect for general contractors, VDC pros, and design managers expecting to leave with actionable steps to replicate our framework.

title: From CAD to Conversation: Building Advanced Gen AI Chatbots for Autodesk Platform Services
summary: Through live demonstrations, we’ll showcase real-world applications where artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots intelligently analyze design data, automate routine queries, and provide intuitive natural-language interfaces to technical information. In this presentation, we’ll explore the process of building advanced custom AI chatbots for interacting with design data. This talk will demonstrate streamlining workflows, saving individuals hours through generative AI’s efficient processing of complex design data. We’ll begin by showing methods for pulling data into Amazon Bedrock and using the latest foundational models to use your data in new and fascinating ways. We’ll review the Autodesk Platform Services APIs for access data, and how to use prompt engineering, agent-based architectures, and retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) to solve industry problems. We’ll showcase live demos of AI-powered chatbots that can query and analyze design data, demonstrating real-world applications and best practices.

title: Streamlining Asset Management and Progress Tracking with Autodesk Build and GAMMA AR
summary: Integrating Build software with GAMMA AR has significantly enhanced project traceability, improving the accuracy and credibility of progress tracking. This integration supports asset management across the entire project lifecycle, from delivery to handover. It also strengthens collaboration by connecting stakeholders through digital workflows, reducing reliance on paper, and lowering the project’s carbon footprint. GAMMA AR brings added value to BIM by enabling real-time validation of on-site work, assigning issues to responsible parties, and instantly tracking installation progress. This strategy not only boosts efficiency and productivity, but it’s also expected to reduce documentation workflow duration by up to 25%, marking a key step toward  in construction. Since all construction documents are stored, linked, referenced, and visualized to all assets, facility manager mobilization time may be significantly reduced by 50%.

title: Development of Object Library and CDE Infrastructure with ACC for the New Era of Tokaido Shinkansen Maintenance Management
summary: The Tokaido Shinkansen high-speed Japanese rail line excels globally in safety, punctuality, and frequency. This project aims to transform infrastructure maintenance using BIM. Although Japan rail owners are adopting BIM, efforts remain siloed across teams and lack integrated optimization. Rail maintenance requires ongoing inspection, diagnosis, action, and documentation. Seamless data handover is essential to reducing lifecycle costs, but information often stays locked in noninteroperable systems. JR Central addressed this by piloting a common data environment and object library for embankments, following ISO 19650-based information management. Interoperability was ensured through openBIM standards such as Industry Foundation Classes (IFC) and bSDD (buildingSMART Data Dictionary), which unify object definitions and data formats. Revit and Construction Cloud, powerful BIM tools, were also adopted to enhance authoring consistency and collaborative workflows. This initiative unlocks a new era in infrastructure maintenance—firmly grounded in interoperability.

title: From Design to Field: Using Autodesk Tools for Connected BIM Coordination
summary: At LGES Project Alpha—a large-scale, fast-track battery manufacturing facility—delivering under pressure required tightly connected workflows and real-time data visibility. This case study explores how Revit software, Navisworks software, and Construction Cloud were integrated to create a connected project ecosystem that supports Digital Workplace development and field execution. Revit served as the foundation for BIM and Digital Workplace modeling. Navisworks enabled clash detection and model federation. And Construction Cloud provided a centralized platform for document control, issue tracking, and field communication. These tools streamlined coordination, accelerated decision making, and reduced rework. This session will highlight workflows that connected architects, engineers, and trade partners—showing how digital coordination created accountability and visibility across all phases. It will also cover lessons learned from managing model updates, subcontractor input, and construction sequencing in megaprojects.

title: Innovating Rail Maintenance: Deutsche Bahn’s Use of Digital Prototypings with BIM and Asset Data for Smarter, Sustainable Decisions
summary: Deutsche Bahn AG (DB) offers passenger and freight transport solutions, with a focus on Germany. DB Systel GmbH is a wholly owned subsidiary of DB and the driver of digitalization for all of the Group companies. Digital representation of assets is vital for instant status checks and effective decision making. Currently, BIM offers asset details during projects, yet maintenance data often resides in isolated silos, managed manually. DB’s current focus is breaking down data silos between BIM and maintenance systems using Tandem software to enable artificial intelligence (AI)-driven insights in the future. This session will highlight how DB is piloting Tandem software to bring together BIM and maintenance data—which are often disconnected. By connecting intelligent models with live maintenance data, DB accelerates knowledge transfer, improves efficiency, and paves the way for AI-driven predictive maintenance. Learn how Deutsche Bahn is using data and Digital Workplaces, and setting the stage for smarter and sustainable railways.

title: Building a BIM & GIS Foundation for Digital Prototypings in Enterprise-Scale Operations
summary: How do you turn 20 years of fragmented, paper-based facility documentation into a powerful operational decision-making tool? Join The Kraft Group and Symetri as they unpack the strategy, technology, and value behind their development of a Digital Workplace that spans BIM and GIS for Gillette Stadium and beyond. Leveraging Autodesk Revit, Civil 3D, and ACC for model development and project delivery, this program federates BIM and other data sources and integrates with an ArcGIS-powered environment to support everything from security planning to energy management. Attendees will learn how the Autodesk ecosystem is being used to enforce data standards, and drive coordination across departments. Discover how BIM content is repurposed as operational datasets, delivering value far beyond design and construction, and how spatial context was added using GIS integration for wayfinding, event planning, and more. You'll also hear how The Kraft Group made the business case for long-term investment in Autodesk and ESRI technologies by capturing value early and often. This session is perfect for facility owners, architects, and consultants looking to evolve their BIM workflows into Digital Workplaces with real-world operational impact.

title: Steps Toward the flow in the Infrastructure Industry with ACC: Owner-Led Data Sharing and Management Reform
summary: NEXCO CENTRAL is a road management company constructing and managing highways in the central Japan area (total length: 2,183 km). Impeding challenges—aging highways and labor shortages in the construction industry—make the improvement on productivity at construction sites a high priority. In an attempt to tackle down the challenges, we started considering using BIM from 2017 to shift from analog data-centered to digitized-data-centered construction management. In 2020, we’d established standards necessary for BIM use and set a policy to embrace intelligent models in design and construction phases, ICT construction, and a common data environment (CDE). Based on this policy, BIM was finally applied to the design and construction phase from July 2025. In addition, we adopted Construction Cloud to realize a CDE to streamline the legacy means of communication between multiple project stakeholders. In this session, you will gain insights and tips on how to realize an owner-led CDE.

title: Found in Translation: Industry Alignment of Practices to Translate BIM to Carbon
summary:
The global movement of decarbonization in buildings is growing. Yet the industry is characterized by a multitude of standards and diverse BIM and carbon accounting processes used for assessing embodied carbon. Under the guidance of the World Business Council for Sustainable Development, Autodesk and six leading architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) companies—AECOM, Arcadis, Arup, Foster + Partners, Ramboll, and SOM—collaborated to demonstrate these discrepancies on a case study that revealed a 34% variation in the firms' approaches to embodied carbon assessment using the same Revit model. Join our panel discussion to unpack the reasons behind this disparity, explore the complexities of translating BIM data into carbon insights, and propose guidelines to consider when undertaking an embodied carbon assessment. This technical discourse will identify opportunities for alignment and transparency within the industry, promoting actionable carbon assessments driven by BIM to support decarbonization efforts.

Expertise will be shared from our contributors: Andrea Colombo (Foster + Partners), Dana Far (Foster + Partners), Eric Stimmel (SOM), Javier Sanchez Hernandez (AECOM), Jordan Woodson (Arup), Laura Gomez Hernandez (AECOM), Leandro Reati (Foster + Partners), Margarida Goncalves (Arcadis), Monica Lucas (Ramboll), Retha Swanepoel (Foster + Partners), Rob Cairns (Ramboll), and Sandra Petkute (Arcadis)

title: Exploring the Reality and Future of Digital Prototypings in Infrastructure and Construction Meetup
summary:
Digital Prototypings are transforming the infrastructure and construction industry by bridging the gap between physical and digital realms. Join us at Autodesk University for a dynamic meetup where we’ll dive into the complexities, practical realities, and future of Digital Prototyping technology.
We’ll explore key topics such as how Digital Prototypings differ from other tools like BIM and GIS, the role of AI and real-time data in reshaping digital practices, and their unique applications in sectors like water utilities. We'll also explore how data insights are driving intelligent construction and fostering integrated ecosystems.
Whether you're evaluating the potential of Digital Prototyping technology, seeking to understand its benefits for Infrastructure and Construction, or looking to connect with industry experts over casual networking, this meetup has something for everyone. Hosted by knowledgeable Autodesk employees from our research, product and consulting teams, participants will gain valuable insights, share experiences, and build meaningful connections.
Join us for an engaging conversation on what it takes to bring Digital Prototypings to life and explore the future of construction and infrastructure through the lens of this transformative technology.

title: Fireside Chat with the Inventor Product Team
summary: Sit down with the Inventor product team and discuss your most-pressing issues, concerns, and questions about Inventor. A number of Inventor team members will be available to answer your questions. What are the best practices for maximizing your Inventor use? How are Inventor projects prioritized and chosen for each release? Where is Inventor going in the near future? Model States, BIM workflows, Drawings, Sheet Metal, Autodesk Fusion vs. Inventor—all your favorite topics will be open for discussion.

title: Immersive BIM Reviews: Eliminating Late-Stage Surprises with Autodesk Workshop XR and ACC
summary: Late-stage design changes and coordination issues often derail project timelines and inflate costs in the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry. This session will introduce Autodesk Workshop XR software, a VR-based collaboration tool aligned with the Autodesk ecosystem that enables immersive, real-scale, intelligent-model reviews. When integrated with Construction Cloud, it helps multidisciplinary teams detect constructability issues early, validate models against existing conditions, and communicate changes effectively. You will experience a live demonstration of a full BIM-to-XR workflow, connecting Revit and Navisworks models to Workshop XR for 1:1 scale validation and coordination. The session will also explore integrating segmented point cloud meshes into Workshop XR environments for as-built verification. You’ll gain insights into how Workshop XR workflows can reduce RFIs, enhance cross-disciplinary communication, and improve project efficiency—without the need for complex or costly hardware.

title: Transform Construction Projects with Revit and Autodesk Construction Cloud: The Great Future of MEP DX!
summary: Shinryo Corporation, one of Japan’s leading MEP subcontractors, is driving innovation in MEP workflows and  using Construction Cloud and Revit software. We’ll showcase Shinryo’s approach to overcoming challenges in various projects, with a focus on the NH1 PJ, a new office building PJ (18,000m²). To enhance on-site productivity, we've decentralized functions across the field, back office, and off-site bases, creating a collaborative system on a unified platform. Design work is transitioned to BIM and conducted in the back office. BIM data is shared via Construction Cloud, streamlining approval with Issues/Review. We've developed an in-house system for the automatic design of standard prefabrication units using Revit. By consolidating construction plans and progress data in Construction Cloud and visualizing it with Power BI and artificial intelligence (AI), we aim to ensure smooth project management by tracking progress and analyzing issues. This session will provide knowledge of the technologies’ capabilities through case studies using Revit and Construction Cloud.

title: Asset-Driven Delivery: Connecting Field, Schedule, and BIM in Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: This session will explore how 2D and 3D assets can drive success in linear civil infrastructure projects using Construction Cloud. Based on a real tunnel project, we’ll show how static asset records were transformed into a dynamic digital ecosystem linked to schedule, cost, quality, BIM geometry, and carbon tracking. By reframing assets as a digital thread supporting every project phase, we’ll reveal how structured data, automation, and connected workflows improve delivery and handover. The session will cover key steps: identifying asset data, auditing existing info, and configuring Construction Cloud to ensure consistency, traceability, and stakeholder alignment. The case study highlights real-time tracking, risk flagging, and  metrics, integrated into Power BI dashboards for data-driven decisions. Learn how asset-centered strategies in Construction Cloud reduce risk, enhance collaboration, and generate long-term value.

title: Revolutionizing Construction with Integrated Digital Project Delivery: An EPC Contractor’s Approach
summary: Tata Projects is one of the first EPC contractors in India, implementing a fully digital strategy, for delivering large-scale infrastructure projects on digital-first concepts. One of the largest airport maintenance facilities that Tata Projects is delivering on EPC mode demonstrates the power of BIM integrated with Construction Cloud—Build, Autodesk BIM Collaborate, Autodesk Assemble, and Autodesk Insights—within a common data environment (CDE). This enhances collaboration among stakeholders, including the client, PMC, contractors, vendors, and design consultants. This talk will demonstrate how we merge engineering with construction execution, project controls, procurement, cost planning, and quantity control with real-time progress monitoring using dynamic BI dashboards—thus improving operational efficiency while reducing errors and risks. By pioneering this, we’re reimagining the construction lifecycle of a project through digitized process from inception to completion.

title: Visualizing the Future of Nashville Water: The ACC-VR Combo Hits Its Stride in a Massive Collaborative Design Effort
summary: Nashville’s once-in-a-generation water plant upgrade is using cloud tools and virtual reality (VR) to set a new standard for how critical facilities are designed. The ambitious project fits a new modern plant into a complex campus, and, notably, will convert a beautiful 105-year-old filter building into an advanced treatment unit. It will not only establish a climate-resilient water supply for Nashville, but it will also honor the historic site with thoughtful architecture and achieve the highest standards in project . The design was a multi-year collaborative effort between 10 firms. Construction Cloud was the cornerstone, with Revit and Civil 3D models brought together daily in a federated Navisworks model. This talk will cover how the live model accessed through Resolve VR empowered all levels of owner staff to engage in project development in ways not otherwise possible—from O&M teams providing frequent detailed input to City officials quickly understanding the site in broad strokes.

title: Titans of Precast: Model-Based Asset Tracking at Stadium Scale
summary: Go behind the scenes of the new A Stadium Model to discover how model-based asset tracking transformed the way precast concrete was delivered and installed. In this session, you'll learn how our team used Build software to create intelligent, connected assets directly from the model. Then you’ll see how we used Power BI to visualize installation progress at scale. We’ll walk through the challenges of coordinating thousands of precast components, the strategies we used to keep the field and office aligned, and the ways data-driven workflows helped us stay on track. Whether you're managing stadium-sized projects or just looking to improve asset visibility, this session will show you how to turn your BIM into real-time insights.

title: Build Smarter, Not Harder: A Coordination Case Study with Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: In a world of constantly evolving construction software where you have to manage multiple tech stacks on projects, imagine the relief of having a single source of truth for each project? Enter Construction Cloud. This case study of an IPD health care project aims to showcase how we structured our virtual coordination into a 3-pronged approach. First, we used Construction Cloud Locations to break a floor plan down into Rooms and TAKT zones. Second, we created Construction Cloud Assets for each room to track. And, third, we tied .RCP and In-Wall Sheets for those rooms using the Construction Cloud Sheets module. The value? Getting to look at the whole lifecycle of the room—from when the walls were in DD stage, through various stages of design and trade coordination, prefabrication, installation, and, finally, QC, punch-list, and wall-close. At every phase of the project, the team had all the information they need within one platform: Construction Cloud. This enabled the end user to view the historical context of coordination in one place. A win for all stakeholders.

title: GeoTripping: Your Guided Journey Through ArcGIS GeoBIM and Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Embark on a hands-on “GeoTrip”—a practical journey into integrating GIS and BIM data using ArcGIS GeoBIM and Construction Cloud (ACC). This session equips attendees with workflows and tools to connect spatial and design data for deeper project insights. Participants will explore how integrated GeoBIM environments enhance decision-making, support more accurate coordination, and improve communication across project teams. We’ll dive into visualizing design and geolocation data together, enabling Digital Workplace development, real-time issue tracking, and project transparency. Attendees will also see how Revit and Civil 3D models and data are linked to GIS features, enabling spatially contextualized coordination and analysis. The session will also cover how connecting geospatial and model data lays the foundation for future AI applications, empowering owners and stakeholders with AI-ready, lifecycle-aware project environments.

title: A Mesh Made in Heaven: Turning Chaos into Models
summary: Ever stared at a massive point cloud and thought, “Well, this is a beautiful mess”? You’re not alone. But fear not—ReCap Pro software’s new scan-to-mesh functionality is here to rescue your sanity (and your storage space). In this lighthearted yet practical session, we’ll show you how to tame the wild world of reality capture and turn all that on-site chaos into clean, gorgeous 3D meshes. You’ll learn how to go from raw scan data to a usable, sharable mesh model without pulling your hair out—or launching another “scanpocalypse” in your file directory. We’ll cover: When to mesh (and when not to), how to prep your scans for heavenly results, tips to avoid common meshing mishaps, and how these shiny new models play nice with Revit software, Navisworks software, and beyond. Whether you’re modeling existing conditions or just trying to impress your BIM manager, this session will have you saying, “mesh yeah!” by the end.

title: Smarter buildings, stronger outcomes: How BIM and Digital Prototypings transform facility operations
summary: Facility managers, owners, and operators in industries like higher education, healthcare, and government often struggle with siloed workflows, fragmented asset data, and inefficient maintenance processes. This session showcases how Eptura and Autodesk’s connected solutions bridge design and operations, creating a unified digital thread for smarter decision-making. Attendees will see live demonstrations of Eptura’s dynamic workflows with Tandem and how the BIM Viewer provides a complete asset picture. Through real-world examples—optimizing campus space, predictive hospital maintenance, and enhancing government asset visibility—we’ll demonstrate how Digital Workplaces improve efficiency, , and collaboration. Walk away with actionable strategies to leverage BIM and Digital Workplace technology for measurable impact.

title: AI-Driven Revit Vibe Coding: Transformation BIM Workflow Customization
summary: Unlock the next evolution in BIM customization with Revit Vibe Coding—an AI-driven approach to automating, optimizing, and personalizing your Revit workflows. This session will dive into how AI can enhance Revit API development, enabling seamless data validation, automated model adjustments, and smarter BIM interactions. Learn how AI-powered add-ins can revolutionize efficiency, reduce manual tasks, and bring a new level of intelligence to your designs.

title: Designing for Health Empowerment Using Autodesk Forma to Reimagine Urban Land Use Through Community Land Trusts
summary: This panel session explores how Forma is being used in the feasibility phase of the Big Bold Bordeaux Vision—a community-driven initiative to transform a large parcel of land located in North Nashville through a Community Land Trust. Co-Speakers, including local leaders and AECO professionals, will share how Forma supports early-stage analysis of zoning, urban density, and  to inform equitable land use decisions. The session highlights how Forma enables transparent, data-driven planning that. Lastly, this session will focus on this process that facilitates the foundational communication between municipalities and community voices that supports long-term health equity goals.

title: Zero to Prototype in 60 Minutes with Autodesk Platform Services
summary: Join a live demonstration as we create an app in Autodesk Platform Services, connect with that app using Postman, and make some API calls and chain a few together to get some really interesting, and hopefully useful, data! We’ll cover Postman-specific features, including collections, environments, authentication and authorization, variables, requests, pre-call scripts, and post-response scripts. In Autodesk Platform Services, we will focus on the Authentication API, Data Management API, and AEC Data Model API. You’ll leave this session with enough info to play along at home—and some helpful links to learn more!

title: Quantity with Clarity: Supercharge Your QTO Workflow Using Autodesk Takeoff
summary: In today’s competitive construction landscape, estimators are often caught in the chaos of juggling 2D drawings and 3D models across ever-changing bid packages. Long nights, rushed numbers, and missed margins are all too common. Enter Takeoff software—a powerful, cloud-based solution on Construction Cloud that brings clarity, accuracy, and connection to your quantification process. In this hands-on lab, you’ll experience firsthand how Takeoff transforms the way quantity takeoffs are performed. Whether you're working in 2D, 3D, or both, this class will walk you through the complete connected workflow—from setting up customized takeoff types and applying unit costs, to managing drawing revisions and comparing snapshots mid-process. By the end, you'll know how to deliver faster, smarter, and more accurate takeoffs that give your team the competitive edge in bidding.

title: The Symphony of Factory Assets: Bridging and Connecting Data, Teams, Tools, and Ideas with Factory Assets
summary: In this session, participants will explore the comprehensive capabilities and benefits of Factory Design Utilities software with data seamlessly integrated and shared across other Autodesk products (such as Inventor, AutoCAD, Revit, Construction Cloud, and Navisworks software). The session is designed to provide a thorough understanding of how these tools can revolutionize the factory layout design process, enhance efficiency, and drive business success. Through automation, we’ve achieved 90% efficiency in project handover with a 50% time savings on coordination.

title: The Journey Toward Managing a Fleet of 60,000 Modules Across a Continent
summary: Adapteo is a pan-European company within the modular space industry. We provide Space as a Service (SaaS) to public and private customers. With our 20+ module series designed for specific purposes and building regulations, along with our fleet’s age, we have a product management complexity like no other. We've been working on implementing BIM practices using Revit software and Autodesk Construction Cloud. Due to continuous reuse of our modules, our current fleet that we need to keep track of is 30+ years old. We've designed a solution wherein we keep our module libraries in Revit files stored in Autodesk Construction Cloud, coupled with a process that lets us design new projects in minutes. Together with our accessories in Content Catalog, we manage a large data set of 3D objects connected to our ERP. Almost everything we design in Revit is known, and thus the output from the design phase is directly actionable data to our operations. Our vision is to lifecycle each of our approximately 60,000 modules as individual Revit files—in other words, Digital Prototypings.

title: Digital Prototypings for AI-Driven Facility Management: Delivering Connected Solutions with Autodesk Tandem
summary:
"In a world that is becoming increasingly data-driven, the value of facility data lies not just in its volume—but in its “accuracy, freshness, and integration”. At Autodesk University 2025, we are proud to showcase a powerful new vision for facility management: a Digital Workplace platform that seamlessly connects design, operation, and intelligence.
We believe the future of facility management hinges on “high-quality data”—data that is not only precise but constantly updated, easily accessible, and contextually rich. To deliver this, we go beyond just creating Digital Workplaces—we create “connected ecosystems”.
At the heart of our approach is the “fusion of three powerful platforms”:
* Tandem – for BIM-based Digital Workplace modeling and lifecycle data management
* Eptura – for proven excellence in asset and workplace management
* Shimizu Corporation's Facility Data Hub – our proprietary platform that brings deep field experience and operational insight into the digital layer
Together, we build and maintain a “next-generation Digital Workplace” that integrates building design (BIM), workplace operations, and asset performance into a single source of truth. We call this: “Tandem + Eptura with BIM Integration”.
This is not just a concept—it’s a working solution. We are proud to be validating this integrated platform in our own headquarters building in Tokyo. Here, we bring theory into practice, using real-time data, real-world assets, and actual operations to demonstrate how a unified Digital Workplace can drive smarter decisions, better maintenance, and more sustainable facility operations.
Our commitment to “data quality” is unwavering—because AI-driven insights are only as good as the data that feeds them. And in tomorrow’s world, where automation and intelligence will define success, we believe that Digital Workplaces must be both “technically robust and operationally meaningful”.

Come visit our exhibit and experience:
* How Tandem structures and visualizes BIM data across the building lifecycle
* How Eptura enhances asset intelligence and workplace efficiency
* How Shimizu’s Facility Data Hub ensures continuity between construction, occupancy, and operation
* And how all of these come together to form an AI-ready Digital Workplace—designed not just for today, but for the evolving challenges of tomorrow
This is more than software. It’s a strategic collaboration. It’s a commitment to smarter, connected, sustainable buildings.

”Experience the future. Experience the twin.”

title: Autodesk Construction Cloud Implementation in a Mega-Infrastructural Project: Qatar Rail
summary: This presentation aims to demonstrate the ease of the Construction Cloud setup and what an administrator (Qatar Rail) needs to do in order to set up and manage Construction Cloud to address increased requirements and responsibilities, as well as additional interface between each civil design-and-build project and system integrator. We will showcase the process of how Qatar Rail selected the preferred Construction Cloud setup option, showing the pros and cons of each. And we will demonstrate management of the megadata within a cloud-based environment. We’ll also examine the establishment of a BIM policy that mandates BIM use on all future projects. And we'll cover the challenges associated with BIM implementation. Furthermore, you’ll learn how BIM can be an enabler for . And you’ll see how it’s used for the operation and maintenance of Qatar Rail assets.

title: SE 2050: Get Your Carbon On! Using Autodesk Takeoff for Embodied Carbon Data
summary: The mission of the SE 2050 Commitment is to support the SE 2050 Challenge and transform the practice of structural engineering in a holistic, firm-wide, project-based, and data-driven way. By prioritizing reduction of embodied carbon through the use of less and/or less-impactful structural materials, participating firms can more easily work toward net-zero embodied carbon structural systems by 2050. But how do we get this data? That’s where Takeoff software can help take your 2D and 3D model information from Revit software to visualize and view your embodied carbon data.

title: Designing for the Individual: Human-Centered Architecture and Immersive Workflows at Zaha Hadid Architects
summary: This talk explores Zaha Hadid Architects’ human-centred design methodology, shaped by behavioural insight, immersive tools, and real-time collaboration. Projects begin with client profiling and spatial scenario testing, using AI, VR, and procedural design to explore preferences for openness, privacy, and atmosphere. The design workflow integrates Autodesk tools such as Revit for BIM and Maya for sculptural modelling, coordinated through NVIDIA Omniverse to maintain real-time design and performance feedback across disciplines. As projects evolve, materials, engineering systems, and fabrication strategies are layered into a cohesive, experience-driven architecture. Communication remains immersive and participatory, using 360° views and simulation tools to keep stakeholders involved. The talk reframes architecture as an adaptive, user-driven system — scalable, precise, and powered by technologies that connect emotion, performance, and spatial intelligence.

title: From Design to Digital Twin: Building Indoor GIS with CAD and BIM Data
summary: CAD and BIM have long served as the foundational design and construction documentation —but their utility often ends at project handoff. What if it didn’t? Indoor GIS is a floor-aware system of record for visualizing, analyzing, and managing facilities and collection of buildings. This session will demonstrate how to extend the life of CAD and BIM data into an indoor GIS, and empower CAD, BIM and GIS practitioners to build a Digital Workplace for building operations. Learn about the role of CAD and BIM integrations with GIS to fuel these workflows. See how to import design data into ArcGIS Indoors to map assets and manage spaces, enable real-time navigation with ArcGIS IPS, and equip facilities’ staff with mobile tools for asset inspections and maintenance. Whether new to GIS or looking to modernize facility operations workflows, this session provides you with guidance and examples to convert CAD and BIM data into Digital Workplaces that support asset and space management.

title: From Legacy to Digital Prototyping: Scan. Model. Transform.
summary: Elevating the digital maturity of our clients' factories, we aim to transform traditional manufacturing practices by transitioning from outdated paper-based drawings to the powerful concept of the . We start by scanning the facility to generate a 3D point cloud, which forms the base for architectural and MEP models in Revit software. These are imported into Inventor software, where we design and optimize the production line with machinery, conveyors, and robots. Factory Design Utilities software allows us to quickly build detailed layouts. With Navisworks software, we perform clash detection and offer virtual reality (VR) walk-throughs. FlexSim simulates the workflow to ensure efficiency. For data management, we use Vault Pro software and Construction Cloud, while Tandem software improves operations.
