This journey helps clients move beyond outdated systems and embrace the  and Digital Workplace.

title: ACC for Civil Infrastructure Projects: It's What Highly Productive BIM Coordinators and CAD Managers Crave
summary: This interactive lab will be an accelerator that will teach BIM coordinators and CAD managers how to effectively use Construction Cloud to manage civil infrastructure projects with modern cloud-based tools. We’ll take an immersive approach to learning: The class will be split up into disciplines, simulating a real project. The disciplines will work together to federate a project model using preprepared files. We’ll start with the basics of recommended file organization in Docs, set up our coordination space in , walk through best practices for exporting and coordinating discipline-specific models, run a mock clash-detection meeting, create/organize and report on our Construction Cloud Issues, and then archive our project simulating a milestone submittal. Many of the default coordination tools in Construction Cloud are built with vertical construction in mind. But there’s a world of value for horizontal construction as well—you just have to know how to unlock it!

title: Autodesk Workshop XR 101: Getting Started with Virtual Reality for Immersive Design Reviews
summary: Discover the transformative power of Autodesk Workshop XR software in this introductory hands-on lab designed to revolutionize your design review process. Experience how leading firms like Stantec, TMX Global, and Worley accelerate their projects using this immersive workspace. Equipped with Meta Quest VR headsets, you'll gain an understanding of how to walk through your Construction Cloud models and use virtual tools to review details with precision—all within an immersive environment. This innovative approach quickly identifies spatial issues often missed on regular screens or with automated clash detection. It efficiently resolves problems, saving time and resources. By the end of the session, you'll understand how Workshop XR can sustainably guide projects from design to construction. We’ll provide everything you need, including laptops and Meta Quest headsets. Just bring your innovative spirit and readiness to explore new dimensions in design review with Autodesk Workshop XR.

title: From ACC Silos to Power BI Insights: Free Your BIM Data Using Autodesk Data Exchange, ACC, and Revit
summary:
Is critical project information stuck inside your Construction Cloud (ACC) project?
Discover how to use the Autodesk Data Exchange process and Revit to bridge the gap and connect your BIM data with data visualisation platforms, such as Microsoft Power BI.
This hands-on lab will demonstrate and guide how to easily extract specific and relevant data from your 3D model subsets, rather than entire files, to create interactive visualizations and dashboards. This cloud-based method streamlines data sharing with stakeholders who aren't BIM experts, providing automatic audit trails and enabling better, data-driven decisions across your projects.

By the end of this lab, you will be equipped with the skills to implement and connect your Revit data on ACC to Power BI and create powerful and visually impactful reports that can be shared with external stakeholders, elevating your BIM data analysis to a whole new level!

title: Generative design meets Digital Prototyping:Transforming Semiconductor Facility Planning
summary: Samsung Electronics plans to leverage Autodesk's cutting‐edge technologies to digitalize the construction process for semiconductor manufacturing facilities. While we have strong expertise in semiconductor production, the construction of semiconductor factories involves a vast array of specialized fields—such as architecture, civil engineering, electrical engineering, and mechanical systems—that are difficult to integrate and manage effectively. To overcome this challenge, we aim to introduce a data-driven construction digital solution by incorporating Autodesk technologies, including BIM, Digital Workplace, Generative Design, and Explainable AI (XAI).

title: Industrialized construction, Pre-fabrication, and Modular Construction Community Meetup
summary:
The principle of Industrialized construction is to apply techniques learned from industries such as Automotive design to the design and construction of buildings. Moving to this new world has inherent challenges, from the complexity of mass customization to the supply chain pipeline.
You are not alone. Many great minds are focused on this complex problem and the challenges of getting there from where we are today.
If you are involved in the manufacture of building products or equipment, the pre-fabrication of building components and modular systems, or the challenges of implementing design for manufacture and assembly (DfMA) in your Architectural practice, come and join your peers at Autodesk University for this informal networking session.
Take this opportunity to meet others at AU who are focused on the same problems as you and build your network of peers to help you meet this challenge long after AU is over.

title: Fabrication at the Design Phase: Is Using Fabrication Tools a Better Way to Model for Designers?
summary: Why continue to struggle with outdated design tools when a more efficient approach is within reach? Embracing fabrication tools—like Fabrication Parts in Revit software—P&ID Modeler for Revit allows engineers to focus on engineering rather than spending excessive time on modeling. By starting with fabrication, designers can model faster and seamlessly transfer design intent Mechanical systems that actually work! This “backward” process significantly enhances efficiency, enabling engineers to dedicate more time to engineering rather than laborious modeling. The approach also accelerates the design-to-construction workflow and proactively resolves MEP coordination challenges—even before trade partners are onboarded. As its adoption grows, this strategy is proving to be a game-changer for speeding up the engineering design process and optimizing project delivery.

title: BIM on Track: Interdisciplinary Design for Large-Scale Railway Projects
summary: Railway projects include many disciplines: rail superstructure, civil works, tunnels, viaducts, road bridges, culverts, systems, and so on. In large-scale international projects, many parties are involved in the design and construction process. And the integration of all information in Construction Cloud coming from different tools—such as InfraWorks, Civil 3D, Revit, Navisworks Manage, and Twinmotion—enables the full BIM methodology implementation on a railway project. Autodesk tools also allow stakeholders to manage the project in the real geographical context, and to facilitate the production of photorealistic videos and virtual reality (VR) experiences for stakeholder engagement.

title: Revit for Rebar-Driven Design and Detailing of Concrete Structural Elements in Building Projects
summary: Discover how Revit software is becoming a complete structural design environment, enabling engineers to manage the full workflow, from analysis to reinforcement modeling. This session will showcase how to integrate results from finite element method (FEM) software (such as Robot Structural Analysis and Advance Design) directly into Revit to perform code-based design checks and generate reinforcement for concrete members such as beams, columns, footings, and walls. Learn how to automate 3D rebar cage generation, produce calculation reports, and manage reinforcement drawings with schedules within a single, BIM-integrated platform. See how this streamlined process minimizes manual input, reduces design errors, improves coordination across teams, and ensures compliance with both US and European codes. From design intent to documentation, Revit is reshaping how structural engineers deliver precision, efficiency, and quality in building projects.

title: Intent to Distribute: How to Control Distribution and Updating of Your Fabrication Database and Profiles
summary: Join us for a session focused on managing the distribution and updating of your Fabrication database and profiles. We'll cover essential techniques to ensure smooth and efficient operations.

title: Project Delivery at Scale: Leveraging ACC, APS and Smart Workflows for Megaproject Success
summary: What does it take to successfully deliver a mega project with thousands of models, multiple stakeholders and complex coordination needs? Drawing from AtkinsRéalis’ extensive experience in delivering large-scale frameworks, this session offers proven strategies for managing at scale. Learn to develop a robust digital strategy for mega projects, from standardized project environment setup and information exchange frameworks to multidisciplinary coordination workflows. Explore how Construction Cloud (ACC), Autodesk Platform Services (APS), ACC Connect, Data Exchange and the Autodesk Validation Tool (AVT) enable seamless collaboration, streamline design review and synchronize project-wide data for quality assurance, coordination, construction (4D), costing (5D) and carbon analytics (6D). Gain practical insights into managing multi-level collaboration and walk away with actionable strategies for implementing data driven solutions in complex, large-scale projects.

title: Coordinated Rebar Detailing in a Multi-Trade Environment
summary: When rebar detailing is performed independently, it often results in costly conflicts and rework. In this session, we will examine a couple of reinforced concrete projects where our team was responsible for both rebar detailing and 3D coordination with other trades using Revit, Construction Cloud, and Navisworks software. We’ll discuss how early involvement, shared modeling with trade partners, and continuous coordination enabled us to detect clashes, streamline installation processes, and minimize field delays. Additionally, we’ll explore how Revit facilitated model data management, effective communication, and the use of new rebar tools to enhance detailing accuracy and efficiency.

title: BIM Meets 3D GIS: Bring Autodesk Construction Cloud and Esri ArcGIS Together to Improve Project Delivery Velocity
summary: Discover how to bring rich BIM data into the geospatial world. This session will explore various integration pipelines—both current and experimental—that share 3D models from the Construction Cloud platform with the Esri ArcGIS platform, enabling seamless geospatial visualization and analysis. BIM data changes rapidly throughout its lifecycle. Geographic information system (GIS) data represents environmental, political, infrastructure, and utility information. To meet the velocity requirements of housing and infrastructure, stakeholders need a seamless, integrated view of this widely diverse information. Learn how Esri and Autodesk are collaborating to accelerate the construction of the future.

title: From Design to Digital Prototyping: Building Indoor GIS with CAD and BIM Data
summary: CAD and BIM have long served as the foundational design and construction documentation —but their utility often ends at project handoff. What if it didn’t? Indoor GIS is a floor-aware system of record for visualizing, analyzing, and managing facilities and collection of buildings. This session will demonstrate how to extend the life of CAD and BIM data into an indoor GIS, and empower CAD, BIM and GIS practitioners to build a Digital Workplace for building operations. Learn about the role of CAD and BIM integrations with GIS to fuel these workflows. See how to import design data into ArcGIS Indoors to map assets and manage spaces, enable real-time navigation with ArcGIS IPS, and equip facilities’ staff with mobile tools for asset inspections and maintenance. Whether new to GIS or looking to modernize facility operations workflows, this session provides you with guidance and examples to convert CAD and BIM data into Digital Workplaces that support asset and space management.

title: A Holistic, Faster Approach to Low-Carbon Design
summary: Discover how Mott MacDonald is driving low-carbon change across infrastructure sectors through the holistic use of Autodesk products. This approach is crucial to creating a sustainable approach to design, as traditional carbon-reduction methods are often siloed and time-consuming. By adopting a unified approach to the Autodesk suite, we have streamlined product workflows for a faster, more inclusive, and cost-effective decarbonization of major infrastructure projects. Our method has been successfully implemented across three sectors in five countries, significantly increasing our audience by 3x. In this session, we’ll share key technical lessons learned through the Autodesk product suite, Construction Cloud platform, and the Autodesk  suite, and provide actionable insights for organizations to make low-carbon decision making a reality. These insights will help empower teams to create real change today.

title: Twinning TISR: A “Hot” Take on Sustainable Environmental Restoration Using Digital Prototypings
summary: Explore deploying a digitalized design and monitoring workflow for a thermal remediation system (TISR®). Using Forma, Construction Cloud, Revit, and Tandem software, the project establishes a seamless lifecycle workflow from early-stage planning and data harmonization to real-time monitoring and maintenance. Forma optimizes solar energy feasibility analysis and site planning, while Construction Cloud ensures standardized data exchange across stakeholders. Revit enables detailed 3D parametric modeling. And Tandem integrates telemetry data to monitor system performance. You’ll learn how Digital Workplaces enhance operational performance, reduce the need for on-site visits, lower greenhouse gas emissions, and improve collaboration between stakeholders. Explore the transformative potential of Digital Workplace platforms for advancing sustainable asset management, conserving resources, and increasing infrastructure resilience in environmental restoration.

title: Moving from Revit API Add-Ins to the Design Automation, Integration, & Customization API: A Beginner’s Guide
summary: Traditionally, firms have developed and deployed Revit Add-ins using C# to implement automations and custom capabilities in Revit. Autodesk now offers the  Automation API, part of the Autodesk Platform Service (APS), which provides access to the automation capabilities of Autodesk’s core products, including the Revit API. This session will assist developers in transitioning from the Revit API to the Automation API. The Automation API introduces a new workflow that allows developers to access the full Revit DB API without needing a Revit desktop installation. This enables seamless creation, extraction, and modification of Revit data. This workflow facilitates the creation of custom Revit families, data extraction, and more, without the need to open Revit models. We outline from start to finish how to convert a Revit Add-in to Design Automation. This includes using Postman, managing References, Access Tokens, AppBundles, publishing, and running WorkItems.

title: Mastering Revit Cloud Coordination Models: Using Changes Awareness
summary: In this hands-on lab session, we will explore coordination workflows between different disciplines, accessed from Docs to Revit software, with a primary focus on the automatic identification of changes in coordination model elements—whether they’re added, deleted, or modified. Participants will learn to use visibility tools tailored to their areas of interest, enabling quick distinctions between different models at a glance. This approach reduces errors by facilitating the easy identification of the correct coordination model. By gaining precise control over the visibility of elements in your coordination models, you’ll be able to simplify complex models and enhance efficiency. Displaying only relevant details allows you to concentrate on specific coordination elements and easily locate them within your coordination views. Join us to master the art of effectively managing and distinguishing coordination model elements, thereby increasing your workflow efficiency and accuracy.

title: Smart Data for Smarter BIM: From Experience to AI-Ready Data
summary: Data is no longer just a byproduct of our projects—it’s their very foundation. In the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry, data represents both the memory of our companies and the raw material for future innovation. It transforms experience into insights, enabling us to deliver quality outcomes and pave the way for tomorrow’s AI-driven workflows. How can we make data truly trusted, structured, and seamlessly flowing across teams, tools, and platforms within a robust common data environment (CDE)? To address these challenges, we’ve created an integrated and scalable solution that combines automated auditing, smart visualization, and seamless communication. Our approach ensures consistency, traceability, and quality of BIM data throughout the project lifecycle, and it supports measurable outcomes and benefits to new stakeholders. During the session, we’ll present a real-world project where this solution was successfully deployed and validated. We’ll reveal key performance metrics demonstrating its effectiveness.

title: How Do You Get Architects to Care About Data?
summary: Architects aren’t exactly known for loving data. But what happens when bad data costs you money—and reputation? In this session, we’ll take you behind the scenes of A-lab’s shift to becoming a data-forward studio that clients see as partners, not just consultants. Through a strategic collaboration with start-up AnkerDB and established industry systems like Construction Cloud, Autodesk Platform Services, Revit software, and Microsoft Power BI, A-lab transformed its  workflows, building a connected data ecosystem beyond BIM, to support real-time collaboration, transparency, and carbon-conscious design. We’ll share our “proof of concept” of BIM for lifecycle analysis—linking design and environmental data with benchmarks like BREEAM and the EU taxonomy. With live dashboards and automated workflows, this method boosts client trust, cuts CO2 budgets, and reshapes internal attitudes toward data. Perfect for anyone building the case for data-driven workflows in a skeptical environment.

title: The 10-Minute AutoCAD Cleanup: Use Autodesk Assistant and Scripts to Fix Messy Drawings (Live Demo!)
summary: Struggling with chaotic client DWGs™? In this demo session, you’ll learn how to combine the tools Autodesk Assistant and AutoLISP scripts (for layer/block cleanup) to transform unreadable drawings into production-ready files in minutes. We’ll dissect a real-world “disaster” DWG—full of rogue layers, exploded text, and broken xrefs—and systematically fix it using automation. You’ll leave with a free step-by-step checklist to implement these tricks immediately. This session is ideal for AEC professionals, CAD managers, and MEP subcontractors tired of manual cleanup drudgery.

title: Clash Review 4.0: Revolutionizing Modeling with ACC, Navisworks, Autodesk Workshop XR, and Beyond!
summary: Step into the future of  with Clash Review 4.0, where automation and immersive technologies transform clash detection and issue tracking. Discover how to use the Construction Cloud  module to streamline workflows and enhance collaboration. We'll explore seamless integration with Navisworks Manage and the Coordination Issues Add-In, bridging cloud and desktop environments. Drawing from real-world project examples, we'll share lessons learned in managing complex geometries, multidiscipline collaboration, and large model sets. Learn to handle high-clash volumes and customize issue filters to prioritize critical tasks. Experience the advanced workflow integrating Autodesk Workshop XR for virtual reality (VR) clash reviews. We'll also explore augmented reality (AR) technologies to minimize  pitfalls on the jobsite. Leave equipped with strategies to boost clarity, accountability, and coordination speed across teams.

title: Make Your Workflow Flow with Rhino-to-Revit Automation, Integration, & Customization
summary: The challenge of transitioning from Rhino software to Revit software during the design process when developing architectural projects has been time-consuming, requiring manual rebuilding of models. This introduces inefficiencies. Henning Larsen Architects has faced this challenge head on. This has become particularly relevant with smaller fees and tighter deadlines. To address this, we’ve developed a solution using Construction Cloud and Data Exchange to enable a seamless automation of the flow of geometry from Rhino to Revit. Using Dynamo, Python, the Revit API, and Data Exchange for Dynamo, our solution automates the creation of native Revit components. This case study will showcase how our innovative approach has revolutionized the transition process, which significantly reduces time and effort while ensuring model integrity and accuracy. You’ll gain insights into the technical implementation, the benefits of automation, and practical applications for your own projects.

title: Digital Builder Podcast Featuring Dr. Sarah Buchner
summary: Dr. Sarah Buchner, Founder & CEO at Trunk Tools, joins the Digital Builder Podcast to discuss how AI is quickly evolving in the AEC industry. We'll also share actionable guidance on how to effectively start using AI on your construction projects today.

title: Digital Builder Podcast Featuring Fope Bademosi and Lorenzo VillaggiFope Bademosi, Construction Researcher and Educator at Autodesk, and Lorenzo Villaggi, Principal Research Scientist at Autodesk, join the Digital Builder Podcast to discuss their AECO industry research titled From Walls to Resources: Early Results in AI-Powered Building Deconstruction Planning.

title: What is Forma? Discover the Power of Planning & Design in the Cloud
summary: Join us as we introduce Autodesk Forma, a cloud-based, AI-powered platform designed to support smarter decisions at the earliest stages of design. In just 30 minutes, discover how Forma helps you stay ahead of deadlines, eliminate guesswork, improve collaboration in the cloud, and enhance your Revit workflow, all from a single, connected environment, purpose-built for early-stage planning and design. We’ll walk through a key early-stage design workflow and show how Forma works seamlessly alongside Revit and other tools. Join us live to see how Forma streamlines your planning and design processes, from site context and 3D modeling to environmental analysis and design comparisons, all in one place!

title: Young Professionals Meetup: Staying ahead in the AI era
summary: In today's rapidly changing technology, young professionals must stay ahead by utilizing the latest industry trends & AI. This meetup will offer an opportunity to broaden and make professional connections. More than just a meetup; it is a platform for cross-industry knowledge sharing on the theme - Staying Ahead in the Tech Era with AI and Data, urging attendees to ideate, and cultivate relationships that last beyond AU. Customers, partners, and Autodesk employees are invited to broaden their professional networks, find inspiration, and play a part in sculpting the future of design and make.

title: From Chaos to Configurations, Be the RULER of them All
summary: Ready to reduce engineering time and get sales quotes and drawings to production faster. Come along for an unexpected but advantageous journey. Ruler is a CAD-neutral sales and design automation platform designed to streamline and enhance your product configuration and design processes. As one fellowship, Ruler maps the plan to CAD such as Autodesk Inventor and Revit to deliver pristine models and documentation. It offers a suite of tools that can be tailored to meet the needs of various industries, including CPQ (Configure, Price, Quote), CTO (Configure to Order), and ETO (Engineer to Order) business models. Embark on this quest with Ruler, and let it be the guiding light that leads your projects to triumph.

title: Shaping the Future of Manufacturing: SmartRoughing, Open Standards, and Cross-Pollinating Innovation
summary: How do we take innovation from one part of manufacturing and ignite transformation in another? In this session, we’ll continue the Autodesk–ModuleWorks journey around the Manufacturing Data Exchange Specification (MDES) and explore a bold new chapter: the emergence of third-party Autodesk Fusion plug-ins that bring advanced technology directly to the shop floor. We’ll spotlight SmartRoughing, the next-generation roughing toolpath initially launched in partnership with Kennametal. See a live example of how MDES and an open ecosystem allow deep tooling know-how to be deployed seamlessly inside workflows. But this session will go beyond just one toolpath—it’ll introduce "cross-pollination of manufacturing technology,” where ideas leap across disciplines to unlock new value. We’ll also preview how this approach is paving the way for technology in emerging areas, demonstrating how the same innovation model can extend manufacturing into the industrial mainstream.

title: Use of AI to achieve Native Interoperability when sharing domain data
summary:
"As industries grow more connected, the ability to share data seamlessly across tools, teams, and domains is no longer a luxury—it’s a competitive necessity. Yet traditional data exchange methods often involve costly conversions, fragmented workflows, and loss of valuable context. This session explores how Artificial Intelligence is redefining interoperability by enabling native, intelligent data exchange across platforms and disciplines.

This session will help users to discover how AI can break down silos between AEC, manufacturing, and process industry workflows—automatically interpreting and aligning domain-specific objects and data without manual intervention.

Whether you're leading , optimizing your data strategy, or looking to future-proof your tech stack, this session will provide a clear vision for how AI-powered interoperability is shaping the next generation of connected design and engineering."

title: Unlocking the Power of Reality Capture: Leica CloudWorx Seamless Integration with Autodesk
summary: Reality Capture has been in the industry since the late 1990’s where it has evolved from it’s tripod-based roots into encompassing many different forms of data capture of today. One could easily make an argument that Reality Capture has also grown from a handful of sensors to now a wide variety of processes. Regardless of where the data comes from, there has been one consistent and constant challenge that professionals still face. What to do with the volumes of data Reality Capture creates and how to make meaningful deliverables. This session will look at a brief history of Reality Capture as well as provide insight on how Leica CloudWorx continues to provide powerful tools for converting massive point cloud data into meaningful 3D models, 2D CAD drawings, and topographic deliverables. Furthermore, many tools in Leica CloudWorx serve as enhancements to the standard CAD tools that are in the various Autodesk suite of software packages.

title: Compliance in a Click: Rapid‑Prototyping Energy Code Automation, Integration, & Customization with Dynamo for Revit
summary: Manual energy‑code compliance—extracting lighting counts, circuit data, and building areas to feed COMCheck—can be tedious, error‑prone, and hard to maintain. In this session, you’ll see how easy it is to spin up Dynamo graphs (with Python nodes) that 1) Extract building area, active fixture details, and lighting circuits directly from your Revit model; 2) Export everything to Microsoft Excel or generate a COMCheck CXL package in seconds; and 3) Run COMCheck nearly automatically, then visualize results or loop back to your BIM environment. Beyond the “how‑to,” you’ll learn how a few hours of Dynamo prototyping can spark ideas for fully fledged Revit add‑ins—demonstrating why rapid prototyping is the fastest path from concept to deployable tool.

title: End-to-End Structural Analysis Workflow with Revit in the BIM Center
summary: In this hands-on lab, you will hear a real-life story of an architect and an engineer collaborating on specific building design. Together, we will walk through the major steps of the structural analysis workflow, and discover the features fostering the most effective use of tools for analytical modeling in Revit. For some steps, we will use customized Dynamo scripts to demonstrate the power of this visual programming tool that enhances the out-of-the-box Revit features with extra capabilities. You’ll learn how to send the analytical model to analysis software, where we will perform some calculations and design checks to experience the modifications of elements. We’ll close the loop by demonstrating the tools for effective version control and changes monitoring to update our Revit model with analysis outcomes and transition the changes from analytical to physical model. This is a full end-to-end workflow flavored with a dose of humor, which we all like and need.

title: PLM Summit | Welcome with Srinath Jonnalagadda, Vice President, Data, Autodesk
summary: Start your PLM Summit experience with a high-impact welcome from Srinath Jonnalagadda, Vice President of Data at Autodesk. In this opening session, Srinath will share insights from conversations with global business leaders about the growing importance of data, connected processes, and . Discover how Autodesk is aligning its strategy to help customers unlock value through modern product lifecycle management, with a special focus on the transformative role of AI. This session sets the stage for a dynamic day of learning, discussion, and innovation.

title: Getting Started with Secure Service Accounts in Autodesk Platform Services
summary: Autodesk’s Secure Service Accounts API offers a robust solution for server-to-server integrations, eliminating the need for traditional work-arounds and enhancing security protocols. This session will guide you through the fundamentals of Secure Service Accounts, demonstrating its capabilities and benefits. Additionally, Mandi Bishop from IMAGINiT Technologies will share real-world insights into how IMAGINiT has used Secure Service Accounts to streamline operations and improve security compliance.

title: Kick-Start Your Business with Autodesk Platform Services
summary: Autodesk Platform Services is an industry-leading Design and Make Platform as a service. It makes the same technology used by Autodesk’s SaaS solutions available to external developers and businesses. This class will focus on industry trends, technology insights, and business strategies using Autodesk Platform Services to accelerate the success of your product. This class will help developers, customers, and business partners use all of the tools and resources that Autodesk provides to make sure that products built on top of Autodesk Platform Services are as successful as possible. We'll explore tools and resources that will help you learn and use Autodesk Platform Services, and we'll cover how to improve product awareness, marketing, sales, and more. We'll also include information about industry trends that we're seeing, and we'll look at several case studies to show you how products in multiple industries have become successful using Autodesk Platform Services.

title: Digital Prototyping Summit | Bridging Industry Tools for Advanced Factory Planning: A Digital Process Engineering Approach
summary: This session will explore how Stellantis is continuously advancing factory planning through a holistic approach that integrates a diverse range of digital tools and methodologies. By merging industry tools—from architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC); product design and manufacturing (PDM); and the entertainment industry—Stellantis is broadening the ways factories are industrialized, from early concept through construction changeover. This session will highlight how democratizing data and promoting cross-functional collaboration—among core manufacturing teams, suppliers, and construction stakeholders—enables more-efficient planning, streamlined construction, and smoother ramp-up to production, all while reducing unforeseen issues. Learn how nontraditional tools for automotive—such as Construction Cloud, Vehicle Tracking, and Navisworks plug-ins or geospatial integrations—are powering advanced visualization and enabling proactive factory planning.

title: Elevate Your Design Workflow: New Functionality in Autodesk ALIAS and VRED 2026
summary:
Discover the latest advancements in Autodesk ALIAS and VRED 2026 that are set to transform your design and visualization workflows. This session will delve into the new features, with a particular focus on Live Referencing—a groundbreaking functionality that seamlessly connects ALIAS and VRED, enabling better collaboration across disciplines and departments.
Live Referencing allows real-time updates and synchronization between ALIAS and VRED, ensuring that any changes made in ALIAS are instantly reflected in VRED. This dynamic interaction facilitates a more efficient design process, and reduces communication barriers, leading to quicker iterations and decision-making. By fostering seamless collaboration between designers, engineers, and visual artists, Live Referencing enhances consistency across departments, minimizes errors, and accelerates project completion.

title: Code-Free Magic: Crafting Web Apps with Ease
summary: This class will explore the transformative potential of no-code and low-code platforms, demonstrating various no-code/low-code technologies related to Autodesk products. We’ll showcase practical examples using Data Exchange from Autodesk products like Revit and Civil 3D, as well as Tekla. Additionally, we’ll demonstrate how to use the Power BI Connector to visualize and analyze data, providing deeper insights and more-informed decision making. We’ll also demonstrate how to connect everything with a web app built in a low-code environment. By the end of the session, you will have a clear understanding of how these tools can be integrated into your workflows to drive innovation and productivity. Furthermore, we will also take a brief look at how to use artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance your applications. This will include a quick overview of how AI can automate tasks and provide predictive insights, giving you a glimpse into the future of AI-driven workflows.

title: Integrations and Automation, Integration, & Customizations in Flow Production Tracking
summary: In this presentation, we will explore the integration capabilities of the Autodesk Flow Production Tracking platform, focusing on how they connect with various tools to enhance productivity and streamline workflows. We’ll start by discussing the ready-to-use integrations available for Flow Production Tracking, including popular tools from Autodesk and third parties. These integrations facilitate smooth data exchange and operational efficiency. Next, we will cover customizing these tools, including an overview of the hook approach, followed by the development of a new app. We’ll then discuss creating automations in Flow Production Tracking to trigger processes based on events. We’ll analyze the tools and frameworks available, examining event logging, the event daemon framework, webhooks, and action menu items. Thanks to the Flow Production Tracking API and automation features, we can demonstrate cloud functionality in Autodesk Platform Services, integrating 3D visualization, geometry optimization, mesh checking, or simulation.

title: More Power! The Manufacturing Data Model Enables Cloud-Based Workflows and Automation, Integration, & Customization for the Autodesk Fusion Ecosystem
summary: GraphQL is used to expose the rich, granular data of the Autodesk Platform Services Manufacturing Data Model. This class will cover the GraphQL introduction and syntax, and explore how to get the data you want. It will also show examples of automating workflows with this rich data. The data itself is authored by Autodesk Fusion software, but the data model is available to anyone you wish to share with. This manufacturing data can easily be used for analysis, processing, and sharing—without needing desktop authoring tools. You can use cloud functionality through GraphQL to seamlessly browse through hubs, projects, folders, files, and component properties—and use customized queries to fetch valuable data, integrate with enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, automate project administrative tasks, and more.

title: Vibe Coding for the Fearless: How AI Lets Anyone Ship Like a Dev
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is unlocking a new era of creativity—but it’s not for the faint of heart. In this session, we’ll show how “vibe coding” empowers developers and product managers alike to move quickly, prototype boldly, and ship without waiting. You’ll learn how tools like Cursor enable fearless experimentation—if you’re willing to let go of old workflows. With real-world proof from Arkance—where a PM built an AI-powered web app solo in 48 hours—this session is a wake-up call: You don’t need permission to build.

title: Unlocking the Potential of the Vault Data API
summary: Autodesk's Vault Data API offers a modern, RESTful approach to interacting with Vault data, streamlining integration and automation processes. In this session, we'll explore the core functionalities of the Vault Data API, highlighting its advantages over the traditional Vault SDK. Attendees will see a real-world example of what is possible with the Vault Data API, including how Vault data can be surfaced directly in Microsoft Teams through custom integrations. The session will also demonstrate a ChatBot that allows users to interactively query Vault information, showcasing new and innovative ways to make Vault data more accessible and collaborative. This class aims to equip software developers with the knowledge to enhance their applications by integrating Vault data seamlessly.

title: Design & Manufacturing Industry Keynote
summary: The way we design and make is evolving at an unprecedented pace. Join Autodesk leaders as they explore the future of design and manufacturing, in an era defined by AI. From AI-powered tools and intelligent workflows to the growing impact of connected data, discover how innovation is unlocking new levels of creativity, agility, and collaboration. Be inspired by real-world stories and bold thinking that showcase how teams are staying competitive and thriving in a time of rapid transformation.

title: Empowering Tomorrow's Factories with Seamless Autodesk Integration
summary: By 2027, the automation market will surpass $400 billion. This isn’t a trend, it’s a transformation. Rising shipping and raw material costs, plus geopolitical instability, are driving manufacturers to reevaluate global strategies. Labor-cost-driven models are giving way to nearshoring and supply chain optimization, enabled by Industry 4.0 technologies like artificial intelligence (AI), robotics, and 5G. Digital factories offer real-time data, autonomous decision making, and unmatched efficiency. Autodesk is uniquely positioned to lead this shift with end-to-end cloud solutions—from factory design to construction, simulation, Digital Workplaces, and asset management. With tools like Autodesk Fusion, Tandem, Forma, and Construction Cloud, Autodesk ensures seamless data flow and collaboration across every phase. This talk will explore how automation is reshaping global manufacturing—and how Autodesk empowers businesses to build smarter, faster, and more resilient factories.

title: Cloud Control: Integrating Point Scans into Packaging Line Design
summary: Point cloud scanning is no longer just a validation tool—it’s a core part of how we design, install, and document automated manufacturing systems. In this session, we’ll walk through how our team uses the Leica BLK360 scanner to capture real-world context at every stage of a project. From scanning existing facilities for layout integration to scanning at FATs, construction sites, or even completed lines for record set drawings, 3D scanning has become key to identifying conflicts early, creating mesh-based equipment models, and aligning installations with design intent. Learn how portable scanning and tools like ReCap software and Cintoo help streamline communication, reduce risk, and improve accuracy across disciplines.

title: AI, Automation, Integration, & Customization, and Connected Data: Accelerating Innovation with Design and Manufacturing Partnerships
summary: Manufacturing today is faced with new and evolving challenges. Complex supply chains, rising material costs, geopolitical tensions, and labor shortages all impact productivity and growth, creating delays and shortages. Meanwhile, companies need to design and make products that are more sustainable, customized, and affordable. Advanced technologies like Internet of Things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), automation, and connected platforms are growing in popularity, giving manufacturers who adopt these solutions a competitive advantage. Innovation and  are essential to keep up with technological advancements and market demands. Autodesk’s ever-evolving partner ecosystem delivers modern solutions, allowing customers to use the latest advancements in technology. Join this session to meet leading Design and Make partners, from hot start-ups to established industry leaders, and explore how together we’re accelerating innovation in manufacturing.

title: Exploring Visualization of 3D Objects in USD Format: Transform Designs with Sensor Data Insights
summary: In this session, we will present a research prototype featuring a web app add-in for Autodesk Fusion software that visualizes 3D objects in USD (Universal Scene Description) format using NVIDIA Omniverse. The use case involves an innovative product design process that integrates sensor-collected performance data into the design, setting the stage for a novel performance-aided design approach. This session will begin with guidance on downloading the Omniverse libraries from public NVIDIA repositories, and will cover how to develop a custom Autodesk Fusion add-in capable of presenting a streamed Omniverse application running on the cloud. You’ll gain comprehensive understanding of the potential and step-by-step guidance for this innovative approach, which enables designers to go beyond traditional Digital Prototyping visualization dashboards and optimize designs using actionable insights from sensor data to ensure products perform as designed in the real world.

title: Autodesk Platform Services-Based Inventor Design Configurator for Industrial Products (Machinery and Equipment)
summary: This case study explores how the Inventor Configurator Automation Project streamlines design workflows by automating the generation of 3D models, 2D drawing sheets, and related outputs. Traditionally, designers manually created models and drawings, a process that was time-consuming and prone to human error. By using automation, the system processes user-provided XML data, integrates with BIM 360 software for file management, and uses the Autodesk Platform Services Design Automation API to generate and manage outputs in the cloud. This innovation enhances efficiency, reduces errors, and provides quick access to essential design outputs.

title: Using AI for the Creation and Modification of OSL Shaders in 3ds Max
summary: Open Shading Language (OSL) in 3ds Max 2026 software empowers artists to craft custom procedural materials, enabling intricate control over textures and surface properties. However, developing or altering OSL shaders traditionally demands a solid grasp of scripting and shader logic. This session will introduce a transformative approach: using artificial intelligence (AI) tools, such as ChatGPT and Claude, to assist in the creation and modification of OSL shaders. Participants will discover how to generate shader code by providing natural language prompts, iteratively refine AI-generated scripts, and seamlessly integrate these shaders within 3ds Max projects. Through live demonstrations, you’ll learn to troubleshoot shaders using AI, streamlining the process and expanding creative possibilities. By the end of this session, participants will be equipped with practical techniques to harness AI as a tool for shader development, reducing technical barriers and fostering innovation in material creation.

title: Automating Design Code Compliance Using Agentic AI and Autodesk Technology
summary: Join us for an inside look at how Atlas Copco and CCTech co-developed an agentic artificial intelligence (AI) solution to automate design code compliance directly within Inventor software. Manual rule checks and interpretations of engineering standards led to inefficiencies and inconsistencies. By using Autodesk Platform Services, cloud workflows, and Inventor software’s API, we built an intelligent, learning-based assistant that evaluates designs in real time against complex rule sets. This session will explore how agentic AI can transform engineering workflows, with insights into data structuring, training, and integration. Results include reduced compliance errors, faster reviews, and enhanced design governance across teams.

title: Creating a Dynamic Cinematic Scene with Maya and Unreal Engine
summary: This class will present a fast, easy-to-use workflow for creating a dynamic cinematic scene using Maya software (modeling, setup, and animation) and Unreal Engine (layout and rendering). This hands-on class has the indie artist and 3D generalist in mind, instead of big companies with armies of specialized artists. Unreal Engine is widely used in the industry as a powerful, real-time rendering alternative to more-traditional renderers. Unreal Engine is a perfect companion to Maya, letting you achieve high-quality renderers in a fraction of the time needed with other renderers. Nevertheless, Unreal Engine’s integration with Maya can be very confusing for beginners. This class will cut to the chase and show you how to set up your cinematic scene in Maya, and give you best practices to properly export it to Unreal Engine. Then we will show you how to set up everything again inside Unreal Engine, how to lay out your cameras and edit in Unreal Sequencer, how to apply post effects, and, finally, how to export your final cinematic scene.

title: Future-Proofing Prefab: Scaling Tech Innovation in Industrialized Construction
summary: This panel will bring together leaders from the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) and manufacturing industries to discuss how prefabrication is being transformed by the integration of digital tools, artificial intelligence (AI), and data-driven workflows. Co-Speakers will share best practices for scaling technology across factory and field teams, with real-world examples from productized systems like BamCore. We’ll explore implementation strategies, barriers to adoption, and how AI and automation are shaping the future of off-site construction. Join us for an honest conversation about what’s working, what’s next, and what it takes to future-proof prefabrication.

title: Streamlining Payment Workflows: Connecting Autodesk Construction Cloud with ERP Systems
summary: We’re a Mexican general contractor with more than 60 years of experience in the industrial and vertical housing market, and five years into our using Construction Cloud, we identified a major opportunity: the excessive time that construction project managers and superintendents spend weekly reviewing subcontractor payment applications. Copachisa has worked with Construction Cloud for three years, investing heavily in the Schedule tool. Last year, our CEO challenged the virtual design and construction (VDC) and IT departments to eliminate the 600 hours typically spent during the execution phase on payment application reviews. In this class, we’ll share the automation we implemented to reach zero review hours. By using the data connector to link construction schedule progress with our ERP, we improved workflows and freed up our teams to focus on what truly matters: controlling and mitigating the gap between scheduled versus completed progress.

title: Breaking Barriers: XR for AEC Training, Safety, and Well-Being—Powered by Autodesk Tools
summary: How can immersive technology transform the way we train, build, and care for our teams? This session will explore how extended reality (XR)—paired with Revit, Navisworks, and Construction Cloud—is evolving from a visualization tool into a catalyst for safety, efficiency, and wellbeing in architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC). Discover how XR can simulate high-risk tasks, streamline onboarding, and strengthen safety culture. We’ll share real-world applications, Autodesk Workshop XR, and practical steps to start, scale, and integrate immersive tech into your workflow.

title: Better Together: Previewing the GCPay and Cost Management Integration
summary: Construction Cloud Cost Management provides a broad range of features for forecasting, managing, and reporting project costs. GCPay provides deep functionality for the collaboration with your supply chain for payment applications, lien waivers, and tier vendor management. See how these two products combine for connected financial management.

title: Autodesk Construction Cloud Road Map: Field Operations
summary: Managing work on-site shouldn’t get in the way of getting the work done. Whether you're trying to punch up punch lists, streamline field workflows, or standardize data input across projects, it’s crucial that your field operations are efficient with actionable data. And information generated or used on the jobsite fuels opportunities like Autodesk AI. At this session, you’ll discover what’s new and explore what’s coming in Build and the Construction Cloud mobile app. So, join our product development teams in this engaging workshop to get a behind-the-scenes look at our field workflows strategy and the major initiatives on the horizon. From downloading sheets and closing out issues to managing schedules and tracking assets—be it on site, in the trailer, or at HQ—you play a vital role in the future of field workflows. Don't miss this session!

title: Innovators Stage | From Risk to Reality: Using Corporate Philanthropy to De-Risk Industry Innovation
summary: Global challenges are intensifying, from climate change to workforce disruption. And companies are being called on—by customers, employees, and markets—to move beyond business as usual to create impact. This panel will explore how corporate philanthropy and impact investing are used to catalyze growth of early-stage nonprofits and start-ups for impact outcomes, including: upskilling and training a rapidly shifting workforce in the age of artificial intelligence (AI), and reducing carbon emissions from building operations, construction, and manufacturing industries. In this session, leaders from corporate foundations, nonprofits, and start-ups will share how they’re unlocking resources—including funding, technology, and expertise—to create an ecosystem for emerging solutions to our most urgent challenges to thrive.

title: Data Exchange and Issues in ACC: Connecting Risk, Change, QTO, and Carbon Insights in One Smart Workflow
summary: This session will uncover how Construction Cloud can transform issue management into a connected process for handling risk, value engineering, and scope control. By using the Construction Cloud Issues tool alongside references, forms, and documentation, teams can structure requests for change (RFCs), flag project risks, and capture value opportunities. Paired with Construction Cloud Data Exchange and Power BI, issue data becomes a strategic resource for visualizing scope creep, managing QTOs from 2D/3D applied to linear infrastructures and bridges through various file formats, carbon emission, and making informed decisions throughout the project lifecycle. The session will highlight how issue-centered workflows can drive clarity, reduce delays, and strengthen governance.

title: Autodesk Build: Crushing Deployment to Maximize Adoption
summary: Effective adoption of applications like Build software is based on a well-executed deployment strategy. This is the differentiator when business investment, outcomes, and ROI are at stake. We’ll explore the implementation journey of Build at ISEC, a specialty finish contractor. We’ll focus on strategy that included a transition plan from a legacy solution, leadership buy-in, trials, functionality review with stakeholders, development of new workflows, configuration, communication strategy, training, and post-deployment support. Alongside Autodesk delivery services, ISEC established a scope of work, budget, and timeline for deployment. We established a team of subject matter experts (37) from across office locations (20) representing more than 700 employees. Come and learn about ISEC’s connected workflows that integrated additional departments in a common data environment optimizing the project lifecycle.

title: Safety in Design with Autodesk Construction Cloud and AR: The Digital Journey of an Aviation Project
summary: The Terminal 2 Baggage Programme (T2BP) at Heathrow aims to replace the aging T2 baggage system linked to Terminal 1. The new solution will be implemented in five phases across 21 construction projects, grouped by physical and operational attributes. A major challenge was managing design risks through different organizations and suppliers that interface at key areas in a live operational environment. The manual Excel processes used to record design risks led to difficulties in maintaining a single source of truth, causing duplication and errors. The goal was to find a streamlined, digital solution to standardize processes and enable monitoring and reporting through dashboards. After researching data environments, Construction Cloud was chosen for its suitability to manage design risk information, requiring customization through trial and feedback. The solution also provided integration with augmented reality (AR) for live inspections.

title: How SSOE Is Using Autodesk AI in Autodesk Construction Cloud Today, and What’s Next for AI in Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is dominating headlines and everyday conversations—and it’s not slowing. It isn’t just a trend. It’s a powerful force multiplier reshaping every industry, including design/construction.​ So, what does that look like for architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) professionals? And how is Construction Cloud putting AI to work in meaningful ways?​ In this class, Tomer Rosenthal (principal AI product manager at Autodesk) will join Lauren Collier (director of AI and Innovation from SSOE) to discuss how AI in Construction Cloud is driving real impact. They’ll explore the opportunities AI brings to our practice, highlight the AI-powered features available in Construction Cloud today, and share insights into how SSOE is integrating AI across their ecosystem—including building trust in AI. You’ll also get a glimpse into what’s ahead on the Construction Cloud road map as Autodesk continues to invest in AI.​ Whether you’re a seasoned tech leader or just AI-curious, this class will offer an inside investigation of the value of Autodesk AI-powered features in Construction Cloud.

title: Empowering the Subcontractor: Stowe Australia's Nationwide Adoption of Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: While  discussions often emphasize general/managing contractors, the true measure of successful digital adoption depends greatly on the buy-in and innovation of subcontractors. As Australia’s largest privately owned electrical subcontractor, with 14 branches nationwide, Stowe Australia recognized the critical need to digitally transform our entire business—not just isolated projects. By strategically deploying Construction Cloud nationally, we've streamlined workflows, enhanced risk management, and empowered our teams to collaborate seamlessly across hundreds of projects. This session will share our journey, as well as practical insights for subcontractors, lessons learned from a large-scale implementation, and proven strategies to achieve measurable ROI and operational excellence. By the end of this session, you'll understand how subcontractors can successfully use Construction Cloud to transform their business operations, gaining tangible benefits beyond a single project’s lifecycle.

title: Unlock Your AI Genius with Autodesk Assistant in Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is no longer just a buzzword—it’s transforming the way construction projects are managed. In this hands-on lab, you’ll discover how to put the Construction Cloud platform’s built-in AI tools to work without writing a single line of code. Learn how Autodesk Assistant helps teams identify issues early, manage risk smarter, and streamline communication across the field and office. Through real-world scenarios and interactive exercises, you’ll learn about AI-driven workflows that will boost productivity, improve decision making, and save time across all phases of a construction project. Whether you’re a project manager, virtual design and construction (VDC) expert, or field engineer, this session will give you practical skills you can apply immediately, with no custom development or AI expertise required. We want to take the mystery out of AI and show everyday workers that it’s here to help. Walk away confident about how to adopt the Construction Cloud AI features to do more with less, faster.

title: Streamlining Material Tracking with AI and Data-Driven Decision Making
summary: In today’s fast-paced environment, visibility within the material supply chain is a necessity to maintain operational excellence and drive growth. Success in project delivery depends on materials arriving on time, surety of cost, and the meeting of schedule dates. Traditional methods are time-consuming and aren’t agile enough to capture real-world scenarios, such as field measurements, factory testing, or mock-up approvals. To address these challenges, we’ve paired project delivery best practices—developed through firsthand experience on real projects—with innovative software such as Build and ConstructivIQ to streamline material tracking and visualize the material supply chain. We’re using emerging artificial intelligence (AI) techniques to automate tasks, simplify processes that require human intervention, and support an equitable exchange of ideas through predictive analytics.

title: Innovators Stage | Out of the Shadows. Into the Light: From Experience Designer to Architect—Success Stories of Women in AEC.
summary: Throughout history, women have pioneered innovations that have shaped the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry, laying the foundation for groundbreaking technologies and radical transformations. We’ll explore the powerful impact of women driving change across the industry, and look ahead to the future of how we design and make. Hear from Autodesk Expert Elites and influential product designers at the forefront of transformative technologies. These women have adopted AI-powered generative design solutions. They’re using Digital Workplace technology to create climate-resilient architecture. And they’re driving the successful integration of cloud-based platforms across large-scale organizations. Whether you're a woman in AEC or an ally, this session will provide actionable insights, inspiring stories, and an opportunity to connect and ask questions with the trailblazers shaping the future of design, construction, and technology.

title: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly: Making the Switch from Procore to Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Switching construction management platforms is a major decision that impacts every phase of the project lifecycle. In this panel session, a team of experts from both the general contractor and consultant side will share their unfiltered experiences transitioning from Procore to Construction Cloud. You’ll hear real-world stories of what worked, what didn’t, and what surprised them the most—ranging from platform comparisons and workflow changes to team adoption and stakeholder buy-in. With perspectives from both in-the-field execution and strategic implementation, this session will provide a well-rounded look at the benefits, trade-offs, and growing pains of leaving one ecosystem for another. You’ll leave with practical lessons, implementation tips, and a clearer understanding of how Construction Cloud performs in real-world construction environments—especially in comparison to Procore.

title: Connected Coordination Level 2: Effective Clash Resolution Using the Power of the ACC Closed Loop Issue Management System
summary: For effective clash resolution, it’s essential to notify the design partners about the clashes in a timely manner. It is also imperative to maintain an auditable and trackable record of notifications related to the clash resolution process. In this Connected Coordination Level 2 lab, we’ll build upon where we left off in the 2023 Connected Coordination lab, and learn to use the power of the closed-loop issue management system to assign, notify, resolve, and close clashes on a project. You’ll also learn about the Construction Cloud Issues add-in for Revit software that allows design teams to download clash issues directly within Revit to highlight the clashing elements and take action to resolve them. You’ll learn how the closed loop issue management system keeps all the stakeholders notified every step of the way, allowing for an effective clash management system. Finally, you’ll learn how to export reports of all the active clash issues and link them to Power BI for the relevant stakeholders.

title: Using Conversational AI for Design Inspiration with ChatGPT and Autodesk Fusion
summary: Unlock the potential of conversational artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance your design ideation process in Autodesk Fusion software. This session will explore how AI image generators like ChatGPT can serve as creative partners, helping you generate innovative design concepts through natural language interaction. Learn how to articulate your design goals and constraints to ChatGPT. Use it to develop a variety of conceptual ideas that can be developed further in Fusion. We'll discuss effective prompting techniques, methods for interpreting AI-generated suggestions, and strategies for integrating these ideas into your design workflow. Whether you're facing creative blocks or seeking fresh perspectives, this session will equip you with tools to harness AI for enhanced creativity and efficiency in your design projects.

title: Network with Fusion Factory Ecosystem Partners and Discuss Manufacturing Data Models Meetup
summary: Join us for an engaging and interactive networking event centered around the Factory Experience at Autodesk University. This meetup is designed to provide attendees with curated, casual networking opportunities while exploring the concept-to-production process using Autodesk Fusion. Connect with peers and Autodeskers who share a passion for innovation, design, and manufacturing, and gain behind-the-scenes insights into the Factory Experience. Kickstart the session with conversations and discussions about the Fusion Factory Experience, focusing on the integration of CAD, CAM, CAE, and PCB processes in Autodesk Fusion. Learn how the team designs, develops, and produces a brand-new consumer product each year, showcasing success stories and innovations throughout the entire product development cycle. Additionally, we will have expert knowledge about the new Manufacturing data model and its APIs, as well as discuss any customization questions you may have. Engage with product design and manufacturing enthusiasts, sharing experiences and insights in a vibrant community dedicated to advancing product development and manufacturing.

title: From Idea to Shop Floor: How Kratki Improved Its Product Manufacturing Process with Digital Data Flow from Inventor to ERP
summary: Kratki, a leading Polish manufacturer of fireplaces and heating solutions, started Management of production workflows by integrating Inventor and Vault software with an enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. Design models are enriched by data based on reference values from ERP and calculated properties from the Inventor 3D model. Customization of Vault Professional software also provides automatic generation of PDF, DXF™, and STP files, as well as quick updates of many projects after the change of a single part. With these tools, Kratki can efficiently respond to specific customer needs, through full digitalization at every stage of the process and data consistency in both systems. This optimizes the technology preparation process, eliminates tedious project update activities after changing single parts, and reduces errors related to outdated documentation. This session will explore how the synergy of CAD/PDM (product data management) and ERP systems has strengthened Kratki’s innovation capacity and market agility.

title: Autodesk Fusion 360 Deep Dive: Freeform, Parametric, and AI in Industrial Design
summary: Industrial and product design require strong sets of approaches, from organic shapes for inspiration to precise parametric models for manufacturability—and even enhancements driven by artificial intelligence (AI). Combining these workflows can be complex and limit innovation. This session will explore efficient workflows in Autodesk Fusion 360 software that maximize the design process, using an office task chair as a case study. The seat and backrest use Freeform (T-Splines) for organic modeling, while the base and pivot mechanism employ parametric modeling for precision. Generative Design is used in the legs and frame by setting material and structural criteria, allowing AI to generate novel forms. Finally, geometric patterns enhance appearance and reduce material use. You’ll learn how to integrate these techniques seamlessly, saving time while maintaining design intent.

title: From Data Sludge to Liquid Gold: Transforming the Future of Water Infrastructure Through Digital Prototypings
summary: Water infrastructure owners and operators face poor asset information handover due to system misalignment. Could automation and integrated data enable Digital Workplaces to support operational efficiency, reduce rework and costs, and improve health and safety (H&S)? Learn how GHD successfully used client-focused data exchange and cloud collaboration during the 40MLD upgrade of Wellington Water Limited’s Te Mārua water treatment plant to ease these struggles. Automating the integration of asset information using Autodesk products enabled delivery of the asset register 12 months early—saving NZ$150,000 and 1,400 hours in asset data management. Combining Esri mobile apps and dashboards enhanced as-built quality and reduced site H&S risks. A proof of concept was developed where GeoBIM and Docs software were fused to create a geospatial common data environment (CDE)—the foundation for an operations and maintenance Digital Workplace. We’ll share valuable lessons on managing evolving data needs and supply chains to demonstrate how connected workflows made  more efficient.

title: Is Your Onboarding Drifting or Driving Results?
summary: Is your onboarding process accelerating performance—or slowing your team down? In the AEC industry, where cost, time, and talent shortages stall , effective onboarding is no longer optional. With 61% of leaders struggling to find technically skilled employees, the need for structured, continuous learning is urgent. This session shares how JMT tackled capability gaps and project ramp-up delays by implementing a standardized onboarding program using Pinnacle Series. Discover how they built a scalable, trackable learning program that equips new hires to contribute faster, with less downtime. Learn how personalized training, workflow alignment, and access to best practices helped JMT boost retention, satisfaction, and billable hours. If you're ready to transform onboarding into a strategic advantage, this session will show you how to drive results from day one.

title: Mo' Data, Mo' Problems — How a Data Strategy Helps You Transition Your Multi-Discipline Workflows to ACC: Panel Discussion
summary: Colliers Engineering & Design’s (CED) transition from on-prem Vault to Construction Cloud (ACC) was driven by the need to eliminate data silos, support massive datasets, and scale across multi-discipline teams and acquisitions. This session explores how CED approached the shift strategically — partnering with ARKANCE and Autodesk to reimagine workflows while honoring what already worked well. You’ll learn how to analyze your current environment, define end goals, and run effective pilot programs with SAT/UAT testing to evaluate performance, latency, and user experience. Discover the importance of documentation, change management, and building an ACC Guideline and Data Process Document to support rollout and adoption. Whether you're a large firm or a small team, this session offers practical insights, lessons learned, and a roadmap to a successful ACC migration — paving the way for connected clouds, integrations, and a smarter future.

title: Digital Builder Podcast Featuring Ben Cochran
summary: Ben Cochran, Vice President of Engineering at Autodesk, joins the Digital Builder Podcast to discuss the future of Artificial Intelligence(AI) in AECO, unpack the impact Model Context Protocols (MCPs) have on AI agents, and identify how this could change your workflows.

title: Autodesk AI Keynote
summary:
Industries in every global market are scrambling to integrate Artificial Intelligence into business models and workflows. Design & Make customers now find themselves in an exciting, yet unnerving time. Our AI solutions are helping customers today stay ahead of industry demands and technological shifts. At the same time, we are developing automated workflow tools for tomorrow that will enable engines to be faster and more efficient than ever imagined.                                                                                                             

During the Autodesk AI Keynote, Chief Technology Officer Raji Arasu and team will outline how Autodesk’s current AI-powered offerings will evolve, disrupting ourselves to empower customers with the capabilities to win the future.

title: AECO Roadmap: AutoCAD
summary: Get a front-row seat to what’s next for AutoCAD. In this session, the AutoCAD product team will walk you through the latest enhancements and offer a preview of upcoming features that are redefining design and drafting. From improved collaboration tools to AI-powered productivity boosts, you’ll see how Autodesk is evolving AutoCAD to meet the needs of today’s complex projects—and tomorrow’s. You’ll also get insight into the product strategy guiding our development, and how your feedback is helping shape what’s coming next.

title: AECO Design Slam | MusicCity Living 2050 - Reimagining The Gulch District
summary:
AECO Design Slam brought to you by HP.

 

AECO Design Slam | MusicCity Living 2050 - Reimagining The Gulch District Experience the excitement of the “Music City Living 2050”—a live, rapid-fire design competition set in Nashville’s iconic Gulch neighborhood. Watch two teams of exceptional AECO professionals race against the clock to reimagine residential living by fusing Nashville’s music heritage, BBQ culture, and into innovative housing concepts. Using cutting-edge generative tools like Forma, ArchiStar, Finch, and AI, teams will model, analyze, and present their visionary designs to a live audience, who will select the winner based on creativity, impact, and performance.

title: AECO Roadmap: AEC Data
summary:
Data is the connective tissue of every successful AECO project—and it’s time to treat it that way. In this new roadmap session, Autodesk product leaders will walk you through our rapidly expanding AEC data model and how it’s transforming digital project delivery through enhanced collaboration, automation, and decision-making across the project lifecycle. Learn how we’re building a more accessible, trusted, and connected data foundation—one that reduces rework, unlocks automation, and ensures the right people have access to the right information at the right time. This session will explore how our expanding data capabilities are helping teams manage, share, and access critical project data and content with greater speed and accuracy.

You’ll get a closer look at the new capabilities we’re connecting to Docs as we expand it with granular data access to enable greater flexibility and control over information across the asset lifecycle. This session will touch on our AEC Data Model API, Content Catalog, Datum, Data Exchanges, Parameters Service and our expanding capabilities for creating, managing and validating information requirements across the project lifecycle. 
"Data is the connective tissue of every successful AECO project—and it’s time to treat it that way. In this new roadmap session, Autodesk product leaders will walk you through our rapidly expanding AEC data model and how it’s transforming digital project delivery through enhanced collaboration, automation, and decision-making across the project lifecycle. Learn how we’re building a more accessible, trusted, and connected data foundation—one that reduces rework, unlocks automation, and ensures the right people have access to the right information at the right time. This session will explore how our expanding data capabilities are helping teams manage, share, and access critical project data and content with greater speed and accuracy.

You’ll get a closer look at the new capabilities we’re connecting to Docs as we expand it with granular data access to enable greater flexibility and control over information across the asset lifecycle. This session will touch on our AEC Data Model API, Content Catalog, Datum, Data Exchanges, Parameters Service and our expanding capabilities for creating, managing and validating information requirements across the project lifecycle.

title: Low Impact, High Tech: Sustainable Design Solutions in the Age of AI Meetup
summary:
Join professionals from across industries for an engaging networking experience passionate about driving sustainable outcomes in the age of AI. Whether you're working on carbon analysis, sustainable design and manufacturing, preserving biodiversity, or water stewardship, this is your chance to connect with peers and explore the strategies and technologies changing the way we create a more sustainable future.

We’ll start with a brief welcome and a few conversation starters, like how Autodesk tools help you design more, guess less, and stay friends with the planet today. We’ll explore how the advent of AI is impacting your Sustainable Design strategies as both a challenge and a catalyst (because Sustainable Design, like AI, isn’t always straightforward). Whether you're here to exchange ideas, discover solutions, or build new connections, this meetup is designed to spark meaningful dialogue and collaboration.

title: Trust Enthusiasts Unite Meetup
summary:
Join us for an engaging meetup dedicated to enthusiasts of cybersecurity, privacy, risk management, and responsible AI — welcoming individuals of all skill levels, from students to seasoned professionals, and those with a general interest in these vital topics. This inclusive event offers an opportunity to connect with like-minded individuals — including members of the Autodesk Trust Org — share knowledge, and explore the latest trends and challenges in the digital world. Whether you're just starting out or have years of experience, you'll find valuable insights and an opportunities to network with peers, exchange ideas, and engage in meaningful discussions to enhance trust across various domains.
Don't miss this chance to deepen your understanding, expand your network, and contribute to a safer and more ethical digital landscape. All are welcome to join us for an evening of learning, sharing, and growth.

title: BIM & VDC Professionals Meetup
summary:
Join us for a collaborative meetup tailored to BIM and VDC professionals
Explore how ISO 19650 is enabling connected data and seamless workflows, and share practical strategies for overcoming implementation challenges; Hear real-world career journeys from BIM professionals who’ve progressed from graduate roles to leadership, offering insights and inspiration for your own path; or dive into BIM/VDC best practices that are shaping more efficient, tech-driven construction.
Whether you're focused on standards, career development, or best practices and future-ready delivery, this session offers a unique space to connect, learn, and grow.

title: AECO Community Meetup - Workflow Wednesdays Live
summary:
Curious how your peers are accelerating project delivery and solving real-world BIM and CAD challenges? Join us for Workflow Wednesdays Live — an open, high-energy meetup where Autodesk users come together to swap tips, share wins, and get inspired. Originally launched as a weekly office hours session for AEC professionals, this meetup invites everyone to experience the community-driven format that’s helped dozens of firms build better designs, faster.
Whether you’re a BIM manager, CAD lead, or just passionate about workflow improvement, come connect with like-minded professionals facing the same goals and roadblocks. Expect organic conversations, cross-discipline ideas, and war stories from the front lines of digital project delivery — with zero slides and 100% peer value.

title: Unraveling 3D into UVs
summary: UVs are an essential part of the content production puzzle that enables you to map bitmap images to your 3D models. But what exactly are they? Why do you need them? And most importantly, how can you gain the confidence to manipulate or even create them yourself? In this casual session, we will demystify the UV workflow. We’ll break down what they are and how UVs are used in production today, and we’ll discuss various methods found within 3ds Max software that you can use and succeed with when you need to modify or create your own custom UV data for your 3D polygon models in your own work.

title: AI and XR: The Future of Design Collaboration and Training
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) and extended reality (XR) are changing how we design, collaborate, and learn. Whether it’s automating repetitive tasks, improving real-time collaboration, or creating immersive training environments, these technologies are making workflows faster and more interactive. This session will explore practical ways AI and XR are being used across design, architecture, and media. We’ll look at how AI enhances creativity and speeds up ideation, how XR helps teams visualize ideas before they’re built, and how these tools are transforming training by making learning more hands-on and accessible. Rather than replacing human skills, AI and XR are becoming essential tools for designers, engineers, and educators. This session will share real-world examples of how they’re shaping the —and how you can integrate them into your own practice.

title: Security, Identity & Access Meetup
summary:
