In today’s digital design and engineering environments, identity and access management (IAM) is more than just a technical necessity—it’s a foundation for secure, seamless collaboration. This meetup offers a space for Autodesk customers to come together and explore how identity and access decisions impact our daily workflows, from managing non-human identities and integrating SSO to navigating the human side of access failures and security breaches.
Whether you're an admin responsible for IAM infrastructure or a user who’s experienced the real-world effects of access challenges, your perspective matters. This session is designed to foster open, community-driven conversations where we can share stories, surface challenges, and learn from one another.
Join us to connect with peers who care about trust, security, and the systems that support our work. Together, we’ll explore how identity and access—often invisible—are essential to everything we do.

title: Turning Generated Models into Production-Ready Content with 3ds Max
summary: Generative model data—such as photogrammetry and generative artificial intelligence (gen AI)—is becoming more and more pervasive in our daily work as we visualize experiences for our customers. While this generative content might look okay at first glance, upon further inspection we see that it’s far from being production ready. So, how do we turn it into something that we can use? Using 3ds Max software, we’ll cover various tools and functionality that can easily clean up and improve this data so you can use it as a positive force multiplier in your productions.

title: Modernizing Your AutoCAD .NET Projects: Refactoring with .NET 8
summary: Learn how to bring your AutoCAD .NET Framework applications to work with AutoCAD 2025 and newer by refactoring them for .NET 8. This class will walk through key refactoring strategies, framework updates, and compatibility considerations to modernize your projects.

title: North Star Vision: Digitizing Breakthrough Engineering for a Better World
summary: In support of the IMI North Star, we’re delivering a connected data environment between IMI engineering, production, and all key business functions—which provides the control, data, and analytics required to continue to drive revenue growth and margin improvement. Learn about IMI’s success with Autodesk Fusion Manage PLM software as it is adopted by more than 2,500 users across 28 sites globally—scaling to 46 sites and 4,000 users by 2027. IMI’s mission continues to be breakthrough engineering for a better world. We’ll explore how integration of these various systems produces increasing amounts of more-accurate data to be collected and shared across the organization in a digital environment. With added workflow efficiency, we see accelerated product development, improved collaboration, and lower operating costs to optimize our organization.

title: Bulletproof Your Inventor Workflow: Settings, Projects, and Beyond
summary: Say goodbye to missing files, style clashes, and design rework. In this hands-on lab, you’ll build a bulletproof Inventor workflow—drawn from 20 years of technical support expertise—optimizing settings, project files, templates, styles libraries, and Content Center. We’ll craft a live design environment that’s fast, error-free, and scalable for solo or team projects. Test it against real-world chaos and see the difference: efficiency up, headaches down. You’ll leave with a proven cheat sheet distilled from decades of troubleshooting that will help make Inventor work for you. Whether it’s parts or assemblies, unlock a smarter way to design. Bring your workflow into the future—starting here.

title: Vault Now and in the Future
summary: Vault 2026 software has arrived, bringing new features and enhancements to improve design creation, streamline user and admin workflows, and enhance software interoperability. This session will showcase these new additions and explore their practical applications. After presenting the latest features, we'll delve into the Vault road map and discuss how you can help shape its future.

title: Optimized NPI, Change, and Supplier Management Integrated with ERP
summary: Discover how Sensio (dba Made by Gather)—the company behind America’s fastest-growing kitchen brands—moved from time-consuming manual and semiautomated tasks and workflows to an automated and integrated (Autodesk Fusion Manage Extension and ERP) ecosystem, supporting their collective of visionaries, movers, and shakers who make super-premium design and innovation accessible to the world. This presentation will take you through the company’s transformative journey—highlighting how they’ve successfully integrated with their ERP and continually evolved their product development, change management, and supply chain automation to take full advantage of continual enhancements that Autodesk has made to these respective processes and workflows. Through the company’s experiences, you’ll gain key insights and strategies for transforming your business with connected data and processes.

title: 0 to 100 in Stratus: A Newcomer’s Guide to Setting Up Stratus for Mechanical Contractors
summary: In this class, you’ll learn how to set up and optimize Stratus for mechanical contractors, based on firsthand experience. We’ll cover the essential steps for setting up Stratus from scratch, automating repetitive tasks, and streamlining workflows to improve project efficiency. You’ll gain insights into managing data and generating reports for better decision making, as well as strategies for troubleshooting and resolving issues you may encounter during the setup process. Additionally, we’ll explore techniques to speed up the development process, helping you implement Stratus faster and more effectively on your projects. Whether you’re new to Stratus or looking to enhance your skills, this class will provide valuable lessons from someone who’s recently navigated the process firsthand.

title: Democratizing Machine-Learning Catchment Modeling: From Simulation to Surrogates
summary: Explore how you can use artificial intelligence (AI) to extend the reach and accessibility of catchment-specific machine learning (ML) in InfoWorks ICM software without sacrificing hydraulic fidelity. This session will introduce the concept of training surrogate ML models on local InfoWorks ICM simulations to predict flows at key locations across a catchment. You’ll learn how Autodesk is generating and deploying these surrogates to quickly forecast system performance without computationally expensive simulations. The approach offers a new way to support rapid scenario testing, stakeholder engagement, and real-time operational insight without hurting a hydraulic equation. The session will present a practical framework for integrating AI in a way that empowers more users and accelerates insights.

title: From Idea to Assembly: Reimagining Product Design with Generative AI
summary: There is no single way to design a new product. The design principles needed to manufacture a coffee maker will be different from those needed for an electric vehicle. So, why can’t today’s software tools adapt to meet designers' needs? Generative AI may offer a path forward to enabling product designers to adopt agile and adaptive design workflows and support the design of complex assemblies. In this interactive session, we’ll take an in-depth look at an early-stage software prototype for AI-assisted assembly design, developed by Autodesk Research. Participants will gain insights into how the researchers used large language models (LLMs), multimodal data, and system modeling to design products from 1D to 3D. Join us if you’re a product designer, software engineer, or UX designer interested in advancing your understanding of assembly design and learning how this new innovative technology can shape the future of Design and Make industries.

title: Blueprints at the Speed of Thought: Fast-Tracking Engineering Drawings
summary: In the world of engineering and design, speed and precision are crucial. Whether you’re working on complex mechanical systems, architectural plans, or intricate product designs, the time it takes to create and modify engineering drawings can make or break a project. This session will address both efficiency and faster, accuracy-creating engineering drawings in Autodesk Fusion software. We’ll explore the following innovative solutions/workflows and time-saving best practices that will help you accelerate your drawing process in Fusion: The power of Drawing Automation, smart usage of drawing templates, techniques to speed up dimensioning and annotation, the magic of “shift” button in the Fusion Drawings, hidden gems “osnaps,” cut-copy-paste in Fusion Drawings, more than “just” a sheet bar, reusing title blocks across drawings, and many more. The goal of this session is to empower you with the knowledge to work smarter, not harder, and make your engineering drawing process more efficient and effective using Fusion.

title: From Screen to Space: Designing Immersive Experiences That Put Visitors First
summary: How do you design for a space, not just a screen? This talk will explore how to think outside of the box (literally) when creating immersive experiences for physical environments. We'll share insights into how our team approaches spatial design—from the earliest concept art to the final install—while always keeping the visitor experience a priority. We’ll cover the importance of prototyping early and often, we’ll look at strategies for working efficiently on small multidisciplinary teams, and we’ll discuss how stepping away from the computer can help creative problem-solving. Whether you're an artist designing with projections, VR/AR/XR, or touchscreens, this session will cover the framework involved in building immersive, accessible, people-first experiences.

title: Early-Stage Precision: Eliminating Designer Error with Informed Design
summary: In early design stages, assumptions become liabilities. They can result in late design changes, costly rework, and coordination issues, often due to low-quality models early on. The Informed Design API closes the gap between BIM and manufacturing, bringing manufacturing detail from Inventor to Revit through parametric models. We’ll explore how Informed Design empowers mechanical designers and Inventor users to contribute to collaborative, model-driven design remotely, reducing downstream changes and saving significant time through design automation and configurability. In this session, you will learn how to build parametric models, and incorporate rules, regulations, and limits into your Inventor models. We’ll discuss how to make your Informed Design models fully BIM-compliant, using best practices for naming conventions, metadata, and interoperable design intelligence. We’ll cover how Informed Design reduces risk, encourages better decision making, and brings manufacturing to the front of the design cycle.

title: AI-Driven Product Success: Revolutionizing Requirements Management & ALM into Autodesk Fusion Manage
summary: AI is reshaping how regulated industries build products by streamlining requirements management and reducing compliance costs. This session introduces Visure Requirements ALM with Vivia, the AI-driven assistant that transforms the Requirements Engineering lifecycle. From elicitation, analysis, and review to adherence to standards, Vivia minimizes manual effort, accelerates decision-making, and improves compliance efficiency. We’ll also show how these capabilities integrate with Autodesk Fusion Manage, bridging Requirements Management with ALM and PLM practices. Attendees will learn how combining Visure with Fusion Manage enhances collaboration, boosts product quality, shortens development cycles, and ensures readiness for evolving standards. Designed for professionals in consumer electronics, railways, medical devices, automotive, and aerospace, this session reveals how to future-proof product development and achieve AI-driven success.

title: 0 Carbon: Precise Carbon Footprint Calculation and Optimization Using Intelligent Model and Carbon Database for Sustainable Construction
summary: Our clients’ specifications are more and more demanding, as governments ask for architecture, engineering, and construction industries to improve their carbon footprints and reduce energy consumption. In France, we need to reach “Carbon Neutrality” by 2050, and this can only be done if major construction companies like VINCI Construction decide to use powerful tools to optimize their projects. Using web applications like Time To Beem, we’ve managed to successfully reach our French clients’ specifications. We’ve also achieved a 50% time savings on our sustainable development engineering. These platforms allow us to upload an intelligent model and quickly assign a carbon footprint to all objects. By extracting quantities and the carbon footprint, we can then have the effect of each discipline and precisely decide on how to make more efforts. Theoretically, we should be able to build a very large database to train artificial intelligence (AI) models and create better and better designs!

title: Reimagining Assembly Design with Agent AI: A New Paradigm for Intelligent Systems
summary: Assembly design is on the edge of a transformative leap. This session will introduce a groundbreaking approach that harnesses agentic artificial intelligence (AI) to redefine how we conceive, simulate, and build complex assemblies. We’ll explore early-stage research and prototypes demonstrating how intelligent agents can collaboratively generate geometry, streamline workflows, model dynamic systems, and adapt designs in real time based on performance feedback. If you work with systems design, simulation, or multidisciplinary workflows, this session will challenge your assumptions and offer a glimpse into the future of AI-augmented engineering. Prepare to rethink what’s possible!

title: Connected Infrastructure: Integrating Datum360 with InfoAsset Manager, InfoWorks ICM, and InfoWorks WS Pro for Live Asset Synchronization
summary: In this technical instruction session, we’ll explore how integrating Datum360 with InfoAsset Manager and hydraulic modeling tools like InfoWorks ICM and InfoWorks WS Pro software can establish a single source of truth for utility asset data. This session will walk through the architecture of a live integration pipeline—connecting BIM updates to hydraulic models in near real time. When a designer updates a pipe diameter in an intelligent model, the change is registered in Datum360 using a unique asset ID. From there, data flows to InfoAsset Manager using the Ruby Exchange API. It is finally synchronized with InfoWorks ICM or InfoWorks WS Pro. The result is a continuously accurate, up-to-date hydraulic model that utility owners can rely on—without time-consuming manual data entry. This connected workflow enables faster updates, better decision making, and significant operational savings.

title: Accelerating Design Innovation: Integrating Autodesk Fusion 360 with AI-Powered Iterative Form Exploration
summary: Discover how to seamlessly integrate ideation powered by artificial intelligence (AI) into your Autodesk Fusion 360 design workflow. This session will explore a dynamic, iterative process using generative AI platforms like Vizcom and GPT-4o to rapidly generate, refine, and visualize diverse form variations directly from your Fusion 360 models. Learn practical methods for exporting your designs, using AI-driven form exploration, and then effectively reimporting enhanced concepts back into Fusion 360 for further refinement. Unlock greater creativity, accelerate your iteration cycles, and elevate your design innovation by strategically combining Autodesk’s powerful CAD capabilities with advanced AI tools.

title: MEP Content Editor: Fabrication Services and Content Creation Workshop
summary: In this session, we’ll explore Autodesk’s MEP Content Editor, a powerful tool designed to streamline the creation and customization of fabrication components within Revit and AutoCAD workflows. You’ll gain hands-on insights into modifying database-driven parts, adjusting specifications, and optimizing content for enhanced project coordination. We’ll cover best practices for maintaining data consistency, using parametric capabilities, and integrating manufacturer-specific components to ensure accuracy in fabrication modeling. Whether you're a BIM manager, detailer, or engineer, this session will equip you with the skills to efficiently manage and refine MEP fabrication content, improving workflow efficiency and project outcomes.

title: Smart HVAC Zoning: An Autodesk Assistant and AEC Data Model Case Study
summary: In this session, we’ll explore the development and application of a web-based tool designed to streamline the application of zones into an architectural Revit model. Our application uses the AEC data model and integrates Autodesk Assistant, an advanced artificial intelligence (AI) agent, allowing users to interrogate their models using natural language. By automating these processes, our solution significantly reduces manual effort, while increasing model visibility. We estimate that our solution can save us an average of eight hours per project. Whether you’re interested in streamlining zone assignment or just want to see a cool AI tool, this session has something for you!

title: From Schematics to Reality: Turbocharging Mechatronics with Autodesk Fusion
summary: This session will explore a practical, classroom-tested workflow for integrating advanced electronics and mechanical design using Autodesk Fusion software. Using a mechatronics case study—a Raspberry Pi Pico-controlled NERF turret—you'll learn to streamline multidisciplinary design, enhance collaboration, and prevent integration challenges. See how Fusion can simplify electronics PCB and mechanical design integration, optimize prototyping, and support real-world educational outcomes. Gain practical methods for improving your electronics-mechanical workflow efficiency.

title: Generative Design Made Easy: Practical Generative Design Workflows for Civil 3D Users
summary: Generative design isn’t just a buzzword - it’s a powerful tool that can reshape how we approach projects in Civil 3D. Yet many users are unsure where to begin to implement generative design into their daily workflows. This class will explore how you can implement generative design into various Civil 3D workflows to create smarter, clash-free models, streamline tasks, and unlock better project outcomes. This session will demonstrate various real-world examples of where generative design can be applied, including route optimization & asset placement. You’ll learn how to prepare Dynamo graphs for use in generative design before creating generative design studies, evaluating outcomes and generating geometry in Civil 3D – all with practical real-world examples. Whether you’re looking to reduce risk, lower costs, improve  or simply work smarter, this class will give you the confidence and tools to put generative design to work on your Civil 3D projects.

title: Automate, Balance, Iterate: Mastering Grading Optimization in Civil 3D
summary: As land development and civil engineering projects continue to demand greater efficiency and precision, the Civil 3D Grading Optimization tool has emerged as a promising solution for automating and streamlining the grading process. This presentation will offer a practical, hands-on perspective from a daily Civil 3D user actively engaged in site design projects. Drawing from real-world experience, we will explore how the tool integrates into typical design workflows, discuss its strengths in accelerating conceptual grading and balancing earthwork, cover the key benefits it brings in terms of design iteration and visualization, and examine a few limitations. This session aims to provide an honest, experience-based evaluation of Grading Optimization, offering insights for professionals considering its adoption and those looking to enhance their current use of the tool.

title: Learn How to Unlock Insights from 3D Ground Data in Civil 3D with GeoDin Ground for Informed Infrastructure Design Choices
summary: Ground data is key to constructing safe, cost-effective, sustainable infrastructure. As an Autodesk strategic partner, Fugro developed GeoDin Ground app for Civil 3D software to transform infrastructure design by providing designers and civil engineers with contextual and comprehensive ground data through an integration with GeoDin, a leading geotechnical data management, analysis, and reporting software. The GeoDin Ground app allows designers to see into the ground. How does this work exactly? We’ll show and teach you all the major insights in this session. We’ll import geotechnical data directly into Civil 3D, visualize boreholes, and create surfaces and volumes with GeoDin Ground. Finally, we’ll analyze geotechnical data between surfaces and create volume reports. And we’ll demonstrate the benefits of visualizing and analyzing infrastructure in combination with ground layers. You’ll leave the session with a bigger picture of the impact of GeoDin Ground and a practical understanding of the app.

title: Lessons Learned from Developing AI Chatbot for Multibillion-Dollar Semiconductor Fabrication Plants
summary:
Imagine a mega project that generates nearly 2,000 Revit files in total, and some getting updated in daily basis. The speed and volume of data produced in multi-billion semiconductor fabrication plant project are staggering. Extracting valuable insights from this vast data pool must be effortless and straightforward, enabling owners to communicate effectively with designers and contractors to ensure project success. Samsung Electronics envisioned an AI Chatbot capable of understanding and interpreting project information as the ultimate solution.
In this session, we will introduce our journey of developing an AI Chatbot using Autodesk Platform Services (APS) and Amazon Bedrock. Discover the challenges we encountered in implementing multi-agent collaboration for Text-to-SQL and effectively ingesting large amounts of data to feed the Large Language Model (LLM). Additionally, learn how we adapted our approach to make the chatbot truly beneficial for the project.

title: Mastering Catchment Creation in Civil 3D for Powerful Hydrology Simulations in InfoDrainage (New Game-Changing Features)
summary: This session will walk through how catchments or watersheds can be automatically generated using a surface model and assigned to drainage networks as part of a concept design in Civil 3D software. Ultimately, with the InfoDrainage/Civil 3D integration tool, we’ll see how we can bring all the data across to InfoDrainage and use its more extensive runoff routing methods and rainfall generation tools to set up and simulate hydrology and accurately size up the drainage network.

title: Preparing for an AI-enabled Future
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is rapidly changing the way we do business. To stay competitive, professionals need to prepare today for the advancements AI will bring tomorrow. In this session, we will help you understand the practical steps you can take now to navigate AI risks, strengthen resilience strategies, and shape the .

title: Work Smarter, Draft Faster: Turbocharge Construction Documentation with AutoCAD Architecture and AutoCAD MEP Schedules
summary: AutoCAD Architecture and AutoCAD MEP Schedules provide an exceptional opportunity to elevate your drawings, enabling effortless creation of tables that highlight essential information about selected objects within your building model. Boost productivity and transform construction documentation workflows with ease, requiring only a minimal time investment. Unlock long-term success as the return on investment steadily grows over time. This proposal advocates for replacing outdated manual methods, such as relying on spreadsheets, with AutoCAD Architecture and AutoCAD MEP scheduling capabilities. This transition enables the automation of tags and tables, ensuring they remain consistently synchronized with the building model. By removing the need for separate updates to drawings and spreadsheets, this streamlined approach unifies a fragmented, error-prone workflow into a seamless and automated system. Alongside exploring the schedules feature, take a moment to discover the latest updates in AutoCAD Architecture and AutoCAD MEP 2026.

title: Innovators Stage | Revolutionizing Design Workflows with AI Agents: Autodesk and Microsoft’s Frontier Partnership
summary: Discover how Autodesk and Microsoft are revolutionizing everyday design and review workflows in Fusion by leveraging cutting-edge AI technology to transform their customers' workflows. Autodesk has become a frontier firm by adopting this innovative, best-in-class AI technology, setting new standards in the industry. Stephen Hooper, VP of Design & Manufacturing Product Development at Autodesk, and Kathleen Mitford, Corporate Vice President, Global Industry Product Marketing at Microsoft, will share how their teams are: - Automating time-consuming design tasks to reduce manual effort, allowing teams to focus on higher-value work. - Simplifying product reviews to speed up collaboration and approvals. - Enabling teams to tell stronger stories through clearer, more compelling outputs. This interactive session also provides attendees the opportunity to ask Stephen and Kathleen questions about their pioneering partnership and the AI-enabled solutions they’re bringing to market.

title: Topo and Tribulations: The Battle of Toposurface and Toposolid
summary: With the rollout of the Toposolid tool in Revit 2024 software, and the deprecation of the familiar Toposurface tool, site modeling workflows have shifted—and not always for the better. Revit users are facing practical challenges: unmergeable toposolids, fussy floor excavations, and visible boundaries of toposolids that cannot be turned off, to name a few. This session will unpack those pain points head-on and offer field-tested solutions. We'll walk through a hybrid, adaptive workflow that uses Civil 3D software for precision and transitions strategically to the Toposolid tool for documentation and collaboration. With accessible methods and work-arounds, this class will be packed with tactics you can apply immediately. You'll leave with real-world guidance and a clear sense of how to work with Revit software’s evolving terrain tools, instead of against them.

title: Get Dirty with Data: Building Autodesk Forma Cloud Data with Dynamo
summary: Exchanging data between applications is a favorite problem in architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC). We risk undersharing and oversharing, we worry about working on different versions of a project, and we find our data formats have become compatible! While desktop software systems are the powerhouses driving design and engineering workflows, we need to communicate beyond our desks, often through rapidly changing distributed cloud interfaces. We've been talking about reading and writing data to a shared cloud in Forma software for a while—and now it’s time to get our hands dirty! Follow along on your laptop or just enjoy the show. We'll walk through how Forma data is structured and why it’s structured this way, and then we’ll use Dynamo to read and write data from the desktop to the cloud. No skills in Dynamo are needed, but if you can, feel free to follow along. Dynamo will be used to show programmers and nonprogrammers the way that Forma data can be created, edited, and searched from really any application or environment.

title: CIA in Action! BIM Our Own Central Intelligence Agent!
summary: BIM is no longer a buzzword, but are we using its full potential? BIM still sits comfortably as a sophisticated 3D modeling tool, while it is meant to do more—much more. Are we using it as a catalyst to our workflow or a glorified tool to generate models, coordinate between disciplines, and produce drawings. And then? That’s it. The rich data embedded in those models is often ignored, unlinked, or siloed. It’s time to get serious, understand its impact on project lifecycle, and learn about the ROI it can provide to its stakeholders. Let’s see how BIM can work harder for you, turning it from a cost center into a value generator.

title: Revit 2026 and Beyond: What’s New, Improved, and Unexpected
summary:
Revit 2026.0, 2026.1, 2026.2 and 2026.3 introduce significant enhancements aimed at boosting productivity and streamlining BIM workflows in the AEC industry. Key highlights include accelerated graphics for smoother navigation, expanded site and topography tools, and the new ReCap Pro plugin for seamless integration of reality capture data. User-driven improvements—such as more flexible compound structures and refined annotation tools—reflect direct feedback from the Revit Ideas page, ensuring the release addresses real project needs.
This session offers an in-depth look at the top features, including live demonstrations of integration with Dynamo, Construction Cloud, and Data Exchange to optimize design and documentation. Attendees will see practical applications across architecture, MEP, and structural disciplines, gaining actionable insights to leverage Revit 2026’s latest advancements for more efficient, collaborative, and future-ready project delivery.

title: Autodesk Insight Is Going Global: Regionalized Carbon Results Supported by Autodesk’s New Sustainable Design Data API
summary: Feeling the pressure to deliver complex projects quickly while balancing ? The key to managing and reducing carbon emissions is accessible, connected, and useful data. Despite growing demand for  information, many face barriers in data consistency and reliability. Autodesk’s platform connects data across design processes, shares insights, and uses workflows powered by artificial intelligence (AI) for sustainable environments. The new  Data API links customers with trusted third-party  data sets at all design stages. The Insight and  Data APIs partnered up to support additional embodied carbon databases, providing essential data for analysis. This integration equips designers with tools to measure embodied and operational carbon, visualize reduction opportunities, and track environmental impacts. Learn how to use Revit Insight software for sustainable design and use the  Data API to connect more data sources or build custom tools with Autodesk Platform Services.

title: Smart Collaboration for Design and Documentation of Complex Spaces
summary: Laboratory environments demand near-seamless collaboration across multiple disciplines to ensure optimal performance. This results in an architectural approach that highlights mechanical, electrical, and plumbing systems—elements typically hidden in architectural documentation. Such extensive documentation necessitates a well-structured methodology within BIM, using a shared parameter workflow. This approach enables flexible assets that can be automatically scheduled, family types imported, and a data dashboard implemented to track key metrics such as utility connections, materiality, cost, linear footage, and unit counts. By using a template of assets, the design team can efficiently capture and coordinate the technical requirements while also streamlining the process. This efficiency frees up valuable time for creativity, allowing the design of laboratory spaces to inspire the next generation of discoveries.

title: Automation, Integration, & Customization or AI: A Discussion on the Boundary Between AI and Traditional Automation, Integration, & Customization
summary: "Can we AI this?" is a statement that’s being thrown around a lot of late. This may bring to mind something else: "They were so preoccupied with whether or not they could that they didn't stop to think if they should.” Frequently, the solution being sought can be achieved through more-traditional automation. So, this leads to the question: When is it better to automate and when is it appropriate to seek AI solutions? A panel of industry experts will discuss their thoughts on the benefits of AI solutions versus those of more-traditional automation for your BIM and design workflows. When is each appropriate? And what is the best way to spend your limited development hours.

title: Enhancing Real-Time Collaborative Design Reviews Through XR: Using Twinmotion and Autodesk Workshop XR
summary: Design reviews are evolving—fast. In this session, we’ll explore how combining Twinmotion with Autodesk Workshop XR software enables architects and designers to conduct real-time, immersive design reviews that transcend screens and static presentations. You'll learn how to create engaging virtual environments that allow distributed teams and stakeholders to walk through projects, discuss changes spatially, and provide input live within the design context. We'll cover best practices for Workshop XR integration in design workflows, discuss hardware and collaboration protocols, and share insights from real-world implementation, including strategies to boost client involvement and decision-making speed.

title: Leveraging Forma and Its Extension Ecosystem for Airport Design
summary:
In the rapidly evolving field of airport architecture, integrating advanced design tools is crucial for optimizing performance and . This presentation explores how Forma and its extensions can be leveraged to enhance airport building design.

Forma’s AI capabilities offer unparalleled design optimization for  from the earliest stages in the design process, and by utilizing powerful extensions to the Forma platform, it can provide real-time analysis of the envelope performance and the implications of substantial glazing systems and shading. This enables designers to optimize rapidly and allows for quick prototyping and feedback.

Attendees will learn how these workflows can empower designers to integrate energy performance into their workflows, and gain insights into the latest tools to unlock new possibilities for achieving  goals in building design.

title: No Box Required: Creatively Adapting to Client Needs Through BIM Families
summary: This session will cover advanced techniques our BIM team uses to create customized Revit families, addressing the challenge of needing highly specific, data-rich components. You’ll learn how we use adaptive model families to ensure 2D visualization can be manipulated without affecting the 3D model, which is crucial for accurate documentation and coordination. We'll also demonstrate how these families store critical data (like location) for streamlined scheduling and legend creation. Additionally, the session will detail how we use planting templates to develop scalable families for ERP (emergency response plan) maps. This allows for easy adjustment of component size and visibility, a key factor in delivering clear and understandable security information to clients.

title: Conceptual Frameworks: Automated Modular Layouts with Dynamo Plus Generative Design and Autodesk Forma
summary: Futureproofing your conceptual design process to take advantage of modern construction techniques, such as volumetric modular buildings, will be a necessary step for all as we transition through the modern age of Design & Make.Using Autodesk Dynamo and Generative Design to create and transmit an automated modular massing to Forma, with the new Dynamo as a Service extension, will become the next step in the journey towards efficient analysis tailored to your design needs. Steve Thorne of Bird Construction will demonstrate how anyone can take the Stack Modular Design Guide and apply that information to a Dynamo Generative Design script configured to automatically generate a compliant massing to be passed into Forma, allowing one to take full advantage of its powerful analysis toolset.This session will empower the attendee to apply massing automation to any volumetric solution with a framework for paving the way to analyzing other modular assemblies.

title: Beyond the Numbers: Big Data's Role in Shaping Inclusive Collaboration and Decision Making in Aviation Projects
summary: As the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry embraces , big data is becoming essential for delivering smarter, faster, and more resilient aviation projects—and shaping the smart cities they connect. But the real power of data lies beyond collection. It’s about how we govern it, share it, and ensure equitable access across disciplines. This inclusive session will bring together aviation design professionals, BIM leaders, and data strategists to explore how big data is driving meaningful change. Grounded in real-world applications, the panel will examine how big data is being integrated into aviation design and construction workflows, why strong data governance builds trust and enables better decisions, and how collaboration makes data usable across diverse teams. The discussion will also highlight the risks of poor data practices and offer strategies to avoid them. Finally, the session will share forward-looking insights into how inclusive and transparent data ecosystems can reshape the industry.

title: Concept to BIM: The Path from the First Sketch to a Finished Model
summary: ATP has developed a systematic workflow to start a project in the right way. We’ve been using Revit intelligent modeling since 2011, and have identified it as the most precise tool for integrated planning across all phases of a construction project. Decisive planning from the start leads to intelligent models with high-level content, even at an early stage. What kind of Information should flow from a project manager to the design team? Which parameters need to be specified as early as possible, so that the data can later be used for cost management, tendering, and construction—as well as for lifecycle analysis? Preparing a solid planning foundation at the beginning of a project using BIM leads to an efficient and clearly structured project flow, eliminating the need for duplicate work processes, and ensuring a smooth path through all project phases. It allows for cost transparency and clarity from the start, avoiding unforeseen costs and leading to higher rate of client satisfaction.

title: Multiplying Analyses to Manage Design Overload
summary: With parametric and AI-based tools accelerating design iteration, architects now face a new challenge: Our ability to generate ideas outpaces our capacity to meaningfully analyze them. This session will introduce a novel workflow that bridges Rhino software’s modeling speed with Forma software’s cloud-based analysis, automating the process of evaluating design iterations in the background as architects continue modeling. We'll demonstrate how automatically pushing variants from Rhino into Forma allows design alternatives to be analyzed across parameters—and how this approach, combined with AI-assisted sorting and filtering, creates a powerful decision-making framework with the potential to reduce evaluation time from days to hours. Teams can comprehensively organize and explore dozens or even hundreds of design options instead of the typical handful, resulting in an early design process that’s more data-informed while maintaining creative momentum.

title: Future-Proofing Airports: How SFO’s Data-Driven Design Is Shaping the Future of Travel
summary: As airports worldwide face increasing demands for Sustainable Design, efficiency, and seamless passenger experiences, San Francisco International Airport (SFO) serves as a forward-thinking example of how data-driven design and emerging technology is transforming aviation infrastructure. The decade-long projects involved a team of 100+ designers, 20+ consultants, and a sophisticated technology approach of 20+ digital tools, bringing together architects, engineers, and contractors in a connected tech environment driving efficiency through construction. Explore how a leading architecture firm, in collaboration with industry partners, used BIM, sustainable strategies, cloud collaboration, data-driven design, and data visualization to enhance operational efficiency and passenger experience, and future-proof major terminals. Gain insights into how connected workflows, predictive analytics, and immersive tools were used to optimize passenger flow, reduce carbon impact, and streamline stakeholder collaboration.

title: Dynamo Plus Autodesk Forma Lab: Uncovering Cloud Automation, Integration, & Customization
summary: Dynamo, Autodesk Platform Services, Forma, Construction Cloud… what do all of these have in common? They’re now closely coupled together where the Dynamo Service powers up Forma, enabling you to work with Dynamo content from anywhere, even a Mac. All you need is a browser! Game change? Absolutely. Worth exploring? You bet! Come join us, as we take you on a journey through Dynamo and Forma in a hands-on lab, allowing you to find out for yourself, step by step, exactly how these two powerful applications talk to each other and how you too can develop Dynamo graphs. We’ll explore how they’re connected today, how to pull data from Forma into Dynamo, and how to visualize and query aspects of Forma. We’ll cover how to work with the DynamoForma node package and explore different sample graphs that paint a picture across data, visualization, analysis, and geometry. And we’ll show you how to share your graphs with your peers. You’ll leave this class armed with the skills you need to create your own graphs that supercharge Forma.

title: Exploring the Dynamo Product Road Map and Vision for the Future
summary: This product briefing will showcase the latest advances in the Dynamo ecosystem, and dive into our new North Star and future vision that’s shaping where we head next. Come learn from Autodesk’s Dynamo product managers about where they’ve been focusing their efforts. This briefing will explore the growth and improvements in Dynamo this year, diving deeply into what has changed and why it matters. We’ll touch upon impactful customer use cases and shed light on Dynamo’s new direction. By strengthening the base, building a cloud-native future, and embracing AI, Dynamo will transform computational design. All these changes seek to dramatically shift the ability for you to have more impact with Dynamo, supercharging your workflows today and tomorrow. Come join us and explore our vision for the future of Dynamo and the steps we’ve both taken and will take to make it a reality.

title: From Data to Intelligent Automation, Integration, & Customization: Building Trusted AI Pipelines for Outcome-Based BIM
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming how we design and deliver construction projects. But real innovation begins with data. This session will offer a strategic and technical road map to scaling AI-driven design pipelines for outcome-based BIM, using tools like Autodesk Platform Services. We’ll explore how structured data pipelines, intelligent agents, and modular architectures enable the generation, enrichment, and validation of intelligent models by integrating geometry, constraints, and regulatory metadata. You’ll gain a practical framework for implementing secure, transparent, and scalable workflows that support real-time consistency checks, compliance tracking, and iterative refinement. We’ll also examine how AI impacts productivity, costs, and timelines, while addressing the legal, regulatory, and ethical implications of automating design. Aimed at decision makers, this session will show how AI can augment human expertise, with outcomes driving the model, to support business-aligned innovation in design and construction.

title: The Adoption of Autodesk Construction Cloud: Integration in the Design and Construction of Climate-Resilient Infrastructure
summary: Build Health International (BHI) is designing and constructing health care facilities in locations that face significant threats from climate change and its impact on rising rates of disease and lack of accessible facilities during intensifying and unpredictable weather events. Using sustainable design strategies and the integration of technology, BHI aims to improve climate resiliency and maximize efficiencies to enable continuous care delivery and sustainable operations. This case study will examine the adoption of a common data environment that integrates and connects teams across the project lifecycle. Showcasing project examples from complex and low-resource environments will highlight how the team uses technology to improve global collaboration, reduce risks, and maximize efficiency—from design through operations that incorporate resilient design and construction methods to create efficient spaces that could withstand heavy rains, hot temperatures, and unreliable energy sources.

title: Beyond Energy Modeling: Next Generation Insight and the Future of Total Carbon in Revit
summary: With the retirement of Autodesk Insight software, the new Autodesk Next Generation Insight software brings unprecedented clarity to operational and embodied carbon in a single cloud-based platform—at no additional cost to Revit subscribers. This session will explore how this new toolset changes the way we model and analyze building performance. You’ll learn how to create an accurate energy analysis model (EAM), define HVAC systems, and manage carbon benchmarks across both embodied and operational carbon dimensions. The talk will highlight critical workflow updates, new metrics, and best practices that allow designers and engineers to make data-informed  decisions earlier and more confidently in their project timeline. Next Generation Insight represents not just an upgrade, but a whole new way of thinking about carbon in the BIM workflow.

title: Autodesk Data Models Brought to Life: Using GraphQL to Implement Real-World Data Connectors
summary: As Autodesk shifts to platform thinking, GraphQL is the choice for a developer-friendly alternative to a REST API. Our GraphQL APIs enable customers to work across the many data sources for their projects—whether buildings for construction, manufactured components, or assets in a media production. And there should be a common solution for data access when working with the rich, granular data stored in these Autodesk Data Models and Data Exchanges. This presentation will be a case study of how GraphQL was used to build data connectors between Autodesk’s platform and third-party applications. Our engineering team collaborated with System Integrators to produce several connectors—for Microsoft’s Power BI and Power Automate, and Autodesk Dynamo. Each connector shared common and unique integration challenges. We’d like to share our journey of discovery that resulted in customer utility and reveal how we brought the Autodesk Data Models to life through successful integration use cases.

title: Engineering Efficiency Unleashed: Hands-On Synera Training
summary: This workshop will introduce engineers to Synera’s process automation capabilities through hands-on implementation. You'll create automation solutions for common engineering workflows that reduce manual tasks and eliminate repetitive processes. Through guided exercises and real-world scenarios, you'll configure Synera to streamline documentation creation, automate design validations, and create intelligent workflows tailored to your requirements. We’ll show you how to integrate Synera with your existing solutions, including Inventor software, Autodesk Fusion 360 software, Moldflow, NAVASTO, and more.

title: Revolutionizing 3D Model Workflows with AI: APS Autodesk Assistant and Arcadis OTL Optimizer
summary: Discover how advanced artificial intelligence (AI) technology is streamlining 3D-model workflows through joint development between Autodesk and Arcadis. This session will introduce the integration of the beta Autodesk Assistant API (in Autodesk Platform Services) with Arcadis’s OTL Optimizer tooling to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of design and construction processes. Learn how AI automates the identification, extraction, and tagging of data within 3D models, reducing manual effort by up to 90%. Explore advanced capabilities, including data and model quality validation, intelligent adjustments, and the generation of cost and  insights directly from your models. Gain valuable insights into how AI-powered automation is driving productivity, improving decision making, and fostering more-sustainable project outcomes. Join us to see how these innovations are redefining the future of digital workflows in the built environment.

title: Meet the Leaders Behind Autodesk Data Models: The Data Foundation for the Autodesk Design and Make Platform
summary: About $2 trillion, that’s the amount of money the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry lost due to bad data—data that is inaccurate, inaccessible, and incomplete. In the industries Autodesk serves, data is a critical lifeline for project decisions and automations. But all too frequently, that data is not easily accessible, or, even worse, the available data is simply bad. Across the globe, the ability to use data in an insightful manner is no longer a nice-to-have. It has become a primary source of competitive advantage. Furthermore, with acceleration of artificial intelligence (AI), the need for data is increasing exponentially. Those who use their data to make informed decisions and gain performance insights will ultimately emerge as leaders in their industries. Meet the leaders behind the industry data models to learn more about how Autodesk will solve top customer problems.

title: Design to Fabrication: Seamless Modular Construction Modular Construction—DuBox Case Study with Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: This session will showcase how modular construction leaders DuBox and DuPod are revolutionizing project delivery by using Build software and Construction Cloud—with QR-coded, data-driven workflows throughout the entire lifecycle. Starting with AI-assisted design, participants will see how design teams generate multiple layout and system options, instantly visualized in 3D models and analyzed through Power BI dashboards to reveal quantities and costs—empowering faster, smarter decisions early in the process. In manufacturing, each module and component is tracked using the Asset feature in Build. QR codes are assigned to every asset, linking physical elements to their digital counterparts.

title: OpenAPI Unleashed: Powering AI Agents and Low-Code Automation, Integration, & Customizations with Autodesk Platform Services.
summary: OpenAPI specifications are more than just a developer convenience—they’re a strategic asset. In this session, see how Autodesk Platform Services’ OpenAPI specs can be used to generate SDKs across languages with Microsoft Kiota, build connectors for Power Automate with minimal effort, and even serve as the foundation for AI agents that interact with Construction Cloud data in real time. Whether you’re building internal tools, automations, or intelligent assistants, learn how OpenAPI can become the backbone of your integration strategy.

title: Equip AI with Access to Your Design Data and Projects: Model Context Protocol & Autodesk Platform Services
summary: Large language models are great at answering questions, and even acting on your behalf, but only if they have access to the right data and tools. In this session, you’ll learn how to give LLMs secure, structured access to your design data and projects using the Model Context Protocol and Autodesk Platform Services. We’ll give an overview of MCP, explore its growing ecosystem, and walk you through the process of building a custom MCP server connected to APS.

title: Digital Prototyping Summit | Welcome + Strategic Planning for Management: Lessons from Motherson SAS
summary:
Stephen Hooper opens the Summit to share how Autodesk is shaping the factory of the future through Digital Workplaces, AI-driven simulation, and open data models.

Then, Stephen invites representatives from Motherson SAS on stage to share their organizational strategy for in the factory. CEO Frederic Boumaza and CIO Praveen Chinta will discuss their approach to planning, deploying, and maintaining a Digital Workplace, and how they included business stakeholders and technology in the decision-making process. Using Autodesk Platform Services (APS), Inventor, and FlexSim, they have implemented solutions for building optimization, production optimization, and real-time monitoring, leading to outcomes like increased energy efficiency, reduced downtime, and improved production flexibility.

title: The Productivity Gap: Rethinking Skills in the Age of AI
summary: For years, manufacturing has focused on the idea of a skills gap—the belief that we need more people trained to perform traditional tasks. But what if that assumption is limiting progress? What if the real challenge is a productivity gap—the growing difference between what skilled people are capable of and what current systems allow them to do? In this session, Al Whatmough, CEO of Toolpath, will explore how artificial intelligence (AI) and automation can shift the role of humans on the shop floor. Instead of replacing people, the opportunity is to empower them, automate the mundane, elevate decision making, and redesign work around human strengths. This session will spark a lively discussion about the future of manufacturing work. What roles will evolve? What skills will truly matter? And how can we build tools, workflows, and cultures that help people do their best work? Join the conversation and help shape what comes next.

title: Innovators Stage | From Disaster Recovery to Future-Ready Design: Building on a Legacy of Innovation, Resilience, and Management
summary: WAM & Autodesk have built a worldclass partnership centred on technology, resilience, & innovation in the built environment. AU23 AECO Keynote showcased how our collaboration shaped the recovery of Christchurch. Heke Rua Archives represents the next evolution: a proactive, future-ready design model, integrating cutting-edge seismic resilience, Digital Workplace technology, & cloud-based infrastructure to futureproof our national taonga for 100yrs. This isn’t about recovery; it’s about anticipating, designing for, & adapting to the challenges ahead. The WAM Autodesk partnership began with a response to disaster—but now, we have the opportunity to design for the future before disaster strikes through technology driven design and operations. Heke Rua Archives is the platform to elevate our collaboration, demonstrating how AI, Digital Workplaces, BIM, and cloud technology can create a new paradigm for resilience, , and cultural preservation.

title: Lightning Fast, Deeply Green: How AI’s Transforming Sustainable Design in AEC
summary: are transforming sustainable design in the AEC—not just by assisting, but by accelerating and automating core environmental analysis tasks. Today, bespoke machine learning models can simulate complex climate factors like solar exposure, lighting performance, wind comfort, and embodied carbon with unprecedented speed—cutting simulation times by up to 99% compared to traditional methods. These AI-driven tools allow teams to run high-fidelity analyses in real time, enabling rapid iteration and better design outcomes from the earliest project stages. We’ll also look at how generative tools and intelligent code assistants are offering informed suggestions—optimizing building performance, ensuring code compliance, and integrating seamlessly into daily workflows. Real-world case studies will highlight how these technologies are driving a fundamental shift toward smarter, greener, and faster decision-making across the AEC industry

title: Reduce Up to 60% Lead Time with an AI-Driven Process: Comfortable Restroom Design with Innovative Workflows
summary: This session will be an introduction to a sustainable workflow initiative that uses the power of artificial intelligence (AI) to reduce lead times from the design phase to construction by up to 60%. Building upon the success of A-SPEC (the existing automated restroom design cloud service) initially introduced during AU 2021, we proudly introduce "A-SPEC Plus,” our newest generation of design process that uses the latest AI algorithms. The inclusion of advanced AI in this upgrade allows for the creation of restroom layouts/plans that prioritize user comfort and spacious designs. In addition to the plan proposals created based on the new design logic, A-SPEC Plus significantly reduces lead time from design to construction with very little input by using the capabilities of Construction Cloud and Autodesk Platform Services. Potential applications of this technology extend far beyond restroom design. It also offers a scalable automated design solution for various building spaces and interior designs.

title: Beyond Dumping Files and Folders: Transforming Autodesk Construction Cloud to Adopt ISO 19650 Workflows
summary: The construction industry generates an estimated 2.5 quintillion bytes of data daily, yet most organizations struggle to make sense of this information. Construction Cloud (ACC) unifies project data, ensuring teams speak a common language by transforming into an intelligent Common Data Environment (CDE). In this hands-on lab, participants will configure ACC as an ISO 19650 compliant CDE by setting up naming conventions, creating multi-step reviews, and implementing trigger-based workflows for automated file review processes. The session will also cover folder structure configuration, access permissions, version control, and embedding metadata like status codes. Finally, participants will explore how to leverage ACC Issues for consistent Quality Assurance (QA) workflows across 2D/3D documents, ensuring effective information delivery.

title: Designing Resilient Communities: Leveraging Forma Simulations for Environmental Livability
summary: How can urban design decisions shape the livability and resilience of communities? This session explores how Forma can simulate and optimize environmental factors such as daylight access, green space integration, and the role of vegetation in reducing heat and noise. Attendees will learn how to create and compare design scenarios to visualize the environmental impacts of human-centric planning while integrating data overlays for deeper insights. By combining AI-powered tools with innovative workflows, this session highlights how technology can unlock new possibilities for designing communities that thrive in the face of climate and urbanization challenges.

title: Conversational BIM: From Prompts to Projects
summary: Traditional BIM workflows demand technical expertise, often excluding those without specialized training. This session will introduce a new approach that integrates large language models (LLMs), such as ChatGPT, into architectural design to simplify BIM generation. By using natural-language commands, users can generate architectural models in tools like Revit software without relying on sliders, scripts, or detailed software knowledge. We’ll demonstrate a working prototype that translates everyday instructions—such as, “create a two-story apartment with eight rooms”—into editable BIM elements. This talk will explore how artificial intelligence (AI) can bridge the gap between language and design, opening BIM access to architects, developers, and even nonexperts. Join us to rethink the future of modeling—from clicking to conversing.

title: Architecting with Steel: Design Large, Complex 3D-Printed Structures leveraging Fusion!
summary:
Meet "The Brænch"—an organic 3-meter-high steel structure fabricated with advanced 3D printing technology. This class showcases how our cross-disciplinary team used Fusion to unlock novel design workflows and create unique architectural elements that are 3 times cheaper than if they were die cast.
We'll demonstrate why architects should consider adding Fusion to their toolbox for generative design, optimization, and FEA simulation to move beyond certain limitations of Rhino/Grasshopper. Through detailed examples, we'll present an integrated workflow improving material efficiency and structural performance in large-scale metal components.
The class targets architects first approaching manufacturing, practically demonstrating how to align design with fabrication requirements, opening possibilities for applications such as façade components and structural elements while leveraging additive manufacturing to tackle material transportation, construction cost, and supply chain challenges.

title: Unlocking the Future of Architectural Design with Autodesk Forma: Democratizing Environmental Simulations and Urban Design in Japan
summary: This case study will explore the transformative impact that Forma software has on environmental simulations and urban design, empowering designers to reclaim tasks that have traditionally relied on specific experts or skilled individuals. Using Forma, we’ve achieved remarkable milestones, including a 400% increase in implementation projects, a tenfold expansion in the diversity of simulations, and an 80% cost reduction. These advancements are “democratizing simulations,” making them accessible to a wider range of designers. Additionally, we’ve customized libraries and workflows to align with Japan-specific regulations, resulting in a 300% increase in implementation projects and a reduction in the lead time for initial outputs by a third. Through innovative application of Forma, designers have experienced significant improvements in both the scope and speed of their work. In this session, we’ll share detailed insights into our workflow, the challenges we’ve faced, and the solutions we’ve developed.

title: Digital Builder Podcast Featuring Jeevan Kalanithi and Michael Fleischman
summary: Jeevan Kalanithi, CEO and Co-founder of OpenSpace, and Michael Fleischman, CTO and Co-founder of OpenSpace, join the Digital Builder Podcast to discuss the evolution of reality capture and spatial AI in the AEC industry.

title: Crafting Your Own Rabbit Bell: Integrating Seamless MCAD and ECAD in Autodesk Fusion
summary: When friends reminisce about the 70s, 80s, and 90s, receiving a musical greeting card for their birthdays was truly a joyful experience. Gently unfolding the paper card to hear the Happy Birthday song was a simple yet delightful pleasure. Even after the birthday, revisiting the heartfelt wishes written by friends while listening to the melody brought back cherished memories, often accompanied by a smile. These moments are among the beautiful memories of that era. Inspired by these nostalgic thoughts, why not create a DIY mini rabbit bell and bring it back to home to share with others about the special moment from Autodesk University? Fusion is excellent for seamless integration of MCAD and ECAD. In this 90-minute class, you will craft your very own Rabbit Bell from scratch using Fusion. You could bring one Rabbit Bell PCB board back to home.

title: Autodesk Product Lifecycle Management Hands-On Test Drive
summary: Get a greater understanding of how businesses can unlock the full potential of Autodesk Fusion Manage Extension  in our immersive hands-on workshop designed for those who are eager to enhance their knowledge of what PLM can offer. This workshop aims to provide you with an in-depth understanding of the powerful Fusion Manage Extension features and tools, enabling you to streamline your workflows and optimize your business processes. In this introduction to Fusion Manage Extension, you’ll gain a comprehensive overview of Fusion Manage Extension and its key functionalities. This workshop is ideal for those who want to learn more about the power of PLM or want to get hands-on with the technology.

title: The Future of Product Design with Inventor Professional
summary: Join this session as we share the development road map and product strategy for Inventor Professional software, including some elements of the Autodesk Product Design & Manufacturing Collection. The presentation will cover recent and planned functionality that will add value to your everyday workflow needs. We encourage you to engage with Dan and members of the Inventor engineering team with questions and feedback during and after the session.

title: Move Over Large Language Models; Make Way for Industry
summary: This session includes discussions and Autodesk machine learning experts for both AECO and Manufacturing industries. The huge advances we have seen in large language models are due to extremely large deep-neural networks’ ability to infer statistical patterns in large amounts of digital data. The industries where we design and make the world that surrounds us also have well-defined and consistent digital data. What would the implications be for how we design and create the world if we enhance them with appropriate and trusted AI solutions?

title: Shipshape 2.0: Smarter Standards and Leaner Layers with AI in AutoCAD
summary: Following the success of "Housekeeping in AutoCAD—Keeping Those Drawings Shipshape!" at AU 2023, this advanced session will dive deeper into best practices for keeping your AutoCAD environments clean, lean, and agile—with a new twist: using tools powered by artificial intelligence (AI). Join Shaun "CADjedi" Bryant (Autodesk Expert Elite and Autodesk Certified Instructor) to learn how to automate standards compliance, eliminate drawing clutter faster, and create dynamic layers and annotations using smart commands and features. Explore how AI features in AutoCAD are revolutionizing housekeeping tasks, from cleaning up files to maintaining company CAD standards. Whether you're a CAD manager or a daily user, you'll walk away with practical techniques and time-saving workflows that go beyond the basics—keeping your drawings shipshape and Bristol fashion!

title: Innovators Stage | AI for Design: What's Now and What's Next
summary: Dr. Tonya Custis, senior director of artificial intelligence (AI) at Autodesk, draws on 20 years of experience in AI research to explore both the limitations and the transformative potential of AI in design workflows. While powerful, AI is often misunderstood—it’s frequently perceived as a catch-all magical solution rather than a tool with specific strengths and weaknesses. As AI becomes more commonly used in daily life, expectations rise for its role in professional tools. The best way to move beyond the hype, fear, and uncertainty surrounding AI is to develop an understanding of its history, limitations, and the types of tasks it’s best suited to help with. In this session, Dr. Custis will demystify how AI actually works, examine current trends, and outline the unique challenges of applying AI to design workflows—particularly those involving complex 3D design data. She’ll also share some recent work from the Autodesk AI Lab, offering a glimpse into the current state of AI in design and what the future may hold.

title: AECO Roadmap: Vision and Strategy
summary: The AECO industry is evolving—fast—and Autodesk is evolving with it. In this session, we’ll take a step back from individual products and zoom out to show how our full portfolio is coming together to support more connected, sustainable, and resilient design and construction practices. From early-stage planning in Forma to Digital Workplaces in Tandem, from vertical to horizontal infrastructure, this session will connect the dots across disciplines, workflows, and platforms. Whether you’re an architect, engineer, contractor, or owner, this is your opportunity to understand the full picture of Autodesk’s AECO strategy and how it all fits together.

title: AECO Roadmap: MEP
summary: Designing and delivering high-performance buildings is more complex—and more collaborative—than ever. In this session, Autodesk product leaders will preview the latest updates and what’s ahead for MEP engineers, detailers, and fabricators across Revit, the AEC Collection, and Autodesk’s cloud collaboration tools. From enhanced modeling workflows to -focused features and AI-powered design assistance, this roadmap session offers a look at how Autodesk is evolving its tools to better support multidisciplinary coordination and project efficiency. Bring your voice—we’ll share what’s coming and listen to what you need next.

title: Autodesk Platform Services APIs: Meet the Experts
summary: Ask your programming and business questions to a panel of hardcore cloud and mobile experts from our software development teams. If you're writing solutions based on these technologies or just about to start and want to know more, this is the perfect forum to get to know the people who create the APIs and services you work with, as well as your fellow programmers who use those APIs. Ask questions, add your expertise to the discussion, or listen and learn.

title: Automating Process Optimization with AI: The FlexSim Optimizer and Live Digital Prototypings
summary: Process bottlenecks and related issues often require complex and dynamic solutions. Discover how FlexSim recommends process improvements from live data, and see how the FlexSim OptQuest optimization engine solves multidimensional problems. OptQuest uses machine learning to evaluate multiparameter input groups in order to strategically determine optimal outcomes across various performance objectives. This method provides faster and more intelligent solutions to intricate problems than manual techniques do. In scenarios with constantly evolving operational inputs, FlexSim can be configured as a live Digital Workplace, continuously operating at set intervals, and using live data streams based on system feedback and artificial intelligence (AI) predictions. This approach necessitates specific model programming, which we will explore. By implementing these advanced techniques, businesses can significantly improve their process optimization capabilities, addressing complex challenges more effectively than traditional methods allow.

title: C>E>M>P>S: Master the BOM Lifecycle Efficiently with PLM
summary: Manufacturing companies often face challenges when transforming key product information, particularly the bills of materials (BOMs). Starting with a CAD BOM, an initial engineering BOM is created and shared with downstream processes. This BOM undergoes several transformations: first to a manufacturing BOM, then to a process BOM, and finally to a service BOM. Managing these BOMs and their transformations within a single PLM environment can significantly reduce errors, delays, and inconsistencies. PLM streamlines the entire process, enhancing efficiency and enabling automation. Join us to discover how a unified PLM system can seamlessly manage BOM transformations, ensuring accurate and timely updates across all stages. Understand how this integration supports better decision making and drives success in manufacturing operations.

title: Fully Integrated Production Workflow for Feature Films Through Autodesk
summary: This case study will provide a complete overview of the motion picture workflow process, using various Autodesk tools to facilitate the creation production from submitted script to final delivery of a motion picture film. Using Twisted Pictures recent feature Trust (2025), we will examine the process of guiding the film from preproduction through production and post production and to the final delivery of all materials to the distributor Paramount Pictures. The emphasis of this study is to consolidate all these aspects into one multitiered data management universe using various Autodesk tool sets, all fully integrated and managed by a streamlined team of department heads.

title: Minimizing construction risk through parametric tunnel design with Revit and ACC
summary: This session presents a real-world tunnel infrastructure project that leveraged parametric design to reduce construction risk and improve coordination. A parametric adaptive ring family, developed in collaboration with Autodesk, served as the base for a modular tunnel model in Revit. Using Dynamo, both primary and secondary structures were generated, and system layouts were added for space proofing. The model was then integrated into Construction Cloud to support cross-disciplinary collaboration between structure, MEP, and design teams. This connected workflow improved communication, reduced errors, and supported earlier decision-making. Attendees will discover a scalable strategy for managing complexity in linear infrastructure projects and see how parametric design helps create robust, coordinated models ready for execution.

title: Twinfinity and Beyond: Automating Digital Prototypings at Scale at the University of Florida
summary: As the land-grant university in Florida and an R1 research institution, the University of Florida (UF) has an extensive facilities inventory, with buildings ranging from the early 1900s to modern research facilities. With 500+ permanent or significant buildings totaling 30+ million gross square feet, it’s critical to have scalable solutions that combine existing systems and advanced technologies as we embrace Digital Workplaces, artificial intelligence (AI), and streamlined workflows. Using the power of Autodesk Platform Services and the Construction Cloud common data environment (CDE), UF has automated the creation of Tandem Digital Workplaces, which are fully connected to critical systems—including BAS streaming and back population of time series data, space management, and work management for assets, work history, and costing. Links are embedded in UF systems to facilitate easy access to Tandem from multiple entry points. Automating the manual effort involved in standing up twins has allowed us to focus on what matters: accurate models and timely data.

title: Digital Doppelgängers: The Truth Beneath the Model
summary: Have you ever wondered what’s under the hood of a Digital Workplace? Most are familiar with intelligent models as they pertain to the design and construction process, but where and at what point does metadata from an intelligent model merge with live data streams from Internet of Things (IoT) devices and other software integrations? In this session, we will dig beneath the 3D visuals commonly seen and look at the mechanics of a Digital Workplace—how it’s designed, how it’s built, and how it all works in concert. Participants will walk away from our session with a better understanding of how the merging of these two environments is possible through the journey of a project lifecycle. We’ll give an in-depth overview of how Aptitude | Intelligent Integration has tied together the latest tools of the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry with innovative technologies and integrations to use asset management and  goals that owners are looking for to get the smart building overlay they desire.

title: Data Continuity in the Chaos: A Modern Owner’s Approach
summary: This class will explore how owners manage data structure and ensure seamless data flow between lifecycle models, Tandem software, and various CMMS systems. We’ll dive into the workflows, tools, and quality control methods that help maintain data relevance, accuracy, and visibility throughout a building’s lifecycle. As buildings undergo constant change—sometimes with portions occupied while other areas are under construction—how can owners prevent data from falling through the cracks? How do they preserve reliable sources of truth across systems? And how do they understand when to retire the assets no longer in use. We’ll be sharing the lessons learned and best approaches. We’ll also examine what structured data means to an owner in terms of value for facility operations, finance, occupant experience, and achieving  goals. Finally, we’ll discuss strategies for bringing the not-so-rich / accurate models across the finish line to add to the expanding portfolio of great Digital Workplaces.

title: Why Digital Prototyping Integrations Fail: Building a Data Model for Operational Success
summary: Digital Workplaces often fail not because of technology, but due to misalignment between data and operational reality. In this session, we’ll explore what goes wrong when Digital Workplaces are handed over to FM teams, and we’ll present a tested solution: a facility template and data model built for real-world operations, with a focus on  and insights enabled by artificial intelligence (AI). Developed using Tandem software and integrated with Planon, the template supports both short- and long-term operational needs. You’ll learn how we moved beyond COBie by using data models to define information requirements that support lifecycle management, while ensuring  metrics are captured and used for AI-driven decisions. We’ll also examine why Digital Workplaces are disruptors, highlighting knowledge gaps, process flaws, and data ownership issues. This session will provide a framework to rethink how you capture, structure, and deliver building data—not just for project closeout, but for long-term operational value.

title: Shift Left: Applying Manufacturing Discipline to AEC
summary:
What if the AEC industry could build it right the first time—every time? By learning from manufacturing, it can.

In this session, Manuel Liedot, CEO of Graitec, and Emmanuel Leroy, EVP of Graitec Solutions, will explore how Graitec is helping AEC professionals “shift left”—bringing simulation, constructability, and data intelligence earlier in the design process. This approach minimizes rework, shortens project timelines, and improves overall outcomes.

With deep roots in both manufacturing and AEC, the speakers will demonstrate how Graitec’s strategy is transforming traditional workflows. Through real-world case studies featuring Graitec tools like Advance Steel, StrucSoft, Rebar Detailing, Simulate, and Revit integrations, attendees will see how early-stage insights lead to smarter execution.

You'll walk away with a blueprint for moving from reactive problem-solving to proactive planning—designing with construction in mind from day one.

title: Autodesk Workshop XR: Leading the Next Wave of Design and Collaboration
summary: Traditional structural reviews, especially for complex projects, often struggle to convey spatial complexities and foster true collaboration. Autodesk Workshop XR is Autodesk’s groundbreaking virtual reality (VR) platform seamlessly integrated with Construction Cloud—and it is designed to overcome these barriers. This session will show how Thornton Tomasetti came to use Autodesk Workshop XR and is transforming structural engineering workflows. Learn how to conduct instant, immersive design reviews directly from Construction Cloud models, fostering real-time collaboration among engineers, architects, contractors, and owners in a shared virtual space. We’ll explore how this enhances communication, accelerates the identification of structural challenges in renovations, and streamlines issue tracking directly within VR back to Construction Cloud. Through practical examples and live demonstrations, discover how the Autodesk solutions deliver tangible benefits, such as reduced errors, cost savings, and, ultimately, more-successful building projects.

title: Spinning up Your Servers Faster:  The Data Center Industry Meetup
