summary: Please join us at our meetup focused on discussing the latest trends, opportunities, challenges, and learnings in the data center industry across the ecosystem.  We plan to have a mix of data center owners, general contractors, specialty contractors, and equipment suppliers on hand to foster a rich discussion and industry networking on how to help support all ecosystem players to build faster, smarter, and more resilient data center capacity to meet the new challenges of AI and evolving business and consumer demand.

title: Optimizing AEC Workflows with Autodesk Construction Cloud and Workato Automation, Integration, & Customizations
summary: This session will explore Construction Cloud, and Workato’s Construction Cloud integration, enhancing project efficiency and accuracy through automation. Using a real-world example from Sener’s metro line extension project in Canada, custom Workato recipes streamline file sharing and deliverable management. Automations include batch file renaming, transferring files across complex folder structures based on metadata, and integrating SharePoint with Construction Cloud. These innovations improve collaboration between Sener and its customer, leading to smoother workflows, time and cost savings, and better control over project data. The session will showcase automations simplifying project management processes by automatically renaming and organizing files using custom attributes and internal review and bridge workflows. Construction Cloud (Workato) tools reduce manual effort and minimize errors. Notably, the savings in this project are estimated to exceed 5,000 hours per year.

title: XR Meetup: Dive into the future of Extended Reality
summary: Join the 4th Annual XR Meetup for dynamic discussions and networking with Autodesk XR team members, customers, partners, and AEC community colleagues. This casual gathering is perfect for anyone passionate about immersive technology. Dive into conversations about the future of XR in the building industry and explore the exciting possibilities of combining XR with AI for the . Connect with fellow XR enthusiasts, try cutting-edge products, and experience firsthand the innovations shaping XR's future in AEC. Be part of the movement that's transforming the industry!

title: Revit Support Clinic—Steel Structures and Connections: Troubleshooting and Learned Lessons
summary: Designing and coordinating steel structures in Revit software comes with particular challenges, from modeling issues to managing steel profiles and connection libraries. Based on experiences from real-life technical support cases, we’ll cover issues related to: modeling steel structures and connections, identifying and handling SQL issues, customizing and managing steel libraries, and coordinating steel models with other disciplines. We’ll also cover best practices when working with steel structures and connections in Revit projects. By the end of this session, you’ll walk away with practical solutions, workflow optimizations, and a deeper understanding of Revit features for steel structure modeling. Whether you're a structural engineer, BIM manager, or technical support specialist, this session will help you navigate and solve issues in Revit steel structures.

title: Navigating AI: Balancing Visionary Potential with Real-World Practice
summary: With groundbreaking innovation and a growing number of more advanced AI technologies around every corner of the AECO and MFG industries, it can sometimes be daunting to understand not only how, but where and more importantly when you should get started on tackling the onslaught of AI that can and likely will affect the workflow of many inside these industries. In this session, learn how the latest workstation technology from Lenovo, NVIDIA and Intel, industry trends and updates can transform the industry you work in, and get help demystifying buzz-word AI bingo vs. real-world workflows that your teams operate in every day

title: Reality Capture Unfiltered: How Industry Leaders Are Using AI to Reshape AEC with Digital Prototypings
summary: As AEC leaders race to digitize the built world, three forces are accelerating how projects are delivered - reality capture, artificial intelligence, and . This panel brings together technology leaders like Autodesk and Matterport, alongside industry leaders from Colliers Engineering & Design and DPR Construction, to explore how these technologies are converging to drive measurable impact across design, construction, and operations. You’ll hear how Digital Workplaces are being used to automate site documentation, support goals with accurate asset data, apply AI to flag issues, accelerate decision making, and improve coordination through cloud-based collaboration. Walk away with a clear view of how these companies are helping AEC teams future-proof their workflows and reduce environmental impact with data-driven insights.

title: Automating the Future with Build: Real-World ACC Applications on Dubai’s $2 billion mega exhibition facility & Palm Jumeriah
summary: Discover how cutting-edge construction technology is transforming project delivery in the Middle East.  This session will highlight the role of Construction Cloud (ACC) in streamlining data collection, enhancing transparency, and improving collaboration and analysis on site.  Gain insights into how Khansaheb Civil Engineering a leading UAE construction company is leveraging automation between CDEs on a $2 billion mega exhibition facility in Dubai and explore how data from its Palm Jumeirah projects is powering customized, automated dashboards, reports, and registers; tailored for both internal teams and external stakeholders.  Join us to learn practical strategies for using Power BI to align ACC-extracted data to overcome coordination bottlenecks, address operational challenges, and maintain clear, current, and concise reporting without the need for manual input.

title: Navigating Change in Construction Projects: A Hands-On Lab
summary: Have you ever faced unexpected changes in your project’s requirements after construction has begun? Of course you have. Change is inevitable in the construction industry. Join us for an exciting hands-on session that will illustrate how Autodesk Assistant, Build, and Cost Management in Build can drive efficiency and collaboration. Discover how referencing your Construction Cloud project’s data can streamline change management and improve project outcomes. In this lively and highly interactive lab, join Construction Cloud implementation veterans who will guide participants to explore the Construction Cloud platform’s integrated approach to site and cost change management. Why attend? Be guided through a completely connected workflow, handling projects on both desktop and mobile. Engage in dynamic activities designed to simulate real-world construction challenges.

title: Top Firms Share How to Use AI in Training to Close the Digital Skills Gap and Scale Knowledge Management
summary: Hear from top AEC firms, including Jacobs, Stantec, HDR, SLB, Tetra Tech, SSOE, and STV, as they share how they’re closing the digital skills gap using Autodesk’s 3-step framework from the 2025 Design & Make Report. Learn how AI-powered training, skills gap assessments, and embedded workflows drive tech adoption at scale. Discover the ROI: improved performance, reduced rework, stronger retention, and a competitive edge to win more bids. See how firms are leveraging AI in training to learn faster, retain more, and save time. Explore how custom learning paths and custom workflow training elevate information into knowledge management by curating and pinpointing the exact combination of external training materials with internal workflows—so teams get just enough, just in time, and just for me learning that’s applied to real-world projects.

title: From Data to Safety: Predicting Floods, Protecting Lives
summary: Floods are among the most devastating natural disasters. But what if we could predict them before they happened? Türkiye’s National Flood Forecast and Early Warning System (TATUS) is transforming disaster response by combining advanced hydrological modeling, meteorological predictions, and real-time . Built with InfoWorks ICM software and InfoWorks ICM Live, this groundbreaking system provides accurate flood forecasts up to 72 hours in advance, enabling authorities to take proactive measures and minimize damage. Discover how advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and geographic information system (GIS) technologies transform flood forecasting, from reactive crisis management to proactive risk mitigation. Through real-world case studies and technical insights, we’ll showcase how TATUS not only predicts flood events with remarkable precision, but also sets a new standard for national-scale environmental protection. Join us to learn how data-driven innovations are shaping a safer, more resilient future.

title: Don’t Just Follow the Tool. Lead the Workflow.
summary: Finding a platform that accommodates all of your needs is impossible. In this session, we, as an owner organization, are on a mission to make the impossible possible. We’ll walk through our real-world deployment of Construction Cloud, showcasing challenges we’ve faced and highlighting how automation and standardized processes have streamlined our workflows. At the Copenhagen Metro, we are shaping the cityscape through our large-scale infrastructure projects. To support scalable collaboration across our extensive network of consultants and contractors, we’re deploying customizations for Construction Cloud to accommodate our process needs.

title: AutoCAD Tips, Tricks, and the Most Stage-Ready Drafting Techniques
summary: If your hatches don’t have rhythm and your linework’s got the blues, it’s time to find your high note with the most stage-ready drafting techniques. In this toe-tappin’, line-snappin’, award-winning session, Autodesk Expert Elite Member and AutoCAD Blog author Donnie “The CAD Geek” Gladfelter will deliver techniques as smooth as a steel guitar and as sharp as a sheet set on deadline. With Smart Blocks that take the spotlight at just the right time and Connected Support Files that keep your drawings and setlist in perfect sync, this session will tune your workflow with chart-topping productivity secrets—sure to leave the AI-driven Autodesk Assistant asking for an encore. Whether you’re riding the neon rainbow of the latest AutoCAD features or digging into deep-cut tips only experts know, your drafting skills will shine like a Rhinestone Cowboy on tour.

title: Zero Paper, Full Control: Digitalizing Metro Design with Autodesk Docs
summary: The entire rail system design process is now managed digitally using Docs software. Instead of relying on traditional email-based file sharing and approvals, all stakeholders—including the client, consultant, and designer—collaborate in real time on a single digital platform. As a result, delays in approval phases have been significantly reduced, achieving up to 70% savings in paper usage and up to 30% time efficiency in past projects. For upcoming projects, the goal is to implement a fully digital, paperless workflow that boosts  and operational efficiency across the entire design phase.

title: The Great Data Migration: Conquering the Transition to Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Join us as we share our journey of migrating our 16-mile transit project from ProjectWise to Construction Cloud. Executing this switch in a pretty short window was a feat that offered enormous challenges. We'll walk you through our initial assessment of the current workflow and the unexpected insights that shaped our decision. Experience our planning process and the efforts we took to preserve our project’s integrity during and after migration. Meet the team we assembled and learn how their unique perspectives created our success formula. Finally, step into the switchover command center with us as we navigate the communications that turned potential chaos into a seamless transition. This isn't just our story—it’s a road map for your own successful migration adventure.

title: Reimagine Infrastructure Planning: Unlock Efficiency with Outcome-Based Generative Design
summary:
Early-stage infrastructure planning involves tight timelines and complex trade-offs—yet making the right decisions early is critical to a project’s success.

In this session, Infraspace Founder & CEO Andreas Kjølseth shows how outcome-based generative design can accelerate decision-making and improve results by enhancing familiar Autodesk workflows.

Kristoffer Bugge from Norconsult will share how one of the Nordics’ largest consultancies is applying Infraspace in real projects to boost productivity and deliver greater value to clients—using automated 3D model generation, instant analytics, and AI-powered optimization.

Join us to learn how generative design can help planners and engineers explore better options, faster—while integrating smoothly with Autodesk tools like Civil 3D, Navisworks, and Forma.

title: Smarter Drainage Design for a Resilient Future (Without Drowning in Data)
summary: Resilient infrastructure demands smarter design—especially as flood risks rise and environmental targets tighten. In this industry talk, we’ll explore how evolving regulatory and environmental challenges in the United Kingdom have shaped the way we approach surface water management on major infrastructure programs. In the past—while working with large, complex sites and multiple data-rich models—we’ve faced limitations in relation to integration, scale, and design flexibility. By transitioning to new approaches and tools such as InfoDrainage software, we’ve unlocked new efficiencies in design workflows, enabled spatial coordination, and better supported the delivery of sustainable, resilient systems. With case studies from recent UK projects, we’ll also touch on the integration of sustainable drainage systems (SuDS) and green infrastructure to meet climate goals and protect the environment. You’ll gain practical strategies for implementing more-intelligent, future-ready drainage designs—and you’ll get a few fresh perspectives along the way!

title: Inventor: Frame Generator—Multiframe Design Setup Made Easy
summary: In this class, you’ll discover multiple routes for generating Frame Generator Reference Files. And you’ll see how they can be integrated into top-level assemblies efficiently—where information from reference files can also be used to drive downstream design tasks where associativity between components and assemblies are important and change may occur throughout the design lifecycle. The class will also touch on new and updated workflows where model states and simplification tools can be used to manage assemblies and generate associative BIM-ready models, required by different or cross-industry design teams. This hands-on session is aimed toward the intermediate Inventor user. But it was developed for users who want to explore the Inventor Professional Frame Generator accelerator and its capabilities with high levels of associativity and parametric potential.

title: Intelligent Hole Machinist Unveiled: A Live Demo of Our Multiaxis, Machine-Aware Drilling Add-In for Autodesk Fusion
summary: Get an inside look at our multiaxis drilling add-in for Autodesk Fusion software. It automatically detects holes, groups them by orientation, and respects machine kinematics to optimize computer numerical control (CNC) workflows, including cross drilling and advanced parameter controls. This live demo will walk you through the entire process—from hole detection to final toolpath generation—showing how to reduce programming time, prevent collisions, and ensure consistent results. By automating repetitive tasks and adding safety checks that prevent unintended breakthroughs or hole intersections, shops have cut drilling cycle times by up to 40%. Whether you’re a CNC programmer, manufacturing engineer, or CAM enthusiast, this session will offer an exciting glimpse at how intelligent drilling automation can boost your productivity and profitability.

title: Hollywood Without the Travel: Building Virtual History with Digital Prototypings, SCAPEs, and Prop Scans
summary: When Fox Nation’s Revolutionary War docuseries called for A-list performances in historic American locations, GO delivered the future. Instead of flying talent across the country, GO recreated the Boston Tea Party and Mount Vernon as immersive SCAPEs using LiDAR, NeRF, and photogrammetry. In this panel, we’ll break down how GO brought Rob Lowe to a virtual Boston Harbor and Kelsey Grammer to a digital Mount Vernon—without ever leaving LA. From Sustainable Design and cost-savings to creative flexibility, this is a case study in Digital Prototyping production, Autodesk integration, and the new blueprint for high-end, low-impact filmmaking.

title: Driving Progress: Real-World Applications of Large-Scale Simulation and AI
summary: Discover how simulation and AI are transforming engineering in the built environment. This session explores how simulation-generated data powers AI, how digital engineering practices enable scale, and how strategic partnerships are accelerating adoption. Learn how to move from reactive workflows to intelligent, AI-driven design—while addressing real-world challenges like cost, safety, , and performance uncertainty. Ideal for AEC professionals, engineers, and innovation leaders looking to apply AI in practical, scalable ways.

title: Carbon Reduction Revolution in Japan by Unlocking Data Capability
summary: Since 2022, Daiwa House strives for “Digital Daiwa House,” enabling business-wide productivity and unlocking business value creation and innovation. As a part of our digital strategy, we worked on standardizing/structuring data to reach higher data maturity. It enables us to improve the lifecycle value of buildings. In this session, we will explain the evolution of data-driven design with a systemic approach to meet our goals and support carbon neutrality. The reduction of CO2 emissions in individual properties is critical to meet our objective: to evaluate all building designs by standardized/structured data models and methodologies. To achieve the goal, we developed ICT (Integrated Carbon Tool) with Autodesk Consulting, which allows individual designers to make decisions based on embodied carbon indicators. Through this journey, we identify more opportunities with the data strategy, data integrations, and industry-wide ecosystem to further increase business value.

title: From Routine to Insight: Automating Construction with Autodesk Construction Cloud and AI
summary: Are you concerned that you spend too much time on routine tasks and not enough on decision making? This session will provide a strategic overview of how we automate 20% of routine construction tasks by connecting Construction Cloud to our project database. We’ve built a platform to manage issues from design through inspection, streamline daily operations, and enable expert decision making via BI dashboards powered by granular data from Construction Cloud. Platform use cases include data aggregation via Bridge on Construction Cloud, model check dashboards with the Data Exchange and Validation Tool APIs, and circulation approval dashboards in projects. The Construction Cloud Meetings tool also embeds meetings into our workflows to manage follow-ups more efficiently. Over 100 projects already benefit from linking Construction Cloud with HR and construction data, and we aim to further scale this by automating 50% of routine site tasks using AI, while also integrating training and evaluation systems into the same platform.

title: From Design to Fabrication: Streamlining MEP Models with Cloud-Based Collaboration and Automation, Integration, & Customization
summary: Turning a design-stage MEP BIM model into a fabrication-ready (LOD 400) model using Fabrication MEP parts is one of the most critical and complex phases in the project lifecycle. Once IFC files and construction drawings are handed off, the responsibility shifts to general contractors and subcontractors to ensure constructability, meet engineering standards, and align with fabrication requirements. This session will demonstrate how Construction Cloud , AutoCAD or Revit with Fabrication MEP parts, curated MEP database sets, custom scripts and powerful add-ins enhance model refinement. You’ll discover how early modeling decisions reduce waste, improve rerouting, and accelerate field installation. By resolving fabrication needs in the model, teams reduce material use and empower crews with ready-to-build content. Whether you're a GC or MEP subcontractor working toward high-detail prefab, this session offers the tools to bridge design and construction empower by the cloud base tools.

title: Hands-On with Autodesk Build: Mastering the Field Mobile App
summary: Get ready to roll up your sleeves and explore Build software like never before in this interactive, lab-style session. Whether you're just getting started or looking to sharpen your skills, this in-depth walk-through will guide you through real-world workflows, tips, and tools—all in a collaborative, hands-on environment. You’ll also get hands-on experience with the Build mobile app, learning how to stay connected, manage tasks, and access project information from anywhere. Perfect for those who learn by doing and want to leave with practical knowledge they can apply right away—both in the office and out in the field.

title: From Bid to Build: Integrating BuildingConnected with Autodesk Construction Cloud for a Seamless Handoff
summary: This 20-minute session will explore how to create a streamlined, integrated workflow between BuildingConnected and Construction Cloud. Learn how bids submitted through BuildingConnected are automatically saved in Construction Cloud folders via Arkance’s custom cloud integration, eliminating manual steps and improving visibility. See how awarded bids connect directly into Cost Management, accelerating contract creation and linking  to construction operations. With centralized  and real-time data flow, this integration enhances collaboration, reduces errors, and speeds up project start-up. It’s perfect for  and operations teams looking to improve handoffs and maximize the value of their connected tools.

title: Spec-tacular AI: Streamlining Project Specs and Submittals with Specifications and AutoSpecs in Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Efficiently managing project specifications and submittals is often challenging. Construction Cloud provides a "spec-tacular" solution powered by artificial intelligence (AI). This session will reveal how the AI-powered AutoSpecs tool in the Construction Cloud platform automates precise submittal log generation. It seamlessly integrates results directly into the Submittals tool in Build software, significantly reducing manual entry and potential errors. We’ll also demonstrate how the Construction Cloud Specifications module simplifies publishing, ensures compliance with industry standards, and enables real-time spec updates across your project lifecycle. Additionally, you’ll discover how Autodesk Assistant AI transforms complex specifications into actionable insights, enhancing collaboration and productivity. Join us to explore how Construction Cloud spec modules and AI work together to optimize specification management, accelerate  processes, and deliver projects more effectively and accurately.

title: Big Builds, Bigger Data: Rosendin’s Playbook for Scaling Success with Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Curious how Rosendin, one of the largest electrical contractors in the United States, successfully implements Construction Cloud at scale across its enterprise? In this session, Rosendin will share its journey of deploying Construction Cloud solutions—including Docs, Build, and Autodesk Insights—to drive consistency, improve collaboration, and enhance productivity. Learn how Rosendin uses standardized templates and customized workflows to digitize critical processes. Beyond the Construction Cloud native tools, this session will also explore how Rosendin connects Construction Cloud data with enterprise systems using the Autodesk Platform Services APIs and Construction Cloud recipes. Discover how SQL-powered workflows automate data integration, reduce manual errors, and accelerate reporting cycles. Finally, see how Power BI dashboards transform raw project data into actionable insights, enabling faster, smarter decision making and measurable improvements in project outcomes.

title: Autodesk Construction Cloud Roadmap: Project and Cost Managment
summary: If leveling up your project or cost management workflows is a priority (and it totally should be), don’t miss this exciting session with the Build Product team. You’ll get a look at the newest features we’ve rolled out and a preview of what’s coming next for project management, cost management, and AI in Build. This session will offer a behind-the-scenes look at our product vision, the strategic initiatives driving innovation, and how customer feedback is directly influencing what we build next. From streamlined workflows to smarter cost tracking, we’re building the tools you need to stay ahead. Whether you're a power user or just getting started, you won’t want to miss this session!

title: From Chaos to Clarity: Integrating Construction and Cost Data Without Losing Your Mind
summary: At Miller-Davis Company, we set out to solve a frustrating and all-too-common challenge: the disconnect between project management and accounting systems. With Construction Cloud as our operational hub and Sage 300 as our financial backbone, we needed a way to unify data without burdening our teams with double-entry or constant reconciliation. In partnership with Autodesk and powered by Agave’s integration platform, we built a seamless connection that brings cost data into real-time alignment—bridging field and finance with minimal disruption. This session will walk you through our integration journey, including the strategy, implementation lessons, and how we’re planning to use connected data to drive clarity, accountability, and smarter decision making across our projects.

title: Parametric Design in Practice: Evolving from Civil 3D Object Automation, Integration, & Customization to Custom Dynamo-Driven Geometry
summary: As the infrastructure industry evolves, so must the tools we use. This session will introduce a game-changing approach to Civil 3D design by harnessing Dynamo—from automating repetitive tasks to creating smart, parametric geometry that can outperform traditional components. You'll learn how Dynamo connects with Civil 3D objects, and how simple scripts can boost productivity across project stages. We’ll explore the limitations of standard workflows and how Dynamo offers a flexible, rule-based alternative for intelligent infrastructure design. This case study will show how Dynamo can evolve from a basic automation tool to a powerful generative engine, enabling agile, scalable, and cross-disciplinary collaboration. We’ll wrap with real-world examples and provide a glimpse into how Python scripting extends Dynamo’s power for smarter, faster design outcomes.

title: Dynamo-Driven Automation, Integration, & Customization: Simplifying Hydraulic Modeling with InfoWorks ICM, InfoWorks WS Pro, and InfoAsset Manager
summary: In this live product demo, you’ll discover how to transform hydraulic modeling by eliminating the need for traditional ruby coding. We’ll showcase a powerful integration between Dynamo and the robust InfoWorks ICM and InfoWorks WS Pro platforms, where preconfigured drag-and-drop nodes replicate ruby methods. Throughout the session, participants will see how automation can dramatically reduce repetitive tasks, streamline workflows, and boost accuracy in hydraulic modeling. You’ll learn practical techniques to create custom automation workflows that cut manual coding and shorten project timelines—all while maintaining design precision. Whether you’re a seasoned professional or new to these tools, this demo will offer valuable insights to optimize your design processes and improve overall project efficiency.

title: The Future of CAD Management: How AI Is Transforming AutoCAD and Civil 3D
summary: CAD managers are facing a major shift. As artificial intelligence (AI) and automation tools become more accessible, the traditional role of CAD oversight is evolving into a leadership position focused on efficiency, strategy, and . In this session, we’ll explore how AI technologies—including ChatGPT for conversational assistance and script guidance, Autodesk Platform Services for seamless integration, and Dynamo for low-code automation—are reshaping CAD workflows in AutoCAD and Civil 3D software. You’ll learn how to automate tedious tasks, improve quality control, and better support project teams—all without needing to become a programmer. If you're ready to stop reacting and start leading, this session will show you the tools and mindset needed for the future of CAD management.

title: Eyes in the Sky, Intelligence on the Ground: Boosting Site Safety and Efficiency with Drones and GeoAI
summary: This session will explore how current drone imagery and GeoAI are transforming jobsites into smarter, safer, and more connected environments. Discover how leading firms like Brasfield & Gorrie are using drones to reduce utility strikes, identify hazards before they become accidents, and ensure real-time safety compliance. See how automated aerial data collection is being seamlessly integrated into CAD and geographic information system (GIS) environments—supercharging workflows in Autodesk Civil 3D software and beyond. We’ll showcase how GeoAI is merging spatial intelligence with design data to unlock faster decisions, greater transparency, and safer outcomes. Through compelling case studies, technical insights, and best practices, you’ll walk away with a playbook for putting aerial data and AI-driven insights to work. Don’t miss this interactive session packed with real-world examples, proven strategies, and a live Q&A.

title: From Days to Hours: How PEC Supercharged Digital Prototyping Delivery with Autodesk Tandem Connect and Autodesk Construction Cloud
summary: Imagine a platform that transforms multiday projects into just a few short hours, without compromising data quality—in fact, enhancing it. In the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry, the need for efficient integrated solutions has never been more critical. As projects grow in size and complexity, the challenge lies in delivering high-quality results within tight deadlines. Discover how PEC used Tandem Connect software to seamlessly synchronize Tandem Digital Workplace assets and their properties with Build software. This innovative process not only reduced manual effort from multiple days to mere hours, but it also ensured robust quality checks on final facilities management deliverables. By integrating with the owner’s facilities management software, Tandem Connect guarantees a streamlined and efficient workflow. Come to this session to experience the synergy of innovation and efficiency, and learn how to achieve maximum results with Tandem Connect and Build.

title: Driving Sustainable Building Lifecycle Management with Data, AI, and Digital Prototypings
summary: This session will explore how building lifecycle management (BLM) empowered by Digital Workplaces can transform  outcomes across design, construction, and operations. We’ll demonstrate how data-rich Digital Workplaces help stakeholders make better, faster decisions across the building lifecycle—from early planning to end of life. Using real-world examples and insights from the BLMI, we will highlight how artificial intelligence (AI) and connected data improve operational efficiency and asset performance and reduce carbon footprints. The session will feature a panel of experts from the architecture, engineering, and construction (AEC) industry and facility owners, offering diverse perspectives. You’ll learn how BLM—when supported by a structured Digital Workplace strategy—drives long-term value and aligns with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals. This session will benefit owners, AEC professionals, and facility managers looking to apply digital intelligence to create sustainable, resilient buildings

title: Unlocking the Power of Live Data: Simplifying Digital Prototyping Integrations with Autodesk Tandem Connect
summary: As buildings become smarter and the demand for real-time operational insight grows, integrating live data into Digital Workplaces is more critical—and more complex—than ever. Tandem Connect software is a powerful iPaaS solution purpose-built to bridge this gap. With its intuitive low-code/no-code interface, Tandem Connect enables the seamless integration into your Digital Workplace of Internet of Things (IoT) sensors, maintenance management systems, building management systems, and space management platforms—without requiring deep technical expertise. Designed for scalability and cloud deployment, Tandem Connect empowers facility managers, operators, and innovators to augment their Digital Workplaces with real-time data streams that drive awareness, optimize asset performance, and inform better decision making. In this session, you’ll see real-world use cases that show how organizations are using Tandem Connect to unify mission-critical systems and unlock actionable insights for smarter building management.

title: Break Rules with Autodesk Tandem: Conceptualizing a Schoolhouse with 80 Different Space Types
summary: In this session, we’ll showcase how to conceptualize 80 different schoolhouse space types to meet end-user demands. We’ll explore a case study of the Kanjoni Schoolhouse project, where we transitioned from traditional PDF/Excel space “cards” to a living, 3D relational model using Tandem and Revit software. In just four months, we moved from scattered reference material to a structured data set ready for contractor bidding. You’ll learn why we selected Tandem as the platform, how artificial intelligence (AI) helped us manage feedback and quality, and how a Digital Workplace can evolve from an operational tool into a continuous development platform. We’ll share lessons learned from our real-world innovative use case of Tandem—highlighting its role in driving transparency, collaboration, and future scalability. This talk is for those ready to challenge traditional workflows and see what happens when you intentionally break the "rules" to build something better.

title: New Whole-Building Performance Platform: Buildings AI—Developed Using AEC Data Model, Design Automation, Integration, & Customization for Revit, and APS APIs
summary: Data federation, amalgamation, validation, and collaborations among multiple stakeholders are critical for successful whole-building performance analysis projects. Buildings AI—powered by Autodesk’s innovative AEC Data Model software—addresses these challenges by providing consistent and granular data representations essential for collaborative workflows. Using Autodesk Platform Services Design Automation APIs, Buildings AI harnesses Revit System Analysis capabilities for building energy modeling and precise cooling load calculations—a whole-year energy analysis. This advanced browser-based SaaS solution allows HVAC designers to efficiently transition between projects in Revit, PDF, and AutoCAD Architecture drawings using agent-based AI workflows. Discover how Buildings AI can drive significant growth outcomes in the HVAC and energy modeling industries by delivering a rapid, user-friendly, and scalable tool designed explicitly for HVAC system optimization, regulatory compliance, and sustainable design outcomes.

title: Transforming Engineering with Autodesk Platform Services: A Comprehensive Enterprise-Level Deployment Strategy
summary: Learn about our holistic approach of deploying Autodesk Platform Services throughout a global engineering business, ensuring we have the right tools for the right tasks! We are transforming our organization, significantly increasing Autodesk Platform Services adoption through a multifaceted and targeted approach of solution development. We’ll explore our comprehensive Autodesk Platform Services strategy, which includes building user-friendly tools native to engineers, training programs, detailed documentation, and cohesive guidance. Learn about a diversified strategy of deploying Autodesk Platform Services solutions through Revit and Civil 3D add-ins, stand-alone web tools, a custom Dynamo library, and integrated workflows—all of which are empowering our engineers in various user groups. Understand each environment’s challenges and learn about tailoring tools to streamline workflows for efficiency and quality gains. We’ll also explore how we’re using artificial intelligence (AI) on top of our web-based Autodesk Platform Services applications, enabling innovative use of data for outcome-based design.

title: Sustainable Change Through Partnership: Delivering Data-Driven Transformation
summary: Join us to discover how Ramboll, a prominent multidisciplinary engineering firm, formed a partnership with Autodesk to drive sustainable change and  through innovative solutions, agile methodologies, and a strategy centered around data and an artificial intelligence (AI) platform. The "Together for Better Outcomes" initiative demonstrates the integration of Autodesk solutions—such as Construction Cloud, Civil 3D, Revit, Forma, and Datum360—across thousands of projects, ensuring user engagement and optimizing workflows. By employing digital change management principles and agile development methodologies, this strategy has successfully eradicated silos, standardized procedures, and created new revenue streams. Through this framework, Ramboll has developed custom solutions tailored to solve specific pain points in its workflows, enhancing the firm’s overall effectiveness and adaptability. These efforts are enabling Ramboll to deliver its vision of being the “Partner for Sustainable Change.”
